Title: Data Analyst
Description:
In het kort:

As an S&P Data Analyst within the Strategic Sourcing & Procurement (SS&P) team at ASML, you will play a crucial role in optimizing the cost of goods (CoG) for specific product families. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will organize cost management processes, conduct in-depth analyses, and support senior stakeholders to drive effective cost roadmaps.




Offer:

Competitive compensation package with relocation support if required.
Assistance with the 30% tax ruling process for international candidates.
Opportunities to work on cutting-edge technologies in a dynamic, innovative environment.
Professional development programs to enhance your skills and career.
A collaborative workplace with flexible working conditions.




Requirements:

A Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain/Logistics, or a related field.
2–6 years of relevant experience, preferably in supply chain or procurement.
Proficiency in data analysis and experience with SAP, Power BI, or Spotfire (preferred).
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal).
A proactive, self-starting attitude with the ability to thrive in a team-oriented environment.
Capacity to influence stakeholders at all organizational levels without direct authority.




Tasks:

Lead and organize Cluster Cost Carousels to align on CoG objectives and strategies.
Provide training and mentorship to Account Leaders on cost management processes.
Act as a trusted advisor for Senior Account Leaders, delivering deep-dive analyses on cost-related topics.
Identify cost-saving opportunities and drive these initiatives within the Cluster.
Interface with finance teams to ensure alignment on Cluster commitments and roadmaps.
Provide clarity and updates to senior Cluster Managers on CoG roadmaps and performance.
Continuously improve cost management processes and tools to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.




Join and take the lead in strategic cost management within a dynamic and innovative environment!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is one of the top tier financial institutions in the Netherlands, operating within (health) insurances, mortgages, pension and investments. The company is experiencing interesting years; they are amid of some major acquisitions and their ongoing IT transformation, migrating their environments/applications to the public cloud.




One of the pillars for the transformation is embracing a data driven strategy.

The company is rebuilding their data/analytics department and is currently building a team that will create a data mesh set-up for the company. The team will work in collaboration with different teams throughout the company, assisting them in creating valuable data insights. As an analyst you will work as an internal consultant, sparring with the different teams to see what data insights they need and helping them translate that to the correct variables to measue, configure their Dashboards properly and help them set=up effective usage. If things are done you will start the same puzzle again with the next team!

We are looking for data engineers who bring:

At least 5 years’ experience in IT/Data of which 3+ on Analytics.
Strong SQL skills and preferably some Python as well.
Excellent communicator and proactive person.
Strong experience with Dasboarding, PowerBI or similar.

So, are you looking to work in a team that is making in impact in a large and critical organization? Are you interested in the puzzle of Data Mesh, Dashboarding and Financial complexity? Please apply!

Salary: up to 75k

One of the pillars for the transformation is embracing a data driven strategy.

The company is rebuilding their data/analytics department and is currently building a team that will create a data mesh set-up for the company. The team will work in collaboration with different teams throughout the company, assisting them in creating valuable data insights. So, are you looking to work in a team that is making in impact in a large and critical organization? Are you interested in the puzzle of Data Mesh, Dashboarding and Financial complexity? Please apply!

Salary: up to 75k

Title: Youda - Data Analyst
Description:
Join us at Playtika (NASDAQ: PLTK), where we're driven by the belief life needs play. We’re on a mission to deliver infinite ways to play using cutting-edge technologies like AI and machine learning to craft immersive experiences that connect, inspire and entertain millions of players worldwide.

From our start as a small mobile games company founded in Israel to our current position as a publicly traded company and industry leader, we continue to be a dominant force in interactive entertainment. With a diverse portfolio of award-winning, category-leading Casual and Social Casino-themed games, including nine of the top 100 highest-grossing mobile games in the US, we're setting the standard for excellence.

Our success story is co-authored by a dynamic team of storytellers, strategists, creators and data scientists who thrive on innovation. We are home of the best, advancing an inclusive culture that embraces our core values and reflects our agile DNA.

With a strong financial foundation, disciplined operations, unwavering player-focused approach and relentless can-do spirit, we're well-positioned for sustained growth. If you're ready to join the driving force behind the evolution of interactive entertainment, we invite you to come play with us.

ABOUT YOUDA GAMES

We are growing! Therefore, we are looking for a talented BUSINESS ANALYST for our studio in Amsterdam. Better known as YOUDA GAMES. From our studio we supply the world with Governor of Poker 3 and Monopoly Poker.

We want users to have a fun time playing our games, it’s that simple. Making games our fans can’t stop playing is our goal. Our studio is loaded with motivated, talented and creative people that will make any possible effort to fulfill our promise. We are fast-paced, nimble and laugh a lot, at least we try to 😉

We work hard, but also prioritize our fun, collaborative and well-balanced culture.

ABOUT THE JOB!

Business Analytics Playtikans have a talent for identifying bottlenecks and areas of growth potential using their ANALYTICAL skills. And want to work at a growing international company with great perks and benefits.

Responsibilities:

As a Business Analyst you'll embark on an epic quest to wield data as your weapon and conquer the challenges of user engagement, growth, and monetization. You’ll join forces with our product managers and game makers to unlock the secrets of gameplay enhancement and user retention, all while enjoying the excitement of the gaming universe!

Last but not least you’re able to tell the data as a story and make it accessible through proper visualization for the rest of the studio.

Requirements:


5+ years of big data analytics, preferably for a web or mobile company, or in the online gaming industry
Extensive experience in SQL, including daily use and a deep understanding of window functions and partitions for advanced data analysis and reporting
Proven ability to create simple yet impactful visualizations that are intuitive, easy to interpret, and demonstrate strong attention to detail, ensuring clarity and effectiveness in communicating insights (preferably in Tableau)
Ability to work independently and deliver actionable insights and recommendations to support business decisions
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills to identify key trends and patterns in player data, with strong attention to detail
Great communication skills – someone who can translate complex data into actionable insights for stakeholders
A team player that can work effectively with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment


Nice to have’s:


Be a gamer yourself - genuine passion for video games and an understanding of what makes games fun and engaging for players
Experience with A/B testing in a live game/service environment, including results analysis and interpretation
Knowledge of statistics, predictive models and machine learning techniques (Python, R)


Here’s What We Offer You:


A challenging role in a diverse, international and fast-growing organization with lots of career opportunities
Hybrid ways of working between home and the office
A competitive monthly salary
Bonus incentive
Monthly Phone Allowance
Participation in our pension scheme
26 vacation days
6 powerup weekends
1 day off for your birthday
Lunch benefit
Christmas, Birthday & Special events gifts


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

If you feel the above describes you perfectly - Apply now!

Employee at Playtika? Click here - https://t.ly/6F9Q_
Show more

Here’s What We Offer You:

  • A challenging role in a diverse, international and fast-growing organization with lots of career opportunities
  • Hybrid ways of working between home and the office
  • A competitive monthly salary
  • Bonus incentive
  • Monthly Phone Allowance
  • Participation in our pension scheme
  • 26 vacation days
  • 6 powerup weekends
  • 1 day off for your birthday
  • Lunch benefit
  • Christmas, Birthday & Special events gifts

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

If you feel the above describes you perfectly - Apply now!

Employee at Playtika? Click here - https://t.ly/6F9Q_

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Specialist to join a dynamic Content Management team. This role focuses on supporting key areas such as Ratings & Reviews (R&R) and User-Generated Content (UGC) in an eCommerce setting. You'll work across both front-end and back-end functions to optimize how content is displayed, monitored, and validated.




Key Responsibilities




Collaborate on ideas, designs, and hypotheses to enhance features on the website and app.
Conduct A/B testing using tools like Optimizely Feature Experimentation and in-house analytics platforms.
Align with stakeholders to communicate updates and changes across various touchpoints.
Maintain and optimize dashboards in Looker Studio to provide insights on team performance.
Support processes for review and image submission validation using SQL and relevant tools.




Broader Initiatives:

Contribute to strategic projects, including transitioning to a headless CMS and improving content performance visibility.
Provide input on performance metrics, OKRs, and monitoring strategies for data-driven decision-making.







Essential Skills

Strong analytical skills and proficiency in SQL.
Knowledge of experimentation methods, including A/B testing.
Understanding of funnels and end-to-end processes in content workflows.
Stakeholder management experience with a collaborative approach.




Desirable Skills

Experience with GCP and BigQuery.
Proficiency in Python (Notebooks).
Familiarity with eCommerce environments.
An eagerness to learn and a strong team-player mentality.







What's in It for You?

This is an exciting opportunity to work on impactful projects in a cutting-edge digital environment, where your expertise will play a vital role in enhancing the customer experience.




Randstad area
Hybrid working - you must be located in Netherlands
ZZP or interim payroll
6 months contract (view to extend)
70-75 per hour or €5000 a month







If you have the skills, curiosity, and drive to excel in this role, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are a cutting-edge data AI/machine learning company specialising in the biomedical domain. Our mission is: Accelerating Time-To-Insights For Personalised Health Care. We empower individuals and organizations by providing near real-time health insights and analysis based on microbiome, proteome, epigenome and other biological data.




WEB: https://horaizon.ai




LINKEDIN: https://www.linkedin.com/company/horaizon-technology




As a growing company, we are currently seeking a DATA ANALYST who is eager to take on diverse development projects and assume responsibility. If you join us, you'll have the opportunity to work in a personal environment where you can quickly gain valuable experience. Instead of merely maintaining systems, you'll utilize your development skills to create new innovations. Our focus is on the HEALTH domain, where we leverage state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to enable highly efficient, parallelized data analysis in a cloud environment. Visualizing the results is an integral part of our work.




Here's what we offer:




Salary range: €2,500.00 - €3,200.00 per month.




A chance to grow with us in a dynamic environment where you'll be exposed to a wide range of experiences.




Utilize your development skills to drive new innovations.




Work on optimizing processes, automating tasks, and extracting valuable insights from data.




Develop customized web applications and set up databases to integrate data from different systems.




Collaborate with clients to build predictive models for important business decisions.




We are looking for someone who:




MUST HAVE = Strong interest in Biology and/or HealthCare 


MUST HAVE = Possesses experience with Python and back-end development (eg REST/DJANGO)


Has a background in Computer Science, Engineering, Software Engineering, or AI. (e.g PyTorch, scikit-learn) = a BIG PLUS but not required


Bioinformatics experience is a BIG PLUS but not required


Holds a MSc degree


Has a strong desire to grow personally and professionally.


Thrives on taking responsibility and delivering exceptional results.


Enjoys surprising customers with the capabilities of their code.


Is ambitious and eager to advance their career.




In return, we offer:




Assistance with obtaining a residence permit and visa.


A competitive salary based on your experience and education


Exciting and diverse projects where you can leverage your programming skills.


Opportunities for personal and professional growth, including a dedicated development coach, software development training, and a budget for further skill enhancement.


Most importantly, a fun and collaborative team environment where you can enjoy working together.




Soort dienstverband: Fulltime




Nederlands niet vereist




Rooster:




ma-vr




Secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden:




Reiskostenvergoeding




Soorten aanvullende vergoedingen:




Vakantiegeld




Werklocatie: Fysiek




Aanvullende vergoedingen:




Vakantiegeld

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:




ma-vr

Werklocatie: Fysiek




Verwachte startdatum: 01-03-2025

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Wil jij advies geven over commerciële en strategische beslissingen aan Royal FloraHolland en onze klanten? Ben jij een kei met Power BI (of andere dashboarding)? Maak jij de mooiste datamodellen en analyses? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Over Royal FloraHolland

Het is onze ambitie om ons te ontwikkelen tot dé marktplaats voor bloemen en planten. We investeren in onze fysieke en digitale marktplaats, ons logistieke- en financiële dienstenpakket om onze kwekers en overige klanten maximaal van dienst te kunnen zijn. Daarnaast investeren we fors in onze mensen, zetten in op ontwikkeling, opleiding en duurzame inzetbaarheid zodat we samen in staat zijn elke dag een stap extra te zetten, onze meerwaarde voor kweker en klant te bewijzen en onze ambities waar te maken.




Market Intelligence

Als Data Analist maak je deel uit van het team Market Intelligence samen met 14 andere collega’s. Dit team bestaat uit Analisten en Marktonderzoekers en is essentieel voor het werken en verbeteren met data binnen en buiten Royal FloraHolland. Samen zorg je ervoor dat zowel senior management als ‘mensen op de vloer’ aan de slag kunnen met data. De scope is hierbij groot en we pionieren dan ook continu naar nieuwe mogelijkheden voor betere besluitvorming. Je kunt hierbij denken aan dashboarding, strategische analyses, voorspelmodellen, onderzoek, simulaties en meer. Goed om te weten: Market Intelligence is een team waar samenwerken hoog in het vaandel staat en waar we elkaar actief opzoeken en samen groeien.




Functieomschrijving

Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het structureren van commerciële, operationele en klantgedrag data. Je bewaakt de datakwaliteit en voert analyses uit. Je weet hoe je aantrekkelijke dashboards maakt en resultaten vanuit analyses samen met actiegerichte inzichten presenteert. Op basis hiervan nemen Royal FloraHolland en haar klanten relevante commerciële en strategische beslissingen. Je signaleert, analyseert en adviseert over kansen, behoeften en ontwikkelingen in de markt. Op deze manier bestrijk je een heel spectrum van strategische, tactische en operationele vraagstukken.




Je ontwikkelt samen met de andere Analisten een visie en strategie over hoe RFH nu en in de toekomst commerciële, klant en marktdata optimaal inzet t.b.v. betere besluitvorming.;
Je bent in staat data uit verschillende bronnen te verzamelen bijvoorbeeld door het koppelen met verschillende databronnen. Je weet hier de beste insights uit te halen en geeft concreet advies.
Je hebt affiniteit met tooling zoals SQL en Python om complexe analyses terug te brengen naar een eenduidig antwoord.
Je stelt je op als kwantitatief expert en bent daarmee medeverantwoordelijk voor de dashboarding vanuit het team.
Je bent in staat jouw dashboards en analyses op een aantrekkelijke en doortastende manier te presenteren. Het is voor de gebruiker leuk en prikkelend om verder aan de slag te gaan met het werk dat je oplevert.

Functie-eisen

Je hebt minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau en bijvoorbeeld een opleiding in een kwantitatieve richting (denk aan Economie, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde, Econometrie)
Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring op het gebied consultancy, marktonderzoek of marktanalyse.
Je hebt ervaring in het opzetten, analyseren en succesvol afronden van dataprojecten.
Je hebt affiniteit met het ontwikkelen en toepassen van nieuwe (markt) analyse technologieën en methodes zoals segmentatie, modelleren en forecasting.
Je vindt het leuk om te pionieren en bent vooral opzoek naar kansen en oplossingen.




Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Wij bieden jou alle mogelijkheden om elke dag een beetje beter te worden, bijvoorbeeld door middel van onze Academy trainingen, Lean trainingen en on-the-job coaching. Wat je precies kunt verwachten (o.b.v. 38 uur per week):

Een team met een positieve werksfeer en can-do mentaliteit
Een fijne werkplek in ons kantoor in Naaldwijk en je werkt ook regelmatig vanuit huis.
Je bent minimaal 32 uur per week beschikbaar.
27 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband
Een uitdagende salarisrange volgens de cao (38 uur per week) van minimaal €3913,35 tot maximaal €5542,21 precies afgestemd op jouw niveau
Een baan bij een uniek bedrijf met een lange historie: de grootste marktplaats voor bloemen en planten in heel Europa!




Contactinfo

Wij verbinden kwekers en kopers aan elkaar om samen verder te groeien. Groei je mee? Reageer online, dan krijg je zo snel mogelijk een inhoudelijke reactie op je sollicitatie!

Heb je inhoudelijke vragen over de vacature Analist waar de vacaturetekst je geen antwoord op geeft? Neem dan contact op met Dominique Rooswinkel via recruitment@royalfloraholland.com

Screening is onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure dit is inclusief het aanleveren van VOG.




Ons recruitmentteam werft deze nieuwe collega zelf, dus acquisitie wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Show more

Als Data Analist maak je deel uit van het team Market Intelligence samen met 14 andere collega’s. Dit team bestaat uit Analisten en Marktonderzoekers en is essentieel voor het werken en verbeteren met data binnen en buiten Royal FloraHolland. Samen zorg je ervoor dat zowel senior management als ‘mensen op de vloer’ aan de slag kunnen met data. De scope is hierbij groot en we pionieren dan ook continu naar nieuwe mogelijkheden voor betere besluitvorming. Je kunt hierbij denken aan dashboarding, strategische analyses, voorspelmodellen, onderzoek, simulaties en meer. Goed om te weten: Market Intelligence is een team waar samenwerken hoog in het vaandel staat en waar we elkaar actief opzoeken en samen groeien.


Functieomschrijving

Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het structureren van commerciële, operationele en klantgedrag data. Je bewaakt de datakwaliteit en voert analyses uit. Je weet hoe je aantrekkelijke dashboards maakt en resultaten vanuit analyses samen met actiegerichte inzichten presenteert. Op basis hiervan nemen Royal FloraHolland en haar klanten relevante commerciële en strategische beslissingen. Je signaleert, analyseert en adviseert over kansen, behoeften en ontwikkelingen in de markt. Op deze manier bestrijk je een heel spectrum van strategische, tactische en operationele vraagstukken.


  • Je ontwikkelt samen met de andere Analisten een visie en strategie over hoe RFH nu en in de toekomst commerciële, klant en marktdata optimaal inzet t.b.v. betere besluitvorming.;
  • Je bent in staat data uit verschillende bronnen te verzamelen bijvoorbeeld door het koppelen met verschillende databronnen. Je weet hier de beste insights uit te halen en geeft concreet advies.
  • Je hebt affiniteit met tooling zoals SQL en Python om complexe analyses terug te brengen naar een eenduidig antwoord.
  • Je stelt je op als kwantitatief expert en bent daarmee medeverantwoordelijk voor de dashboarding vanuit het team.
  • Je bent in staat jouw dashboards en analyses op een aantrekkelijke en doortastende manier te presenteren. Het is voor de gebruiker leuk en prikkelend om verder aan de slag te gaan met het werk dat je oplevert.

Functie-eisen

  • Je hebt minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau en bijvoorbeeld een opleiding in een kwantitatieve richting (denk aan Economie, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde, Econometrie)
  • Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring op het gebied consultancy, marktonderzoek of marktanalyse.
  • Je hebt ervaring in het opzetten, analyseren en succesvol afronden van dataprojecten.
  • Je hebt affiniteit met het ontwikkelen en toepassen van nieuwe (markt) analyse technologieën en methodes zoals segmentatie, modelleren en forecasting.
  • Je vindt het leuk om te pionieren en bent vooral opzoek naar kansen en oplossingen.


Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Wij bieden jou alle mogelijkheden om elke dag een beetje beter te worden, bijvoorbeeld door middel van onze Academy trainingen, Lean trainingen en on-the-job coaching. Wat je precies kunt verwachten (o.b.v. 38 uur per week):

  • Een team met een positieve werksfeer en can-do mentaliteit
  • Een fijne werkplek in ons kantoor in Naaldwijk en je werkt ook regelmatig vanuit huis.
  • Je bent minimaal 32 uur per week beschikbaar.
  • 27 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband
  • Een uitdagende salarisrange volgens de cao (38 uur per week) van minimaal €3913,35 tot maximaal €5542,21 precies afgestemd op jouw niveau
  • Een baan bij een uniek bedrijf met een lange historie: de grootste marktplaats voor bloemen en planten in heel Europa!


Contactinfo

Wij verbinden kwekers en kopers aan elkaar om samen verder te groeien. Groei je mee? Reageer online, dan krijg je zo snel mogelijk een inhoudelijke reactie op je sollicitatie!

Heb je inhoudelijke vragen over de vacature Analist waar de vacaturetekst je geen antwoord op geeft? Neem dan contact op met Dominique Rooswinkel via recruitment@royalfloraholland.com

Screening is onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure dit is inclusief het aanleveren van VOG.


Ons recruitmentteam werft deze nieuwe collega zelf, dus acquisitie wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

About Us:

We are a data-driven organization seeking a skilled Data Analyst to help with a data migration project, and transform data into actionable insights. Join our dynamic team and play a key role in delivering impactful reporting solutions during a digital transformation.







Key Responsibilities




Data migration
Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure data accuracy
Optimize data models and DAX calculations for performance
Perform ETL tasks to integrate data from various sources
Implement data security and governance within Power BI
Troubleshoot and enhance existing report

Power BI Expertise
Data Modelling, Data extraction & Data migration

Business Analyst knowledge







What we offer

An opportunity to work on high-impact transformation projects
A collaborative and supportive work environment
12 month contract
can be freelance €65 per hour or payroll €5000 per month




Ideally start within 2-4 weeks.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

As Business Data Analyst you are part of Customer Excellence Team, supporting and facilitating our organization with data analytics and enabling effective decision making. In close cooperation with your colleagues in Customer Excellence, Business Technology Services and the various business stakeholders, you transform market and customer data into sustainable dashboards / analytical reports based on business use cases. The ideal candidate has a strong affinity with data analytics and the health care environment, is a quick learner and brings a positive can-do mentality. You will report to the Manager Business Analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Analytics & Reporting - Understand, combine and transform local & global datasets into visualizations. Build sustainable dashboards (PowerBI) to support both operational reporting and strategic decision making. Guide colleagues to develop right visualizations for presenting results.
Data modeling - Understand and further optimize the data models of current use cases. Develop data models for new use cases. Help manage the various data models which enable business users to answer their questions.
Data governance - Partner with internal stakeholders from different departments to help shape how we manage customer data, to ensure alignment and to maintain analytical tools sustainable and compliant.
State-of-the-art data platform – opportunity to familiarize yourself with a state-of-the-art data platform (Palantir Foundry)
Innovation - Explore and innovate new solutions and capabilities in the areas of data, analytics, and AI to address business issues and opportunities.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or higher degree with academic courses in quantitative methods, analytics, statistics, economics or finance.
Experience in a corporate environment & experience with relevant customer / market datasets within the biopharmaceutical industry is a plus.
Analytically strong. Ability to rapidly connect & match analytics and data products to business needs. Able to analyze and draw meaningful conclusions from data. Affinity with relational database query languages using SQL.
You need to be able to quickly be in the driver’s seat and work on the different use cases with the ability to quickly learn the new environment and Palantir Foundry platform.
Expert knowledge of an analysis tool such as Microsoft PowerBI and curious to learn more about their platforms. Passionate about technology and excited about the impact of emerging / disruptive technologies.
Gives importance to creating sustainable, well-documented, compliant data solutions.
Great collaborator and excellent written and verbal communications skills
Ability to independently frame business questions, identify data sources, formulate a methodology and manage project timelines and deliverables.
Fluent in both English and preferably Dutch, with excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.


Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The company is a relaxed working environment and very sociable and friendly, anyone who joins is welcomed like family - even if you are a freelancer. We have helped over 15 candidates at this company and not once had a complaint.




Role objective: The Data Analyst will develop analytical reports and dashboards using Tableau regarding the comp-any's software estate and IT assets as well as the operational performance of the cloud infrastructure.




Responsibilities:




Develop and design reports and dashboards in Tableau ensuring optimal user experience.
Update existing dashboards as part of migration to new data warehouse.
Work closely with stakeholders, gathering requirements and translating them into requirements specs and user stories.
Analyse and profile large operational and technology datasets with a focus on data integrity and accuracy.
Data cleansing, preparation and modelling using DBT or AWS Athena.







Requirements:

Tableau expertise is a must have, alongside strong data visualization and design skills.
Additionally, Power BI experience is also preferable.
Experience working with large and complex data sets, data profiling and cleansing.
Experience or knowledge of IT asset management preferred.
Proficiency with SQL, Snowflake and DBT.
Familiarity with AWS or other equivalent cloud technologies, in particular Lambda, S3, Athena.
Excellent communication skills and ability to engage effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels.




If your skills match please send your cv to lee.dubar@opusrs.com or press apply.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real-time performance insights and connect the enterprise - accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.

HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry-specific solutions.

We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
Optimize data processes for performance and scalability



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities



Benefits

Why choose HSO?

Freedom and flexibility

An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.

Culture

An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!

Development and growth

A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.

A good remuneration package

An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
HTML:
We are looking for a Data & Reporting Analyst for Fellowmind in Amersfoort. Are you looking for a dynamic environment and international growth? Then check out the vacancy below!


Job Description

As part of this dynamic and forward-thinking environment, Fellowmind's Group Finance Department is looking for a Data & Reporting Analyst. This role will be responsible for managing and optimizing the consolidation system (e.g., Tagetik), support in set up of dashboarding and business insights and the ability to analyze and interpret financial data to produce accurate and reliable reports.


Tasks and responsibilities:

  • Coordinating and implementing system changes and improvements;
  • Ensuring the technical integrity and efficiency of the consolidation system, including resolving technical issues and executing enhancements, together with external Tagetik consultants;
  • Implementing controls within and outside the consolidation system to maintain the integrity and quality of financial data;
  • ESG reporting-logic/data-model implementation in Tagetik;
  • Close cooperation with the Group Finance Team to establish a robust technical foundation for the consolidation system.


Job Requirements

  • A Bachelor or Master degree in finance, accounting, business administration, or a related field is preferred;
  • A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in financial reporting, accounting, or a related field in a multi-national company;
  • Experience in financial consolidation processes and working with consolidation systems like Tagetik;
  • Experience in an international environment, handling multiple currencies;
  • Knowledge of financial software and ERP systems;
  • Experience in Dashboarding Power BI (Pre);
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail;
  • Ability to coordinate and implement changes within the consolidation system;
  • Full proficiency in the English language, both written and spoken.


Employment conditions

  • Salary: €70.000 - €75.000 (incl. holidays allowance);
  • A bonus scheme up to 10%;
  • 28 vacation days with the option to buy or sell vacation days using a separate flex budget;
  • Time off on national holidays such as New Year’s Day and King’s Day;
  • Travel reimbursement (€0.23 per km) or an NS Business Card;
  • The possibility to take a 3-week workation once a year;
  • Hybrid working: from the office, on-site with our clients, or from home;
  • Mobile phone and laptop. Additionally, a monitor, keyboard, mouse, and headset for working from home;
  • Take advantage of the sports plan: lease a bike or receive a contribution towards your gym membership;
  • An inspiring workplace in Amersfoort, where you can enjoy good coffee and tea, fruit, soup, and soft drinks;
  • WIA and WGA insurance;
  • Pension plan with Aegon Capital;
  • Generous training budget.


About Fellowmind

Fellowmind is a leading international consultancy firm specializing in digital transformation and business solutions, with operations in Denmark, Sweden, Finland, the Netherlands, Germany, and Poland, and a team of over 2,000 employees.


The company’s mission is to create meaningful connections by ensuring seamless collaboration between people and technology, with a focus on leveraging Microsoft cloud solutions, fostering agile development, and implementing integrated platforms. Fellowmind empowers organizations to unlock the potential of data analytics and business insights to drive innovation and achieve sustainable success. Headquartered in Amersfoort, the Netherlands, Fellowmind encourages a culture of collaboration, flexibility, and excellence throughout its operations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For our Local Service Team, we are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support the development and maintenance of interactive dashboards, ensuring accurate and actionable insights for stakeholders. In this role, you will work with teams to drive data-driven decisions, improve existing systems, and explore future developments. Our focus is on delivering high-quality dashboards tailored to business needs while fostering collaboration and innovation. You are already based in The Netherlands

About Your Responsibilities


Collect, organize, and analyze complex data sets using analytical tools to provide actionable insights.
Design and deliver reports, dashboards, and ad hoc analyses tailored to business needs.
Collaborate with local teams to understand requirements and develop data-driven solutions.
Provide user support, helping stakeholders leverage dashboards effectively for decision-making.
Identify opportunities to enhance data quality, processes, and visualization techniques.
Verify and validate effort calculations for potential changes received from external suppliers.
Modify and optimize backend coding for the Data Warehouse Solution as needed.
Maintain ETL pipelines, ensuring seamless operation and future scalability.
Oversee planning of deliverables, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
Collaborate with stakeholders to align business requirements with technology solutions, fostering efficient communication and decision-making.
Stay updated with the latest trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis and visualization to drive innovation.
You are already based in The Netherlands, we do not provide relocation or sponsor for the role.
Dashboard Development: Create and maintain interactive dashboards in Tableau, adhering to business needs and enhancing usability with UX/UI principles.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into actionable insights. Acting as a facilitator to align current technology stacks with potential future developments.
Data Modelling and Analysis: Design and implement data models that optimize database structures for analysis. Conduct deep dives into datasets for predictive analytics and insights exploration.
Programming and Backend Development: Possess strong programming skills to validate supplier effort calculations, modify backend systems, and ensure seamless data warehouse solution operations.
Documentation and informing: Maintain thorough documentation of processes and findings. Educate and support stakeholders to effectively utilize dashboards and insights.


Required Knowledge And Experience


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related fields.
Minimum 2 years experience in data analysis, data engineering, or related roles.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, specifically Tableau.
Knowledge of SQL and database management.
Proficient in Python, with expertise in libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Seaborn, and Matplotlib.
Strong understanding of backend development principles and the ability to modify and optimize code as needed.
Knowledge of data modeling principles and data warehouse concepts, with experience in ETL processes.
Excellent critical thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Written and verbal communication for presenting data-driven insights.
Strong stakeholder management skills to facilitate collaboration and alignment across teams.
Excellent written and verbal communication for presenting data-driven insights.
Adaptability to domain-specific data contexts (e.g., HR, Finance, Operations).


Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. Our values are trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate the collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

What's in it for you?

Work environment


Agile way of working, multi-cultural work environment promoting work-life balance
Autonomy, flexibility, opportunity and growth
Cool office space in the World Trade Center Rotterdam!
Are you coming to the office by bike or car? You can park right here at the office
Be a part of our events to build a stronger Swisscom community - for example, culture lunches, fun quizzes, game nights and a lot more!


Allowances


Full relocation support (Housing, settling in, etc.) for you and your family
200 euros per month Telephone/internet allowance
275 euros per month contribution to health insurance
5 Paid training days and access to Swisscom learning platforms
Travel allowance reimbursement
500 euros home office allowance
Gym subscription, Tax advice, and language course


Leaves policy


Work from abroad possibility for one month per year
Care, bereavement, maternity and paternity leaves
25 days paid vacation days plus Dutch national holidays


Contract terms


To begin with you will receive a fixed term contract (one year), after 6 months of your employment with us, after a feedback meeting with the team, there is a possibility of extending the contract to an indefinite term
The salary ranges mentioned in our Job Descriptions are base annual gross salaries including the 8% holiday allowance
Show more
HTML:
For our Local Service Team, we are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support the development and maintenance of interactive dashboards, ensuring accurate and actionable insights for stakeholders. In this role, you will work with teams to drive data-driven decisions, improve existing systems, and explore future developments. Our focus is on delivering high-quality dashboards tailored to business needs while fostering collaboration and innovation. You are already based in The Netherlands

About Your Responsibilities

  • Collect, organize, and analyze complex data sets using analytical tools to provide actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver reports, dashboards, and ad hoc analyses tailored to business needs.
  • Collaborate with local teams to understand requirements and develop data-driven solutions.
  • Provide user support, helping stakeholders leverage dashboards effectively for decision-making.
  • Identify opportunities to enhance data quality, processes, and visualization techniques.
  • Verify and validate effort calculations for potential changes received from external suppliers.
  • Modify and optimize backend coding for the Data Warehouse Solution as needed.
  • Maintain ETL pipelines, ensuring seamless operation and future scalability.
  • Oversee planning of deliverables, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to align business requirements with technology solutions, fostering efficient communication and decision-making.
  • Stay updated with the latest trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis and visualization to drive innovation.
  • You are already based in The Netherlands, we do not provide relocation or sponsor for the role.
  • Dashboard Development: Create and maintain interactive dashboards in Tableau, adhering to business needs and enhancing usability with UX/UI principles.
  • Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into actionable insights. Acting as a facilitator to align current technology stacks with potential future developments.
  • Data Modelling and Analysis: Design and implement data models that optimize database structures for analysis. Conduct deep dives into datasets for predictive analytics and insights exploration.
  • Programming and Backend Development: Possess strong programming skills to validate supplier effort calculations, modify backend systems, and ensure seamless data warehouse solution operations.
  • Documentation and informing: Maintain thorough documentation of processes and findings. Educate and support stakeholders to effectively utilize dashboards and insights.

Required Knowledge And Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related fields.
  • Minimum 2 years experience in data analysis, data engineering, or related roles.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, specifically Tableau.
  • Knowledge of SQL and database management.
  • Proficient in Python, with expertise in libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Seaborn, and Matplotlib.
  • Strong understanding of backend development principles and the ability to modify and optimize code as needed.
  • Knowledge of data modeling principles and data warehouse concepts, with experience in ETL processes.
  • Excellent critical thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Written and verbal communication for presenting data-driven insights.
  • Strong stakeholder management skills to facilitate collaboration and alignment across teams.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication for presenting data-driven insights.
  • Adaptability to domain-specific data contexts (e.g., HR, Finance, Operations).

Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. Our values are trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate the collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

What's in it for you?

Work environment

  • Agile way of working, multi-cultural work environment promoting work-life balance
  • Autonomy, flexibility, opportunity and growth
  • Cool office space in the World Trade Center Rotterdam!
  • Are you coming to the office by bike or car? You can park right here at the office
  • Be a part of our events to build a stronger Swisscom community - for example, culture lunches, fun quizzes, game nights and a lot more!

Allowances

  • Full relocation support (Housing, settling in, etc.) for you and your family
  • 200 euros per month Telephone/internet allowance
  • 275 euros per month contribution to health insurance
  • 5 Paid training days and access to Swisscom learning platforms
  • Travel allowance reimbursement
  • 500 euros home office allowance
  • Gym subscription, Tax advice, and language course

Leaves policy

  • Work from abroad possibility for one month per year
  • Care, bereavement, maternity and paternity leaves
  • 25 days paid vacation days plus Dutch national holidays

Contract terms

  • To begin with you will receive a fixed term contract (one year), after 6 months of your employment with us, after a feedback meeting with the team, there is a possibility of extending the contract to an indefinite term
  • The salary ranges mentioned in our Job Descriptions are base annual gross salaries including the 8% holiday allowance

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Heb jij een passie voor data en wil je bedrijven helpen hun processen te optimaliseren? Bij Matrix Meesters ben je aan zet!

We zoeken een Business Data Analyst die de brug kan slaan tussen business en IT. Werk aan uitdagende projecten met geavanceerde data-oplossingen en ondersteun bedrijven met waardevolle inzichten. Sluit je aan bij ons dynamische team en bouw mee aan innovatieve data-initiatieven!

Jouw rol

Als Business Data Analyst analyseer je complexe datasets, bouw je datagedreven oplossingen en adviseer je klanten bij strategische beslissingen. Je vertaalt bedrijfsdoelen naar bruikbare data-oplossingen en creëert inzichten via dashboards en rapportages.

Verantwoordelijkheden:

Vertalen van bedrijfsbehoeften naar data-oplossingen.
Data verzamelen, modelleren en analyseren (o.a. SQL, Snowflake).
Dashboards en rapportages ontwikkelen (Power BI, Tableau).
Adviseren over procesoptimalisatie en ondersteunen bij data-architectuur.
Stakeholders begeleiden in het gebruik van data-oplossingen.

Wat bieden wij?

Marktconform salaris en 190 vakantie-uren.
Pensioenregeling en flexibele werktijden.
Opleidingsmogelijkheden (certificeringen in data-analyse, BI-tools, Agile, etc).
Flexibel werken, laptop en smartphone van de zaak.
Innovatieve werkomgeving gericht op persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Wie ben jij?

Je bent analytisch, proactief en hebt een passie voor data. Je hebt ervaring met Power BI of Tableau, geavanceerde SQL-kennis, en bent bekend met datawarehousing en ETL-processen. Je hebt 3-5 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol en een relevante hbo- of wo-opleiding. Je bent communicatief sterk en bouwt makkelijk bruggen tussen stakeholders.

Twijfel je of je profiel aansluit?

Geen probleem! Bij Matrix Meesters investeren we graag in jouw groei en ontwikkeling. Laten we samen kijken naar de mogelijkheden.

Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol continuously advances its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our Advertising via bol (Avb) propositions, which help shoppers discover products and help advertisers reach shoppers, play an important role in bol’s ambitions – and this is where you’ll make the difference. As Avb Marketing, we help and engage thousands of our advertisers.

Marketing Analytics play an instrumental role here. Our goal is to enable ‘Engagement at Scale’. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you’ll analyze our advertising partners’ behavior, uncover opportunities for improvement and share actionable insights with our marketeers so that our campaigns reach the right audience at the right time. In all your decisions, you’ll take scalability into account as we serve thousands of active advertisers at any given moment.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and becoming increasingly important for bol. The number of colleagues, the complexity of the tech, and the breadth of initiatives are rapidly expanding. Data needs and requests for more insights are no exception. At the same time, we’re implementing Marketing Automation tools to improve our capabilities. This requires us to work pragmatically and focus on achieving the required outcomes. You rise to the occasion to ensure that the underlying data of our campaigns is robust, can be used effectively and responsibly and iterate quickly.

What You’ll Do As An Marketing Data Analyst

You’ll join a team of marketing data analysts in bol’s Avb Marketing Analytics team, which aims to help the marketing teams to create more engaging and impactful campaigns through data.

Your Workload Covers Three Main Areas


You help our marketeers by creating insights to understand advertiser behavior, help optimize campaigns, and drive data-driven decisions. All with the goal of building and optimizing campaigns that help and engage advertisers
You help build, maintain and simplify our data model that supports our communication flows. All with the goal of enabling scalable campaigning where we reach thousands of advertisers at a relevant moment
You analyze the performance of our campaigns and attribute their commercial value. All with the goal of identifying opportunities for improvement and getting a clear picture of the impact we’re making as a department


We’re Looking For You If You


Don’t want to work alone. You work closely with various stakeholders to make the above possible. This requires strong communication skills to bridge the gap between Marketeers, Analysts and Product Engineers;
Challenge ideas. You help the team with the other Marketing data analysts to reach a higher level, both in terms of content and on a personal level.
Help implement best practice around tools and concepts like: Git, SQL, Dbt, data testing, monitoring, and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards;
Help model pipelines, optimize queries, and apply best practices. You also actively collaborate within bol’s wider analytics engineering and data engineering community to improve our data stack at scale;
Practice and preach Clean Code principles such as DRY and Clean, Clear and Concise;
Know a thing or two about data engineering, analytics engineering or business intelligence engineering and know your way around a marketing automation tooling (such as Marigold Engage).


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


Uncomfortable with ambiguity Our data landscape evolves, and you’ll need to navigate it confidently, so an entrepreneurial mindset is a must. Bol is complex, you have to involve and convince both Product & Tech colleagues to find solutions, proactively and autonomously.
Output over outcome If your work ends when you complete a dashboard – who cares how users experience it – then this job is not for you. We’re looking to find real solutions for our marketing teams to build solid campaigns!
No continuous improvement We’re always learning from our analyses and work to improve our ways-of-working.
Sharing is caring You have hands-on experience in marketing analytics, SQL (e.g. BigQuery), statistics (the basics) and feel comfortable navigating and analyzing large, complex datasets.
High quality code results in clear and actionable insights Finetuning queries, data models, and coding principles make you smile and SQL, Git and dashboarding tools like Tableau/Looker Studio are your home away from home. *Dbt and/or Airflow is a plus.
You are not a one-trick-pony Our role is multi-faceted so you can translate data to opportunity and opportunity to campaign building blocks. It starts with extracting campaign opportunities from data and ends with realizing the data foundation for scalable marketing campaigns.


This is where you’ll work

You’ll join a team of four Marketing Data Analysts which supports our multidisciplinary Avb Marketing team. Your marketing colleagues are seasoned in the world of data and CRM. Sparring happens on a daily basis. We like to make each other better – motivating and respecting are second nature to us.

Besides the strategic topics, you have the space to work on your own innovations and seize the opportunities you identify. Bol gladly invests in your personal and professional growth; development is a primary employment condition. The culture is informal, down-to-earth, and pioneering.

We work in collaborative spaces where you’ll work alongside other data enthusiasts, enjoying a mix of open areas and quiet corners. Our most important stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Product are just a stroll away.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.
Show more

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Een positieve toekomst voor iedereen, daar werken we bij Sopra Steria aan. Met meer dan 56.000 collega’s in 30 landen zijn we Europa’s toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale oplossingen. Wij geloven dat het niet alleen technologie is die transformatie aandrijft, maar dat mensen de kern vormen van verandering. Daarom staan mensen centraal in alles wat we doen, zowel individueel als in teamverband. De wereld is hoe we haar vormgeven. Laten we haar samen vormgeven.

Vacatureomschrijving

Je identificeert de behoeften van de organisatie en vertaalt deze naar informatieoplossingen. Je stelt ook gevalideerde vereisten en specificaties op met de juiste kwaliteit en diepgang, en prioriteert deze samen met de business. Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor de organisatie en voor de scrumteams als het gaat om inhoud. Bovendien ben je in staat om duidelijk over te brengen wat gerealiseerd moet worden als geen ander.

Je hebt een passie voor je werk en richt je volledig op klanttevredenheid en kwaliteit. Durf, proactieve communicatieve vaardigheden en een sterke analytische benadering zijn essentieel voor je rol als Data Analist.

Als Data Analist bij Sopra Steria overbrug je de kloof tussen business, informatie en technologie. Als echte expert in jouw vakgebied voer je gesprekken met stakeholders zoals beheerders, gebruikers en architecten. Je identificeert hun behoeften en vertaalt deze naar informatieoplossingen. Je stelt gevalideerde vereisten en specificaties op met de juiste kwaliteit en diepgang en prioriteert deze samen met de business. Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor de organisatie en voor de scrumteams als het gaat om inhoud. En je bent in staat om duidelijk over te brengen wat gerealiseerd moet worden als geen ander.

Functie-eisen

We zijn op zoek naar gepassioneerde collega’s die graag de grenzen van digitale transformatie en technologieconsulting verleggen. Bij Sopra Steria krijg je de kans om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen in een constructieve, samenwerkende teamomgeving, waarbij je werkt aan impactvolle projecten die verandering teweegbrengen voor onze klanten. Als jij gedijt in een uitdagende omgeving en voldoet (tenzij anders vermeld) aan de meeste kwalificaties hieronder, kijken we uit naar je sollicitatie!

Type dienstverband: Hybride

Locatie: Nieuwegein

Aantal contracturen: 32-40 uur per week

Contracttype: Vast

Opleiding: Je hebt een HBO- of WO-opleiding afgerond in de richting van IT

Talen: Nederlands (vereist) en Engels

Je hebt kennis en ervaring van het volgende:


Minimaal twee jaar ervaring in data-analyse en datavormgeving
Affiniteit met data, datastructuren en datamapping
Kennis en ervaring met datamodellering en relationele algebra
Nauwkeurige en precieze werkhouding
Analytisch denkvermogen, sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en een praktische instelling
Ervaring met SQL is een duidelijke pré


Aanvullende informatie

Als onderdeel van een van Europa’s grootste aanbieders van digitale oplossingen profiteer je van uitgebreide carrièremogelijkheden, zowel lokaal als internationaal. Bij de Sopra Steria Academy maak je deel uit van een dynamisch netwerk van 56.000 professionals in verschillende stadia van hun loopbaan.

Je wordt onderdeel van een toonaangevende techspeler in Europa, erkend voor zijn consultancy, digitale diensten en softwareontwikkeling. Binnen onze Oracle Area bieden wij uitgebreide beheerdiensten voor alle Oracle-producten, waaronder SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, on-premise databases, middleware en Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Onze expertise garandeert dat jouw Oracle-omgevingen geoptimaliseerd, veilig en soepel draaiend blijven.

Naast beheerdiensten bieden we consultancy op maat. Of je nu behoefte hebt aan doorlopend beheer of ondersteuning bij specifieke projecten, ons team staat klaar om je doelen met Oracle-technologieën te realiseren.

Onze medewerkers staan bekend om hun gedurfde keuzes en het leveren van resultaten. Werk samen met hooggekwalificeerde professionals die voorop lopen in bedrijfs-softwareoplossingen en innovatie bij Europa's toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale diensten.

Wij bieden een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder:


Locatie onafhankelijk en flexibel werken;
Onbeperkte ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden;
Een laptop, telefoon en thuiskantoor;
Een aantrekkelijk salaris;
Keuze tussen een bedrijfsauto of een mobiliteitsbudget;
De mogelijkheid om je eigen voordelen aan te passen via Flex Benefits:
Vakantiegeld en winstdeling;
27 verlofdagen (20 wettelijke en 7 bovenwettelijke vakantiedagen).

______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.
Show more

Onze medewerkers staan bekend om hun gedurfde keuzes en het leveren van resultaten. Werk samen met hooggekwalificeerde professionals die voorop lopen in bedrijfs-softwareoplossingen en innovatie bij Europa's toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale diensten.

Wij bieden een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder:

  • Locatie onafhankelijk en flexibel werken;
  • Onbeperkte ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden;
  • Een laptop, telefoon en thuiskantoor;
  • Een aantrekkelijk salaris;
  • Keuze tussen een bedrijfsauto of een mobiliteitsbudget;
  • De mogelijkheid om je eigen voordelen aan te passen via Flex Benefits:
    • Vakantiegeld en winstdeling;
    • 27 verlofdagen (20 wettelijke en 7 bovenwettelijke vakantiedagen).
______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.

Title: Power BI Analyst
Description:
Power BI / Data Analyst

Rotterdam based - hybrid

Excellent salary & benefits package on offer




The Odiin Group is partnered with a leading company who are looking for a Power BI / Data Analyst as part of their digital transformation efforts.




Our customer is embarking on a multi year digital transformation programme, investing heavily within their ERP and broader IT landscape - a complete technology modernisation program.




This is a fantastic opportunity to join a newly formed team within Business Intelligence, where you will be focused on analysing data, developing reports within Power BI dashboards and providing key insights to the business.




Our client are able to offer lots of flexibility, company perks, benefits, and opportunities for growth and well-being!




Within this role, Dutch speaking is imperative - minimum B2.




Requirements:

Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience, operating as a BI/Data Analyst
Strong analytical abilities with proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with other data analysis tools like Power BI or similar software is a plus.
Experience with ERP systems are considered advantageous.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
English is essential, and business fluency in Dutch is a must.




What’s on Offer:

Competitive salaries and benefits and perk packages.
Flexibility around start/finish times
Extensive company benefits programme
Indefinite contracts available
The chance to work on cutting-edge IT projects.
Opportunities for career growth and development in thriving markets.




If you're interested in exploring this opportunity further, please apply to the advert with your CV or contact JamesRodgers@odiin.tech for more info.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst who loves transforming complex data into meaningful insights? Do you have a knack for visualizing opportunities and bottlenecks, and a passion for enabling data-driven decisions?

As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in leveraging data to guide strategic decisions. You'll analyze complex datasets, develop insightful reports, and create advanced visualizations to support stakeholders. Acting as a trusted advisor, you'll collaborate with users to uncover new perspectives, operationalize sustainable data solutions, and foster a data-informed culture.

What you'll do

Develop, deliver, and maintain Power BI products and Management Information (MI) to enhance decision-making.
Analyze data, provide actionable insights, and support stakeholders with expert knowledge.
Collaborate with business units to identify new use cases, educate teams on data possibilities, and inspire a data-driven mindset.
Ensure reports and visualizations meet the information needs of various business units and align with strategic goals.

What you'll bring

Detail-oriented with strong storytelling and data visualization skills.
Experienced in data analysis, data processing, and maintaining Power BI reports
Power BI Certificate PL300 is preferred.
Knowledgeable about data modeling, sustainability strategies, and the organization's data framework.
Curious and innovative, with a logical mindset and the ability to derive connections from complex datasets.
Familiar with Databricks (preferred) and adept in tools and systems used for advanced analytics.

Show more

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Bij KLM Health Services krijg je als Data Analist een unieke kans om jouw talent voor data in te zetten op het hoogste niveau. Geen gespreid bedje, maar een uitdagende rol waarin je organisatie breed verantwoordelijk bent voor het verwerken en analyseren van data. Met behulp van tools zoals Power BI vertaal je complexe datasets naar heldere inzichten die niet alleen onze dagelijkse operatie versterken, maar ook bijdragen aan strategische beslissingen.

Ben jij klaar om met jouw expertise in data-analyse en Power BI impact te maken binnen een organisatie waar gezondheid vooropstaat? Lees dan verder!




Wat ga je doen

Als Data Analist bij KLM Health Services krijg je een uitdagende rol waarin je jouw expertise inzet op zowel IT-gebied als strategisch niveau. In deze rol werk je als verbindende schakel tussen data en de business, waarbij je nauw samenwerkt met verschillende interne en externe stakeholders. Met jouw ervaring weet je prioriteiten te stellen en effectief te schakelen tussen projecten. Jij zorgt ervoor dat data op de juiste manier wordt ingezet om strategische en operationele doelstellingen te behalen. Je krijgt de ruimte om jouw functie zelf vorm te geven, zodat je de organisatie op de best mogelijke manier kunt ondersteunen.




Verder houdt je bezig met het:

verzamelen van relevante datasets door middel van gesprekken met stakeholders, en deze verwerken in Power Bi voor visueel aantrekkelijke rapportages.
vertalen van bedrijfsbehoefte naar concrete vragen en toepasbare analyses.
ondersteunen van de Product Owner en Business Analist.
meedenken en bewaken van data/privacy compliance en signaleren van risico’s.
presenteren van resultaten aan de stakeholders met een doeltreffende communicatiestijl.
proactief verslag uitbrengen aan het team over het voortgang van projecten.




Waar je terecht komt

KLM Health Services, Airport Medical Services en Executive Health Management helpen met gezond leven, werken en reizen. Van eerste hulp en medische ondersteuning tot vaccinaties, health check-ups en lifestyle programma’s. Dit doen we met een team van artsen, verpleegkundigen, assistenten en coaches.




De afdeling Digital is een platte afdeling met weinig hiërarchie. Je bent samen met een junior collega het hart van het datateam. Ook zijn er collega’s Data Engineer. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar we samen lerend de organisatie continu verder ontwikkelen. Binnen deze context speelt de afdeling Digital een belangrijke rol. Wij adviseren over digitale innovatie, leveren waardevolle inzichten, beheren het digitale landschap en bieden support.




Wie jij bent

De ideale Data Analist voor deze functie is iemand met:

HBO werk-en denk niveau;
minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie;
ervaring in Power BI (diepgaande kennis) en SQL;
ervaring als Data Analist in een agile omgeving;
kennis van de Nederlandse taal op een zakelijke niveau.
sterke communicatievaardigheden die makkelijk schakelt op verschillende niveaus.




Wat wij bieden

Een functie vol uitdagingen met volop ruimte voor eigen invulling. Je krijgt de vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid om jouw werk op jouw manier uit te voeren. Daarnaast bieden wij een Data Analist bij ons:




de mogelijkheid om hybride te werken in afstemming met je team.
een functie voor 32 a 40 uur per week.
een salaris tussen €3.425 en €4.564 bruto o.b.v. 40 uur afhankelijke van je werkervaring.
8% vakantiegeld en 5% eindejaarsuitkering.
max 10% winstdeling.
20 vakantiedagen en 6 ADV dagen. En leeftijd afhankelijk nog maximaal 9 extra vakantiedagen.
een thuiswerkbudget van €900,-.
een fietsplan: een belastingvrije vergoeding (eenmalig) voor aanschaf van een fiets voor zakelijk gebruik.
korting Travel Clinic Travel bij KLM Health Services: 15% korting op vaccinaties.
deelname aan Cultuur Werkt! met korting of soms gratis naar culturele voorstellingen of concerten.




Daarnaast kun je na een jaar dienstverband gebruik maken van een gunstige regeling voor KLM-tickets.




Vervolg

Spreekt deze vacature je aan? Solliciteer dan direct! Na ontvangst van je sollicitatie doorlopen we de volgende stappen:

1. telefonische kennismaking met Nilab Ahmadi, Recruitment Specialist.

2. 1e gesprek bij KLM Health Services met de Teammanager Digital + collega

3. 2de gesprek bij KLM Health Services met HR Business Partner + collega

4. beide enthousiast? Top! Wij doen je een aanbod.




Heb je nog vragen dan kan je altijd bellen met Nilab Ahmadi via 0627381868 of mailen naar nilab@raas.today




We require a minimum of Dutch B2 to ensure the quality and safety of our products for the Dutch healthcare sector. Profiles that do not meet the Dutch B2 level will not be considered in the procedure.

Show more

  • een functie voor 32 a 40 uur per week.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Freelance Data Analyst (8-Month Contract)

Location: Amstelveen, Netherlands (2 Days in Office, 3 Days Remote)

Contract Duration: 8 Months




About the Company:

Our client, an innovative company in Aviation, seeks a Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in a collaborative, flexible environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and process large datasets to inform business decisions.
Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present insights.
Identify trends and KPIs to optimize processes.
Collaborate with teams to define and implement data solutions.
Conduct data validation and ensure consistency.
Provide ad-hoc analytical support and help maintain automated reporting tools.




Key Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, or related field.
Proven experience in data analysis and reporting tools (SQL, Excel, Python, R).
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI).
Strong attention to detail and ability to communicate findings clearly.
Experience with business intelligence tools or cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) is a plus.
Fluent Dutch




What We Offer:

Hybrid work model (2 days in the office, 3 days remote).
Collaborative team environment.
Competitive compensation.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
An exciting new opportunity for a business intelligence (BI) specialist for an exciting scale-up company located in The Hague has opened up, the key responsibilities and requirements are listed below. If you think you meet / are capable of meeting these, makes sure to submit an application and we will be in touch soon!




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain BI solutions such as dashboards, reports, and data visualizations that provide actionable insights for stakeholders.
Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data from various sources to support decision-making processes.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and deliver customized BI solutions.
Utilize BI tools and technologies (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker, etc.) to develop reports, graphs, and visualizations.
Perform data modeling, data extraction, and data transformation (ETL) processes to ensure data integrity and accuracy.




Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
Proven experience (3+ years) in business intelligence, data analysis, or a similar role.
Strong proficiency in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, or similar platforms.
Excellent knowledge of SQL and experience with data query languages.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.




Salary Package:

Up to €90,000
Flexible hybrid working
Company car + Travel reimbursement
Bonus + Pension Plan

Title: Spotfire Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Experienced in Spotfire and SAP

The Strategic Sourcing & Procurement Cost of Goods team is responsible for coordinating, reporting, and organizing platform cost roadmaps, as well as supporting Cluster organizations to ensure effective cost management. The team collaborates closely with Product Lifecycle Management, Cost Product Teams, and Account Leads to drive successful CoG roadmaps for specific product families.




As a Data Analyst in the SS&P CoG team, you will support a dedicated Cluster in their cost management efforts. You will partner with Account Leads to plan cost of goods activities, perform deep-dive analyses, and organize Cluster Cost Carousels. This role involves analyzing and presenting data, working with senior stakeholders, and collaborating with Finance on cost-related topics.




Key Responsibilities

Identify cost-saving opportunities and drive implementation within the Cluster.
Act as the go-to expert for Senior Account Leaders for in-depth cost analyses.
Provide cost roadmap clarity and insights to senior Cluster Managers.
Organize and facilitate Cluster Cost Carousels.
Deliver training to Account Leaders.
Collaborate with Finance on Cluster commitments and cost approvals.
Identify and implement improvements in cost management processes and tools.




Education and Experience

Proficiency in Spotfire and SAP is mandatory.
Familiarity with Power BI
Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain, Logistics, or a related field.
Relevant experience, preferably in Supply Chain/Procurement.
Background in finance environments, particularly related to cost of goods, approvals, and financial analysis.
Experience working with data, analyzing, and presenting findings to stakeholders.
