Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.  

We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a Data Analyst in our Stockholm office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change? 

The Role 

As a Data Analyst at Viaplay Group, you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights, enabling us to deliver exceptional experiences to our customers. By leveraging your analytical, visualization, and data modeling skills, you’ll inspire and lead the way toward a more data-informed business. Collaborating with diverse teams, you’ll be integral in evaluating trends, optimizing strategies, and supporting data-driven decision-making. Your expertise will help shape the future of Viaplay Group through enhanced user engagement, content performance, and operational excellence.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business strategies and improve user experiences
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to bring the business closer to data by offering expertise, advice, and insights. Actively contribute to creating a data-informed culture across all levels of the organization
Data Visualization: Build dashboards and reports with a strong focus on storytelling, making complex data easy to understand for stakeholders
Strategic Impact: Partner with stakeholders to align data strategies with business goals, support roadmap decisions, and ensure appropriate tracking is in place for new initiatives
Self-Service Analytics:Champion a self-service analytics culture across the organization, empowering teams to access, interpret, and utilize data independently
Education & Communication: Lead and participate in data education initiatives to improve understanding and utilization of data tools and methodologies across the organization
Process Automation: Identify opportunities for automation in data tracking, analysis, and reporting to streamline processes and improve scalability
Documentation: Create standardized and accessible documentation to ensure clarity, reduce dependencies, and enable teams to operate autonomously


What We’re Looking For 

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following: 


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, demonstrating the ability to work independently and proactively drive change
Strong knowledge of SQL and proficiency in visualization tools like Tableau or ThoughtSpot
Expertise in data storytelling, with the ability to translate complex insights into clear, compelling presentations for technical and non-technical audiences
A passion for setting up dashboards, KPIs, and reporting structures that inspire action and align with business goals
A collaborative mindset, with the ability to build strong relationships and work cross-functionally
A proactive approach to problem-solving, actively seeking new solutions and considering scalability in your work
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for making others enthusiastic about data


It’s a bonus if you have: 


Experience with analytical engineering or tools like Databricks
Background in the streaming or media industry
Experience working with data from finance or marketing teams


What we offer you


We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more. 


Hit play today 

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position. 

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.   
Show more

  • Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more. 

Hit play today 

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position. 

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About TOTEME

TOTEME is a Swedish fashion house founded in 2014 by Elin Kling and Karl Lindman. From the studio in Stockholm, the label explores the appeal of a modern uniform through distinct design cues, meticulous craftsmanship and methodic repetition. TOTEME is a conscious label committed to making decisions that work in favor of people, animals and the planet.




The Role

TOTEME is looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Stockholm. As a Data Analyst, you will play an important role in providing accurate, data-driven insights to our stakeholders. You will manage and develop our Business Intelligence (Qlik) tool, drive workflow improvements, and contribute to the strategic direction of our data systems. You'll play a crucial role in helping teams translate complex data into actionable insights. You will report to the Head of Finance.




Responsibilities

Oversee and maintain TOTEME’s BI system, including data and dashboard management, ensuring they meet the needs of internal stakeholders.
Collaborate with consultants and internal teams to process and prioritize BI system improvement requests.
Lead data workflow enhancements and contribute to strategic initiatives for greater efficiency and accuracy.
Drive initiatives that streamline processes, improve efficiency, and optimize financial performance.
Partner with the tech team on future system developments.
Support in financial analysis.
Stay informed on industry developments, sharing relevant insights across the organization.
Participate in and contribute to TOTEME’s social and environmental sustainability strategy.




Your Profile

A minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role, with strong expertise in Qlik Sense, Qlik Cloud, and preferably Shopify.
Experienced in data extraction, and visualization, with proficiency in dashboard creation and crafting compelling narratives through data.
Proficiency in Excel and creating actionable data dashboards.
Knowledge of the fashion, e-commerce, or retail industries is a plus.




About you

Curious and passionate about emerging technologies, including AI.
Comfortable adapting to new tools, systems, and methodologies.
Self-driven with a collaborative mindset, able to work both independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear, concise manner.
Detail-oriented, with a proactive approach to problem-solving and process improvements.




This is a full-time position based at TOTEME's headquarters in Stockholm, starting as soon as possible.




TOTEME has teams in Stockholm, London and New York with a growing number of stores in Europe, North America and Asia. You will join a dynamic, creative and highly collaborative team working towards exciting projects and milestones. You will contribute to the company’s development and have the opportunity to grow within your role.




TOTEME stands for inclusivity and a sense of belonging in the workplace. We welcome all applicants and recruit on the basis of skills and experience.




By applying to this position I agree with TOTEME’s privacy policy and to be contacted about future job opportunities for up to 2 years from the submission date. Find out more about our privacy policy here.

TOTEME is looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Stockholm. As a Data Analyst, you will play an important role in providing accurate, data-driven insights to our stakeholders. This is a full-time position based at TOTEME's headquarters in Stockholm, starting as soon as possible.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Vi startade Signific för att kunna lösa världens mest spännande och utmanande problem. Det gör vi genom att hjälpa organisationer och team att samla in, strukturera upp och agera på insikter från stora mängder kvantitativ data. På så sätt lär de sig snabbare om hur nytta, förändring och effekt skapas.

Som Data Analyst-konsult på Signific hjälper du våra uppdragsgivare att ta sin data till nya, insiktsskapande nivåer. Din förståelse för både affärs- och datamodeller kombinerat med analys, verktyg och kod är superviktig för ett datadrivet, lärande arbetssätt. På Signific får du använda dina skills på stora, inspirerande problem.

Utöver att göra skillnad i dina uppdrag är du en stor del av ett framåtlutat bolag som sätter våra anställda i fokus. Vi är ett litet, flexibelt bolag med stora ambitioner och vill ha med dig på resan dit.

Vad du kommer få göra

Vi tror på en öppen approach till lösningar på våra kunders utmaningar. Vi väljer lösning efter problem och inte vice versa. Din roll kan därför variera beroende på ditt intresse och kundernas problem.

Som Data Analyst hos oss ser vi dig troligen göra några av följande saker:


Först och främst hjälpa företag skapa mer nytta av sin data
Ta fram KPI:er och mätpunkter för användarbeteende kopplat till produkter och verksamheter
Ta komplex data till modeller och analyser som löser viktiga verksamhets- och samhällsproblem
Analysera stora mängder användardata för att driva produkt- och designbeslut
Kommunicera insikter och rekommendationer
Ha en nyckelroll att förflytta team och organisationer mot ett datadrivet arbetssätt.
Få ta del av och bidra till kunskapsdelning och nyskapande kultur ihop med dina kollegor
Utvecklas åt det håll du vill


Vem vi tror du är

Vi Tror På Att Bygga Ett Bolag Av Olika Personer Som På Olika Sätt Bidrar Till Att Vi Alla Trivs Och Lyckas. För Att Du Ska Trivas Hos Oss Och i Din Roll Tror Vi Dock Att Det Finns Några Saker Som Du Checkar Av Merparten Av

Som person


Ser positivt på utmaningar
Gillar att vara självgående men också att samarbeta
Nyfiken på nya teknologier och problem
Vill vara så bra som möjligt på det du gör
Gillar att sälja, kunskapsdela och/eller bidra till kulturen bland dina kollegor


I din roll


Är genuint intresserad av att lösa kunders verksamhetsproblem
Har minst fyra års arbetslivserfarenhet inom rollen eller liknande roller
Förstår vilka mått och mätetal som är viktiga för digitala produkter
Riktigt vass på att ta fram analyser av digitala produkter och tjänster i verktyg som t.ex. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Mixpanel eller Amplitude
Känner dig bekväm med att göra kontextspecifika analyser när vanliga analysverktyg inte räcker till i t.ex. Excel/Google Sheets eller med programmeringsspråk som SQL, Python eller R.
Har flera års erfarenhet av att sätta upp dashboards i visualiseringsverktyg (som t.ex. Tableau, Google Analytics, Google Data Studio)
Gillar och förstår statistik (som t.ex. A/B-tester, signfikanstester och regressionsmodellering)
Noggrann men också lösningsorienterad
Trivs att jobba i agila team och kanske också i en mer ledande roll.
Har stort intresse för Data Engineering/Science/Analytics i allmänhet
Högskoleutbildning är inget krav, men konkret arbetslivserfarenhet är det.


En spännande resa där du får vara med och påverka

Vi är ett nystartat litet bolag, med ambitioner att göra stort avtryck i våra uppdrag och på längre sikt. Vi vill skapa en samling av dom bästa inom vår nisch och bygga en stark kultur av gemenskap, ambition och kunskap. Något som gör en signifikant skillnad helt enkelt.

Hos oss får du


Utmanande uppdrag inom områden du är intresserad av
Kollegor som ser möjligheter och värdet med din kunskap inom data
Vassa kollegor som gillar att lära och läras av varandra
Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner
Inkluderande och hållbar arbetsmiljö


Vill du vara med och göra skillnad?
Show more

Title: Data Analyst to Online Growth Analysis
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
Be a productive member of the team.


Requirements


Collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders across global and regional retail teams to understand and address their analytical needs.
Translate business questions into comprehensive analyses, delivering actionable insights by managing the entire process from problem definition to results presentation.
Analyze large datasets, leveraging technical expertise in SQL, R, Python, Power BI, or other analytics tools to identify the best methods or models for each analysis.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to provide swift responses to urgent inquiries.
Lead complex analyses, derive insights, and prepare clear, impactful communication materials for senior stakeholders.


Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.
Opportunities for learning where needed.

• Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
  • Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
  • Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
  • Be a productive member of the team.

Requirements

  • Collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders across global and regional retail teams to understand and address their analytical needs.
  • Translate business questions into comprehensive analyses, delivering actionable insights by managing the entire process from problem definition to results presentation.
  • Analyze large datasets, leveraging technical expertise in SQL, R, Python, Power BI, or other analytics tools to identify the best methods or models for each analysis.
  • Conduct ad-hoc analyses to provide swift responses to urgent inquiries.
  • Lead complex analyses, derive insights, and prepare clear, impactful communication materials for senior stakeholders.

Benefits

  • A challenging, innovating environment.
  • Opportunities for learning where needed.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.




Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.




We at the Identity team provide smooth and efficient activation and account handling for Truecaller users. Our mission is to secure authorized access to our platform for legitimate users only.




As a Senior Data Analyst in Identity, you will be working with a cross-functional team. You help the team understand user verification trends, analyze usage patterns, and participate in the product discovery process to help build the right features that deliver value.




What will you work on

Create and analyze verification and fraud management metrics to identify opportunities for growth and cost optimization.
Utilize data to inform and help direct the product design process by providing a clear data narrative and a deep understanding of user needs.
Design and develop reports and dashboards to track user account verification and fraud management metrics.
Create and manage ETL pipelines.
Analyze the impact of changes to product design and AB tests and communicate results to stakeholders.




What we expect from you

Natural drive to uncover the “why” behind data trends, understand underlying business problems, and find solutions
At least 4 years of experience doing quantitative analysis
Expertise in business intelligence visualization tools, such as Google Data Studio, Looker, QlikSense, Tableau, PowerBI, etc
Experience in using SQL to extract, transform, and analyze data
Experience in CI/CD and Git
Work closely with stakeholders across the business to identify and act on opportunities to generate business value.
Ability to communicate the results of your analysis in a clear and effective manner
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Good communication skills in English




It would be great if you also have

Good scripting and programming skills
Experience with Python, Spark, and Airflow
Experience with data from mobile applications




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.




We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:

A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!




Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
HAYPP GROUP

We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.

Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 200 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.

THE ROLE

As a Data Analyst at Haypp Group, you will join the Haypp Lab team, our in-house insight division Haypp Lab that has the overall responsibility of providing both the internal organization and our external partners with actionable insights. We deliver data and analyses that drive both ours and our partners businesses forward. As a Data Analyst your responsibility will be to dive into the data and find customer patterns, unidentified consumer needs and much more. As a part of Haypp Lab you will work side by side with a team of highly skilled colleagues with a wide range of skills with both internal and external stakeholders.

Our e-commerce platforms are optimized and best in class. In addition, we have a cutting-edge insights platform where we also provide insights for our external partner to better understand consumers, to develop better products. We are currently the world’s leading insights provider when it comes to nicotine.

If you are ready to join a team that is making things happen in a brilliant manner and thereby drive a real change in the industry - we have just the challenge for you!

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with cross-functional teams, both internally and with external clients to identify business opportunities that can be solved with data.
Translate data into actionable insights and communicate the findings to relevant stakeholders using appropriate visualization.
The ideal candidate possess and can utilize SQL data to extract, analyze, and interpret the data from various sources to provide actionable insights.
Conduct in-depth analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to track key performance indicators and business metrics.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives by identifying process efficiencies and optimization opportunities.
Provide team members with proposed commercial actions based on transactional & customer data from our platforms.


What We Want From You


Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, or related field.
4+ years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a commercial setting.
Experience in customer management and being comfortable presenting data to internal and external stakeholders.
Proficiency in SQL programming for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience or willingness to learn programming languages like R or Python for data analysis.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Qlik Sense, or similar platforms is a plus.
Experience building intuitive presentations to visualize data.
Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with changing priorities.
Solid Powerpoint presentation skills


What We Offer

We are a value driven company with our values We team up, Innovation Drives Us, No Douchebags and Going the Extra Mile at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.

Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:


Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
Insurance plan, including private healthcare
30 days of paid vacation
Parental pay lift
Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
Lots of social happenings


SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!

If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!

Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.

If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Viktoria Sobolewski or Philip Anderberg at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com, philip.anderberg@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.

With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 950 000 consumers.
Show more
HTML:
HAYPP GROUP

We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.

Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 200 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.

THE ROLE

As a Data Analyst at Haypp Group, you will join the Haypp Lab team, our in-house insight division Haypp Lab that has the overall responsibility of providing both the internal organization and our external partners with actionable insights. We deliver data and analyses that drive both ours and our partners businesses forward. As a Data Analyst your responsibility will be to dive into the data and find customer patterns, unidentified consumer needs and much more. As a part of Haypp Lab you will work side by side with a team of highly skilled colleagues with a wide range of skills with both internal and external stakeholders.

Our e-commerce platforms are optimized and best in class. In addition, we have a cutting-edge insights platform where we also provide insights for our external partner to better understand consumers, to develop better products. We are currently the world’s leading insights provider when it comes to nicotine.

If you are ready to join a team that is making things happen in a brilliant manner and thereby drive a real change in the industry - we have just the challenge for you!

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, both internally and with external clients to identify business opportunities that can be solved with data.
  • Translate data into actionable insights and communicate the findings to relevant stakeholders using appropriate visualization.
  • The ideal candidate possess and can utilize SQL data to extract, analyze, and interpret the data from various sources to provide actionable insights.
  • Conduct in-depth analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to track key performance indicators and business metrics.
  • Drive continuous improvement initiatives by identifying process efficiencies and optimization opportunities.
  • Provide team members with proposed commercial actions based on transactional & customer data from our platforms.

What We Want From You

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, or related field.
  • 4+ years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a commercial setting.
  • Experience in customer management and being comfortable presenting data to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in SQL programming for data extraction and manipulation.
  • Experience or willingness to learn programming languages like R or Python for data analysis.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels.
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Qlik Sense, or similar platforms is a plus.
  • Experience building intuitive presentations to visualize data.
  • Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with changing priorities.
  • Solid Powerpoint presentation skills

What We Offer

We are a value driven company with our values We team up, Innovation Drives Us, No Douchebags and Going the Extra Mile at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.

Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:

  • Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
  • Insurance plan, including private healthcare
  • 30 days of paid vacation
  • Parental pay lift
  • Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
  • Lots of social happenings

SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!

If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!

Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.

If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Viktoria Sobolewski or Philip Anderberg at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com, philip.anderberg@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.

With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 950 000 consumers.

Title: Data Analyst, Commercial
Description:
Insurance is all about life. And these days more than ever, it’s all about data. At If, we are developing technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for an analyst with a passion for data to help us accelerate our pace within analytics.

About The Role

You will be working in a cross-functional agile team, generating insights, and improving our digital B2B customer journeys. To succeed in your work, you will utilize flexible and robust data platforms, like Google Cloud and Databricks for data transformations and Power BI for analysis and visualization. This role blends data analysis, stakeholder collaboration, and actionable insights to elevate customer engagement and satisfaction. Changing market trends and influx of data in the largest insurance company in the Nordics offer you a great opportunity to develop yourself and contribute to If’s success in commercial insurances.

Responsibilities of the role include:


Design, develop and maintain operational reports to follow up and optimize performance (i.e., digital sales, CRM activities, etc.).
Deep dive analysis to understand drivers of business performance and customer satisfaction.
Develop analytical data assets/data products to be used in CRM-activities.
Identify and specify needs for new data and take part in implementing new data pipelines.
Provide strategic insights to improve our customer journey.
Supporting users in their understanding of data and analytics, including evaluation of business results and communication with business stakeholders.



About The Team

We strive to be an organization where you as an analyst can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. Even though the work is autonomous, you won’t be left alone. We are team players with a strong drive and ambition to always deliver the best results - and we take pride in having fun along the way. Together we are a large Nordic community of technology and data professionals – over 200 colleagues supporting and pushing each other forward. To learn more how we work and think around technology, data, and analytics, please visit our Tech blog: If Technology – Medium

We offer

In the same way that we place high expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:


An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
Possibility of hybrid workplace
Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
Great insurance benefits



Who are you?

We think that you have a strong interest for digital business and customer experience, but what gets you up in the morning is your interest in data and analytics. You want to work cross functionally to improve customer journeys and to help us understand new and existing customers even better. You have previously worked with analytics within CRM or sales and are comfortable with transforming large amount of data into actionable insights. And you are comfortable with talking to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

We believe in hiring talented candidates and giving them room to grow, but we hope you’ll recognize yourself from the following characterizations:


You have experience from a similar role.
You possess good data transformation and programming skills (e.g., SQL, Python).
You have data visualization experience from BI tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
You have gained some experience in using cloud platforms like Databricks and BigQuery
It would be great if you also have experience with web analytics tools like Google’s stack (incl GA, BigQuery and GTM), understanding of web technology (i.e., HTML or JavaScript), technical CRM understanding (for example with Salesforce) or experience working with CX data and its metrics like NPS.
You have a relevant university degree.
You are fluent in English, and in at least one Nordic language.



Additional information and recruitment process

Applying: Please apply through our recruitment system and attach your CV and answer in the questions on the application form. Please notice that we are not able to process any applications via email.

Application deadline: Last day to apply is 9th of February 2025.

Location: Turku, Espoo, Stockholm, Oslo, or Copenhagen

Employment type: Permanent and full-time

Traveling: Requires some occasional traveling in the Nordics

Background check: Final candidates will undergo a background check before a job offer can be presented.

Questions about the position or the process can be directed to Chapter Lead, Analytics Chapter, Business Area Commercial, Jani Lindén (jani.linden@if.fi).

We are eager to hear from you!

About Us

We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!
Show more

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Konsult
Description:
Astrada söker en ny begåvning att komplettera vårt team med. Hos oss får du chansen att skapa innovativa lösningar som skapar verkliga insikter och beslutsunderlag hos våra kunder. Du får tidigt hoppa in i olika projekt och med stöttning av kompetenta kollegor har du snabbt tagit dig an konsultrollen och utvecklat både dina tekniska kunskaper och generella verksamhetsförståelse. 

 

Om rollen 

Som konsult hos oss arbetar du i parallella projekt med analys av kundens verksamhet och implementering av BI-lösningar. Du jobbar nära kundens projektorganisation och dagliga verksamhet men närmast arbetar du seniora kollegor från Astrada. Du får vara med i hela kedjan genom att omvandla önskemål och behov till färdig systemlösning. För oss är det viktigt att skapa kvalitativa lösningar som är hållbara över tid.  




Vilka är vi? 

Astrada är ett produkt- och konsultbolag inom Data & Analytics som hjälper företag och organisationer i flera branscher runt om i världen att ta fram och implementera systemlösningar för styrning och optimering av verksamheten. Detta kan vara allt från beräkningar av kostnad, lönsamhet eller koldioxidavtryck per produkt inom tillverkningsindustrin, till visuella planeringsunderlag med schemaoptimering inom sjukvården. 

 

Vårt jobb handlar om att ge beslutsfattare rätt information, i rätt tid och vid rätt plats. Därför har vi utvecklat ett eget webbaserat analysverktyg som dessutom är kompatibelt med andra ledande BI-applikationer. Vi verkar i ett ständigt växande område och vår unika kombination av verksamhetskunskap och ett eget AI- och datadrivet system gör att vi snabbt kan bygga och anpassa lösningar för att hjälpa beslutsfattare med de insikter de verkligen behöver. 




Passar vi dig? 

Du kommer att trivas hos oss om du är intresserad av att kombinera dina tekniska kunskaper med ekonomi- och verksamhetsstyrning. Efter en tid här hoppas vi att du är bekväm med att enkelt växla mellan mer tekniska uppgifter till att interagera med verksamheten och skapa lösningar för att utveckla den i rätt riktning. 

 

Astrada arbetar med komplexa och globala organisationer vilket medför ett stort behov av ansvarstagande. För att leverera kontinuerlig kvalitet till dessa kunder värdesätter vi dig som är lyhörd med ett öga för detaljer. Du arbetar tillsammans med dina kollegor för att komma fram till de bästa lösningarna i nära samarbete och dialog med våra kunder. Du är därför kommunikativ och kan förklara tekniska lösningar på ett begripligt sätt samt ger dig an nya uppdrag med ett öppet och lösningsorienterat sinne. Vi uppskattar även dig som kan se ett steg längre och vågar ifrågasätta rutiner och komma med förslag på långsiktiga förbättringar både hos uppdragsgivare och internt.  

Utöver ovanstående tror vi att du: 

Vill utvecklas inom BI, dataanalys och verksamhetsstyrning.    
Har en civilingenjörsutbildning eller master inom data, teknisk fysik, maskinteknik, energi och miljö, systemvetenskap, industriell ekonomi eller liknande. 
Talar och skriver obehindrat både på svenska och engelska. Extra meriterande är det om du även talar finska. 
Gärna besitter kunskaper inom SQL, databashantering eller BI-verktyg, annars får du lära dig det hos oss. 




Det här erbjuder vi dig 

Här får du chansen att jobba inom ett spännande och komplext område på en familjär och stöttande arbetsplats. Vi är en liten organisation med fördelarna av att ha korta beslutsvägar men med högt i tak och stora ambitioner. Hos oss får du utrymme att utvecklas i den riktning du vill med stor frihet att forma din egen karriär. Vi tycker att det är viktigt med balans mellan arbete och vardag och därför är flexibla arbetstider och -lösningar en självklarhet för oss. Arbetet sker mestadels från vårt kontor på Skeppsbron i Stockholm men med frekventa besök hos våra uppdragsgivare.  

 

Låter det här intressant? 

Vi söker dig som snart tar eller nyligen har tagit examen, men även dig med några års erfarenhet inom området.  

Vi rekryterar löpande, så hör av dig så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!  

Frågor skickas till: career@astrada.se

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Map Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!







Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Swedish.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Sweden.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Sweden for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.




About the Data & Insight team

The Data & Insights team’s mission is to transform Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.

About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst at Trustly, you will look at the breadth of our data with a statistical mindset. Through your analytics skills and proficiency in handling data, you will uncover patterns and provide data-driven answers to complex strategic challenges. Depending on the stakeholder’s requests, you will choose adequate solutions to present your insights, ranging from dashboards in our BI tool to deep-dive analysis. In close collaboration with our data foundation team, you will be involved in building a strong and reliable data foundation that will support the analytics needs.




What you’ll do
Taking ownership of entire analytical projects, from defining objectives with our business stakeholders to delivering actionable insights and recommendations
Perform in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business growth and efficiency
Choose adequate analytical methods and tools to convey complex findings in a clear and concise manner
Continuously contribute to improve our Analytics capabilities 
Actively participate in establishing the data-driven culture at Trustly





Who you are
A Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or similar field
At least 3 years of experience within the analytics field, experience with the payments industry is a plus
Having a high degree of autonomy and being able to work independently on complex analyses
Solid and broad analytical skills-set including the ability to use statistical methods
Solid SQL and Python skills
Experience working with BI tools such as QlikSense or Tableau
Excellent communication skills 
Thrive in in a fast growing company








Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.

If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and kindly submit your CV in English.

Title: Global People Data Analyst
Description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.

Role Summary

Are you passionate about data and its potential to drive impactful decisions? As a Global People Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping strategic initiatives by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex People data across global operations. You will ensure data integrity, develop insightful reports, and provide actionable insights to enhance business performance and employee experience. This is your opportunity to work in a global environment, collaborating with key stakeholders to drive innovation and continuous improvement within People & Culture.

Job Responsibilites

Data Analysis and Reporting:



Collect, clean, and analyze global HR data, including workforce demographics, performance metrics, and engagement surveys.
Develop dashboards and reports to visualize key HR metrics for stakeholders.
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement within the organization.



Data Integrity and Governance:



Ensure the accuracy and security of HR data across systems.
Collaborate with HR teams to implement data quality standards and practices.
Maintain compliance with global data privacy regulations such as GDPR.



System Management and Integration:



Partner with IT and HRIS teams to optimize HR systems for effective data management.
Lead the integration of data from multiple global sources into cohesive reporting platforms.
Troubleshoot and resolve data discrepancies across systems.



Stakeholder Collaboration:



Work closely with HR, Finance, and Leadership teams to align data analysis with business objectives.
Present insights and recommendations to stakeholders to enable data-driven decision-making.
Support HR programs such as talent acquisition, retention, and succession planning with data insights.



Strategic Insights and Workforce Planning:



Analyze global workforce trends to predict future HR needs.
Provide input on workforce planning, diversity and inclusion, and organizational development.
Suggest innovative approaches to HR data utilization for continuous improvement.



Who You Are



Higher education in statistics, mathematics, or equivalent work experience in a similar role.
Minimum 2 years of experience working with workforce-related data, ideally in a global or multi-regional context.
Proven expertise in analyzing data for strategic purposes.
Strong understanding of data governance, integrity, and compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR.
Experience with data visualization tools and creating reports tailored for various stakeholders.
Fluent in English with excellent communication skills, Swedish is meritious.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including HR, IT, and leadership.



This role offers the chance to be part of a dynamic, global team where your insights and skills will directly impact strategic decisions and organizational success. If you are analytical, detail-oriented, and thrive in an innovative environment, we encourage you to apply!

Scania Offers

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-02-04. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact hiring manager Jana Sklenarova: jana.sklenarova@scania.com

We look forward to your application!

Title: Product Master Data Specialist
Description:
Solera Sweden offers a wide range of products in the world of beverages, from wines, spirits and beers to non-alcoholic alternatives and snacks. We work with leading brands to provide our customers with quality products to suit all occasions. Our goal is to create refreshing and enjoyable moments for our consumers, customers, partners and employees. As part of the Royal Unibrew Group, we build our success on strong international cooperation, sharing knowledge and resources to strengthen our presence and create added value in the market.

We are looking for a proactive, detail-oriented and enthusiastic Master Data Specialist to join our team!

About the role:

As a Master Data Specialist, you will be responsible for securing valid product data for supply chain flow as well as support getting the data from relevant sources for new product launches. You will handle the different requests for product creation (new products, as well as update of the existing ones) across multiple business functions, systems and applications.

This role will play a pivotal part in managing product master data and ensuring that our product information is properly organized, accurate, consistent, and up to date across all systems and processes. Additionally, you will play a critical part in optimizing, streamlining and enforcing data processes and procedures to support business operations, decision-making, and compliance.

In this role you will be collaborating with cross-functional teams including Logistics, Sales, Marketing, Finance, and IT, to drive data quality and governance in a fast-paced FMCG environment.




What you will do:

Master Data Management:

Maintain and manage product master data in SAP with help from HQ office to ensure that master data (e.g. products, costs, pricing, and materials) is high quality, up-to-date and in line with company standards.
Participate in new product launch projects to set up materials in SAP and Validoo in line with supplier systems and market guidelines for respective channel (wholesale, monopoly and retail)

Data Quality & Governance:

Develop and enforce material master data standards, policies, and procedures.
Monitor data quality and conduct root cause analysis for material master data related issues and implement corrective actions.

System & Process Optimization:
Support the implementation of new systems, tools, or processes related to material master data management.
Identify opportunities for automation and process improvements to enhance data accuracy and efficiency.
Reporting & Documentation:
Generate regular reports on material master data accuracy, completeness, and adherence to KPIs.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for material master data processes and workflows.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Act as the central point of contact for master data inquiries and changes.
Work with stakeholders (e.g Product Coordinators, Marketing, Sales, Logistics, Finance, HQ and IT) to ensure alignment on data requirements and support business processes and resolve questions and issues.
Provide training and support to teams on material master data processes and best practices.

Who you are:

The ideal candidate will be hands-on, deeply involved in data processes, and passionate about maintaining high data quality standards. We are primarily looking for the potential for future top performances, and that is also what we emphasize in the selection decision, but the following requirements are keys to succeed in the role.

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Data Management, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in product/material master data management and experience on FMCG operations
Proficiency in SAP, Validoo, and data analysis tools (Excel, Power BI, etc.)
Familiarity with GS1 quality assurance requirements and process flow for Retail (Monopoly is merit) is a strong advantage.
Excellent attention to detail, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.

Why come work for us?

Solera is the place for you if you share with us the idea that it's refreshing to be in a workplace where:

The work culture encourages entrepreneurial thinking and activities
The decision-making power is largely where the work is done
Our glass is always half full. We have a positive attitude, and we are curious. We believe that there are opportunities in all situations, people and things
We are hungry for success together: together we develop new ideas that we learn from and work together to turn challenges into opportunities. We are not afraid of mistakes!
We are on growth path, and we do not have a table ready set, but we are agile, flexible and creative

How to apply

The deadline for applications is 10 February. Be quick as we process applications during the application period and will fill the position as soon as we find the right person.

  • We are hungry for success together: together we develop new ideas that we learn from and work together to turn challenges into opportunities. We are not afraid of mistakes!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.

Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.




We at the Infrastructure team, work on a vision to empower our product-oriented teams with a complete self-service analytics platform to make data-driven decisions possible in Truecaller, guaranteeing the stability, velocity, and delivery of the mainstream events pipeline.




As a Data Engineer, you will play an important role in the Data Platform team which is responsible for building and maintaining a scalable, robust, self-service analytics platform.




What do we expect from you:

3+ years of experience in data engineering
Experience working with orchestration tool (ex: Airflow)
Experience working with a large data set
Experience building complex ETL pipelines
Experience working with cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, or Azure
Strong programming skills in Spark with Scala and Python
Experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Git
Strong understanding of Software Engineering practices and principles
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take initiative to own the problems that come up and solve them




What will you work on:

Maintaining and improving the ingestion pipeline to reliably deliver billions of events daily in defined SLA
Provide support for all teams in building and optimizing their complex pipelines
Work closely with other teams to identify pain points and problems around the platform
Develop new tools and frameworks to improve the data platform
Facilitate company-wide to be data-driven
Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts to help support their work in production
Work with vast projects such as building an ML platform and streaming use cases
Setup best practices and processes around software and data development




It would be great if you also have:

Working with messaging systems like Kafka
Knowledge in Kubernetes
Hands-on experience with any streaming platform
Experience managing data warehouse in BigQuery or Redshift




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?




We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:




A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!




Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

Title: Trainee Data Engineer/ML Ops Sundbyberg
Description:
Som trainee hos oss är du med och bygger it-infrastruktur som är en del av grunden för ett fungerande samhälle. Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Vi skapar möjligheter och förutsättningar – resten är upp till dig. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!

Om jobbet

Som trainee inom systemutveckling ingår du i ett av våra agila utvecklingsteam från dag ett. I nära samverkan med verksamheten levererar teamen färdiga lösningar som förenklar för miljontals privatpersoner och företag. Våra system bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle genom att skapa förutsättningar för bland annat beskattning, folkbokföring, demokratiska val, brottsbekämpning och internationella samarbeten.

Skatteverkets it-traineeprogram är inne på sitt fjärde år och vi planerar nu för nästa start där vi vill

anställa upp emot 25 traineer på sju olika orter. Under programmet får du kunskap om Skatteverkets verksamhet och bygger på din erfarenhet. Du har en individuell utvecklingsplan som följs upp och revideras under programperioden så att du kan skapa det bästa upplägget utifrån dina förutsättningar och verksamhetens behov. Du har en erfaren mentor som stöd och bollplank. Traineeprogrammet pågår 12 månader och din vardag består av praktik, utbildning, temadagar och workshops, parallellt med att du jobbar i teamet. Programmets upplägg är noga framtaget för att du ska ha den bästa starten på din karriär. Självklart inleds programmet med en kick-off.

Som Data Engineer/ML Ops Trainee arbetar du i ett agilt team och utvecklar lösningar som kombinerar avancerad datahantering och maskininlärning för att skapa nytta för medborgare och företag. Du bidrar till Skatteverkets digitala utveckling genom att bygga skalbara dataflöden och pipelines för att möjliggöra effektiva ML-tillämpningar och avancerad analys. Dina arbetsuppgifter omfattar hela utvecklingsprocessen, från arkitektur och design till dataförberedelse, modellträning, implementation, automatisering, test, drift och förvaltning. Du arbetar nära verksamheten och levererar frekvent, vilket kräver god samarbetsförmåga, flexibilitet och problemlösningsförmåga.

Teamet består av kompetenser från verksamhet, IT och data science. Du kommer att arbeta med tekniker som Python, Java, Red Hat OpenShift, DevOps, mikrotjänster samt verktyg för datahantering som Denodo och databaser. Exempel på tillämpningar inkluderar att bygga effektiva dataflöden för klassificering av inkommande e-post, identifiering av fel och fusk inom beskattning och folkbokföring samt olika tillämpningar av social nätverksanalys.

Som trainee får du använda din problemlösningsförmåga till att skapa system som underlättar vardagen för många. På vår stora it-avdelning med nära 1500 kollegor har du möjlighet att utvecklas samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid.

Du tillhör Data- och analyssektion 1 på enhet Gemensamma Tjänster på it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg. På vår sektion är vi 22 kollegor.

Om dig

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.

I det här jobbet ska du:


vara en teamspelare och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar
ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker och att kunna tänka om när det behövs
vara nyfiken, gilla utmaningar och ha förmågan att driva din egen och verksamhetens utveckling framåt
uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och kommunicera på ett engagerande sätt.



Du ska även ha:


en pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning inom it (minst 180 hp) från högskola eller universitet med examen från år 2023 eller framåt, dock senast augusti 2025
erfarenhet av systemutveckling i programmeringsspråk Python, Java och SQL från studietiden.



Bra att veta

Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.

En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.

På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.

När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.

Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/537 | Kontakt: Thomas Carlbring, sektionschef thomas.carlbring@skatteverket.se, Jesper Österberg, hr-specialist jesper.osterberg@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-12-16 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-31
Show more
HTML:
Som trainee hos oss är du med och bygger it-infrastruktur som är en del av grunden för ett fungerande samhälle. Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Vi skapar möjligheter och förutsättningar – resten är upp till dig. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!

Om jobbet

Som trainee inom systemutveckling ingår du i ett av våra agila utvecklingsteam från dag ett. I nära samverkan med verksamheten levererar teamen färdiga lösningar som förenklar för miljontals privatpersoner och företag. Våra system bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle genom att skapa förutsättningar för bland annat beskattning, folkbokföring, demokratiska val, brottsbekämpning och internationella samarbeten.

Skatteverkets it-traineeprogram är inne på sitt fjärde år och vi planerar nu för nästa start där vi vill

anställa upp emot 25 traineer på sju olika orter. Under programmet får du kunskap om Skatteverkets verksamhet och bygger på din erfarenhet. Du har en individuell utvecklingsplan som följs upp och revideras under programperioden så att du kan skapa det bästa upplägget utifrån dina förutsättningar och verksamhetens behov. Du har en erfaren mentor som stöd och bollplank. Traineeprogrammet pågår 12 månader och din vardag består av praktik, utbildning, temadagar och workshops, parallellt med att du jobbar i teamet. Programmets upplägg är noga framtaget för att du ska ha den bästa starten på din karriär. Självklart inleds programmet med en kick-off.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
We are seeking to hire a Quantitative Researcher to join the Quant Research group within Nasdaq Europe’s Economic and Statistical Research team.

The quant research unit acts as the central research hub providing quantitative research and analytics services to multiple Nasdaq business units such as cash equities (listing and trading), equity derivatives, and market data with the overarching aim of improving Nasdaq’s trading offering, capital formation, and market structure within the Nordic and Baltic region. Select projects include supporting product development work on new market models and order types, helping Nasdaq’s customers optimize trading/routing decisions, and designing incentive schemes to attract order flow and measuring the efficacy of such initiatives.

What will you be doing?


Employ advanced statistical, quantitative, and econometric techniques to conduct top quality research in areas such as market microstructure, pricing strategy, dark and lit fragmentation, and market liquidity.
Employ artificial intelligence and machine learning models while developing trading protocols, order types, routing strategies, etc.; designing and implementing proof-of-concept research for new product ideas; work with relevant engineering teams to deploy successful product ideas in production.
Take end-to-end ownership of research projects including defining the project scope, building data pipelines, data analysis and visualization, communication of research output, and industrialization of research findings.
Contribute to improvements to the cloud-based research infrastructure and to the development of core analytical capabilities and model libraries.
Create clear, concise, and organized communication materials (e.g., reports, presentations, procedures, and technical documentation) for consumption by audiences with different levels of subject-matter expertise.
Independently work with and supervise students and interns on specific projects.
Develop expertise in significant market, strategy, and/or policy areas.
Establish and maintain relationships with key stakeholders.


We expect you to have


Advanced degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Financial Engineering or equivalent.
Up to 3 years of work experience employing statistical/econometric techniques and/or artificial intelligence and machine learning models within a quantitative research environment to produce robust, actionable research insights.
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar, working with specialized statistical tools and large data sets. Strong skills in SQL (MS, PostgreSQL, Redshift)
Experience applying sound scientific practices, formulating and testing hypothesis, back testing, verifying accuracy and predictive ability of models, etc.
Experience in producing actionable decision material for senior management, and the ability to explain complex and technical concepts in a simple and meaningful manner
Proficient English language skills


It would be great if you have


A background working as a quantitative researcher in the finance industry, preferably in a trading environment
Experience in transforming prototype models into production resilient application frameworks.
Experience with cloud services (AWS, Redshift)
Experience working in a governed development environment, having version control, doing code review, producing technical documentation, etc.


What do we offer you?


Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Competitive salary and benefits package including monetary bonus and equity.
32 vacationdays, 6 additional flexdays.
Employee Stock Purchase Program Nasdaq stocks with a discount
Pension plan
Fitness allowance
Flexible health Insurance program


Does this sound like you?

This role provides a great opportunity to work within a highly skilled team! To succeed in this role, you need to be highly analytical, meticulous, and thorough while handling large amounts of data. Our short deadlines also place high demands on service mindedness, efficiency, and expertise. We offer you access to detailed datasets that provide a microscopic view into the functioning of financial markets.

This is a permanent position located in Stockholm. The company allows the flexibility to work half a week on-site and remotely (Hybrid model).

Nasdaq is a vibrant and entrepreneurial company where everyone is encouraged to take initiative, challenge the status quo, and take intelligent risks. We want everyone to feel welcome and bring their authentic self to work. Every day, we are building a culture where we all feel connected, supported, and empowered.

As the selection and interview process is ongoing, please submit your application in English as soon as possible.

Come as You Are

Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
Show more

Title: Dataanalytiker
Description:
Om jobbet

Vi söker en självgående dataanalytiker med vana att projektleda surveyundersökningar och bearbeta surveydata.




Om Infostat

Infostat är ett analysföretag som levererar verktyg och systemlösningar för kvantitativa samhälls- och marknadsanalyser. Infostats databaser med samhälls- och marknadsdata är branschledande och kopplar samman all slags offentlig statistik, geografiska data, högupplöst rörelsedata och enkätundersökningar. Infostat arbetar med kunder och uppdrag inom politik och påverkan, retail och konsument samt urban utveckling.




Arbetsuppgifter

Projektledning av surveyundersökningar, insamling och bearbetning av surveydata, undersökningar såväl i Infostats regi som på kunduppdrag;
I viss utsträckning hantering av kunddialog;
Databearbetning och databasutveckling med fokus på samhälls- och marknadsdata;
Dataanalys med fokus på samhälls- och marknadsfrågor.

Du kommer att ingå i ett litet, högspecialiserat team med lång erfarenhet av dataanalys. Som del av teamet kommer du ha stora möjligheter att vidareutveckla dig inom många typer av dataanalys, exempelvis inom GIS och rörelsedata.




Din profil

För rollen söker vi efter en person som har:

Relevant högskoleutbildning (som berör kvantitativa metoder) eller motsvarande kunskaper,
Förtrogenhet med att samla in och arbeta med surveydata,
Vana av att arbeta med skriptbaserad analys (i dagsläget används Python samt Power Query/DAX, men kan man andra språk går det att lära sig nya),
God känsla för skriven svenska,
Allmänt intresse för och kunskap om aktuella samhällsfrågor.

Rollen ställer särskilda krav på förmågan att arbeta strukturerat och systematiskt med fokus på detaljer: kalendrar, listor och fasta rutiner.




Det finns många vägar till en analytikerroll och vi värderar alla slags meriter och erfarenheter inom området. Du kan vara i början av din karriär eller ha lång erfarenhet.




Tjänsten

Heltid, med placering i Stockholm. Anställningen är tills vidare som inleds med 6 mån provanställning. Goda personalförmåner, bra lokaler i hjärtat av Stockholm och möjlighet till hemarbete och flexibilitet. Infostat har kollektivavtal och är medlem i branschorganisationen Tech Sverige och Svenskt Näringsliv.




Tillträde

Tjänsten kan tillträdas omgående när vi hittat rätt matchning. Intervjuer görs fortlöpande. Intresserade bör därför söka tjänsten snarast genom att skicka ett kortfattat CV och ett personligt brev.




Kontakt

För mer information om tjänsten kontakta Peter Santesson, vd: peter.santesson@infostat.se

Show more
