  • A diverse, friendly and international environment 
  • Modern office in central Copenhagen or Oslo

Title: BI Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Why join us in 2025?

Think of the digital tools we use daily - from virtual shopping to contactless payments. They're shaping our future. Join us in influencing the future of digital payments in an innovative environment. With our global merger, the opportunities for personal growth and collaboration are immense.

If you join us in the role of Commercial BI Analyst, this is what you can expect from us:


Attractive salary and an overall competitive package
Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
Hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours
Home equipment allowance
Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
Private health insurance
Healthcare cost reimbursements
Sponsored sports activities
Voluntary pension fund (company-sponsored retirement plan or pension)
Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company


About Your Future Role

We’re on the lookout for a curious and self-driven data analytics star that will be part of the strong MS Commercial team of BI Developers and data scientists, where our vision is to deliver best in class sales reporting and performance management for our sales organisation within the exciting and growing payment industry. Our team is split between Copenhagen and Frankfurt, so both options are available as home base.

We deliver a governed self-service BI solution driven by our Alteryx Server and PowerBI. Further, we support MS Sales with analytics, reporting and project management of strategic initiatives. We are part of a European team on a mission to scale the performance management infrastructure across existing and new markets, thereby supporting the continued growth ambition across Europe.

You’ll be empowering Commercial teams across Merchant Services

As Commercial BI Developer/Analyst you’ll join an open and sharing community with highly skilled and ambitious colleagues. You can come as you are and be at your best at Nets. You’ll find the freedom to balance an exciting job with life outside of work.

Your key responsibilities in this role will be:

Your key tasks and responsibilities will be to further develop our analytics and reporting capabilities leveraging our Alteryx Server and PowerBI setup to automate our sales performance reporting and help drive sales improvements. Further, you are expected to play an important role in expanding the reporting framework across our European organisation and drive BI development projects independently. An ambitious student will be supporting the team in maintenance and development. You need great stakeholder management skills, as you will be working with stakeholders across Sales, Finance, BI and IT developers to develop best-in-class reporting and defining the hero KPIs to steer our business. Further, you will assist sales directors and team leads to improve their business through sparring and conducting ad hoc analyses and optimisation proposals on selected topics.

What makes you the best person for this job?

As you read about the role, are you eager to learn more? If so, review the qualifications that fit you for the position. Remember, beyond your skills and experience, it's your potential that sets you up for success in your daily tasks.

Qualifications needed to be successful in this role:


Bachelor or Master’s degree within a relevant field
Experience working with PowerBI or Tableau is a big plus
Experience working with Alteryx is a big plus
Experience working with Sales is a plus
Fluent English both written and spoken is a must


Additional skills and experience that would make you stand out:


Curious
Eager to learn and self-improve
Problem solving mindset
Analytical
A team player


Life at Nexi

Discover more about us and what it's like to be part of Nexi by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm_source=career-platform&utm_medium=job-openings&utm_content=standard . Learn about our values, meet our communities, and see how we are shaping the future of digital payments together.

Apply now!

If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.

By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

QUALIFICATIONS

About Us

Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies? Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Why join us in 2025?

Think of the digital tools we use daily - from virtual shopping to contactless payments. They're shaping our future. Join us in influencing the future of digital payments in an innovative environment. With our global merger, the opportunities for personal growth and collaboration are immense.

If you join us in the role of Commercial BI Analyst, this is what you can expect from us:

  • Attractive salary and an overall competitive package
  • Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
  • Hybrid way of working
  • Flexible work hours
  • Home equipment allowance
  • Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
  • Private health insurance
  • Healthcare cost reimbursements
  • Sponsored sports activities
  • Voluntary pension fund (company-sponsored retirement plan or pension)
  • Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company

About Your Future Role

We’re on the lookout for a curious and self-driven data analytics star that will be part of the strong MS Commercial team of BI Developers and data scientists, where our vision is to deliver best in class sales reporting and performance management for our sales organisation within the exciting and growing payment industry. Our team is split between Copenhagen and Frankfurt, so both options are available as home base.

We deliver a governed self-service BI solution driven by our Alteryx Server and PowerBI. Further, we support MS Sales with analytics, reporting and project management of strategic initiatives. We are part of a European team on a mission to scale the performance management infrastructure across existing and new markets, thereby supporting the continued growth ambition across Europe.

You’ll be empowering Commercial teams across Merchant Services

As Commercial BI Developer/Analyst you’ll join an open and sharing community with highly skilled and ambitious colleagues. You can come as you are and be at your best at Nets. You’ll find the freedom to balance an exciting job with life outside of work.

Your key responsibilities in this role will be:

Your key tasks and responsibilities will be to further develop our analytics and reporting capabilities leveraging our Alteryx Server and PowerBI setup to automate our sales performance reporting and help drive sales improvements. Further, you are expected to play an important role in expanding the reporting framework across our European organisation and drive BI development projects independently. An ambitious student will be supporting the team in maintenance and development. You need great stakeholder management skills, as you will be working with stakeholders across Sales, Finance, BI and IT developers to develop best-in-class reporting and defining the hero KPIs to steer our business. Further, you will assist sales directors and team leads to improve their business through sparring and conducting ad hoc analyses and optimisation proposals on selected topics.

What makes you the best person for this job?

As you read about the role, are you eager to learn more? If so, review the qualifications that fit you for the position. Remember, beyond your skills and experience, it's your potential that sets you up for success in your daily tasks.

Qualifications needed to be successful in this role:

  • Bachelor or Master’s degree within a relevant field
  • Experience working with PowerBI or Tableau is a big plus
  • Experience working with Alteryx is a big plus
  • Experience working with Sales is a plus
  • Fluent English both written and spoken is a must

Additional skills and experience that would make you stand out:

  • Curious
  • Eager to learn and self-improve
  • Problem solving mindset
  • Analytical
  • A team player

Life at Nexi

Discover more about us and what it's like to be part of Nexi by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm_source=career-platform&utm_medium=job-openings&utm_content=standard . Learn about our values, meet our communities, and see how we are shaping the future of digital payments together.

Apply now!

If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.

By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

 QUALIFICATIONS

About Us

Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies? Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
If your dream and ambition is to be part of a digital transformation journey, where you can have a direct impact on data-driven decision making and implement solutions that make a difference, then you might be the data analyst we are missing. In Business Support we are on the lookout for our next team member, with a passion for their field and an innovative mindset. Could that be you?   

Apply now for a life-changing career!

The position
As a Data Analyst of our digital transformation team, you will play a key role in shaping the organization's journey toward digitalization and data-driven decision-making. Your expertise in digital tools and stakeholder collaboration will enable the optimization of processes, innovation, and the creation of impactful solutions that drive business value.

Your main tasks will be to:



Act as an internal consultant to analyze and understand the business's needs.
Design, develop, and maintain digital solutions using tools like Tableau, Alteryx, Power Automate, Power BI, and Power Apps.
Collaborate continuously with stakeholders and team members to ensure transparency and value delivery.
Innovate and streamline business processes through data-driven insights and digitalization.
Work on business cases and ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision-making and prioritize effectively.




Qualifications 

As a person, you bring strong analytical skills paired with a structured and transparent approach to your work. Your collaborative mindset and ability to engage effectively with teams make you a valuable team player who thrives in dynamic and innovative environments.

To succeed in this role, you have to:



MSc in Science, Innovation, or Business Field, e.g. data engineering, business analytics or UX/ innovation,
Experience with analyzing and visualizing data,
Have hands-on experience with the Microsoft Power platform (Power App, Power Automate, dataverse, etc.) and Power BI (while experience with other BI tools such as Tableau and Alteryx is a plus)
Experience in process development frameworks such as “double diamond” is a plus
Experience in using O365 MS Office Tools with a passion for generating insights from data
Professional proficiency in English




About The Department 

The Business Support is responsible for developing and facilitating cross-departmental processes, projects, and products supporting the rest of the FPMSAT departments to succeed with their projects and goals. This means we are a group of highly skilled and specialized people who help the business optimize processes, solve problems, and make better decisions by applying our areas of expertise. In terms of Digitalisation, this means facilitating a change from manual to digital processes by introducing the right tool at the right time.

 

What kind of team is waiting for you? We stand out as a very lively and most diverse team, with experts from various educational backgrounds. We are both men and women, some of us freshly graduated and others with many years of experience backing us up. At work, although ambitions are high, we try to keep a light and informal tone. You will be a fully-fledged member of the team from day one, and we will train and onboard you with great care.   

Working at Novo Nordisk
Novo Nordisk is its people. We know that life is anything but linear and balancing what is important at different stages of our career is never easy. That’s why we make room for diverse life situations, always putting people first. We value our employees for the unique skills they bring to the table, and we work continuously to bring out the best in them. Working at Novo Nordisk is working toward something bigger than ourselves, and it’s a collective effort. Novo Nordisk relies on the joint potential and collaboration of its more than 40,000 employees. Together, we go further. Together, we’re life-changing.

Contact 
For further questions contact Manager Mia Thiesen on +45 3444 8871.

Deadline 
28 January 2025.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. Title: Data Analyst Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are a digitally native technology services company where innovation, design and engineering meet scale. We use some of the latest technologies in the digital and cognitive field to empower organizations in every aspect.

Vertic, Globant division is currently looking for a Data Analyst to join its Globant GUT Strategy Studio in Copenhagen. In that role you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data from various sources into insights that drive strategic decision-making in marketing, branding, and communications. You will be an integral part of the 'Insights & Strategy' department, a dynamic team of analysts, strategists, and media specialists. Your expertise will be crucial in conducting thorough analyses to generate insights that empower both internal teams and clients to make informed decisions across brand strategy, product launches, campaign planning, media planning, and engagement strategies.

Your day to day work will be shaped by the projects we have at that given period of time, but across the year you can expect approximately:


Data Analysis 60%: The majority of your time will be spent hands-on conducting data analysis to deliver on insights projects for our clients and internal teams.
Take ownership of digital insights projects from start to finish, including briefing, scoping, data collection, analysis, drawing conclusions, providing recommendations, and delivering presentations.
Become an expert in the digital insights services and methods that we offer (social listening, search engine analysis, influencer mapping, web analytics, competitor profiling etc.) through a range of SaaS tools (e.g. Brandwatch, SEMRUSH, Traackr etc.) and our custom built toolbox of AI applications for data processing and analysis (written in Python).
Insights Communication 20%: An important part of your job will be to reflect on what the data and insights mean in the context of our clients and the challenges they face.
Consolidate and distil often complex and larger data briefs (from our own digital insights, client provided market research, interviews, surveys, brand plans/ strategies etc.) into clear, impactful insights that inform business, brand, and marketing strategies/ decisions.
Create data visualizations and write reports that effectively convey your work.
Liaison with client and internal teams (account, creative, project management) and collaborate closely with Insights & Strategy colleagues (strategists, campaign planners).
Data Science 20%: We constantly innovate the insights services that we offer. You will play an important role in testing and suggesting new approaches as part of your work. Particularly exploring how to keep leveraging the fast-developing space of Generative AI in data analysis and insights work.
Continuously enhance our insights services by exploring new data sources, tools, testing and developing innovative frameworks, integration of new technologies (e.g., AI/LLMs) and refining how results are created and presented.
Support in the development of new custom AI tools (written in Python) and the updating and refinement of existing tools.
Define approaches to solve new requirements, problems, or data use cases.



What will help you succeed:


Bachelor's or Master's degrees in Data Science, Statistics, Business, Marketing, or a related discipline.
A minimum of 3 years in data analysis, business intelligence, or data science.
Strong data literacy and analytics skills.
Business acumen with a strategic mindset.
Good communication skills, with the ability to clearly present findings and recommendations to diverse audiences.
Proficiency in Python and experience working with Jupyter Notebooks.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau.
Familiarity with digital intelligence tools such as social listening platforms (e.g. Brandwatch, Netbase) and search/ web analysis tools (e.g. Semrush, Google/Adobe Analytics etc.)
Fluency in written and spoken English.



Bonus, but not required, experience:


Experience with graph databases such as Neo4j
Experience with web analytics (Adobe, Google).
Experience with healthcare, life science, medico, and pharmaceutical industries.
Experience with the b2b software industry space.



At Globant we believe that an inclusive culture and a diverse environment makes us stronger. We encourage people to have an inclusive spirit as our global footprint expands. We seek to generate a place of inspiration and growth for everyone. A safe space, based on equity as a value, where everyone's careers can be promoted and developed in the same way. There is no innovation without diversity and there is no improvement without plurality.

Are you ready?

Job Segment: Database, Data Analyst, Testing, Business Development, Market Research, Technology, Data, Marketing, Sales

Job Segment: Database, Data Analyst, Testing, Business Development, Market Research, Technology, Data, Marketing, Sales

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Carry1st is Africa's leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, publishing, and fintech, we scale awesome content in frontier markets by solving hard problems. Across our publishing and Pay1st business lines, we are partnered with top global game companies like Riot Games, Activision, and Stillfront. We are backed by top investors like: a16z, Bitkraft, Google, Konvoy, Riot Games, Sony and Nas.

As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst you will generate insights into our players and our acquisition campaigns, leading to strategic recommendations and operational optimisations that drive cost efficient acquisition of high-valued customers.

You will...


Insights & Optimisation: Utilise advanced analytics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities, translating these into strategic recommendations and/or operational optimisation
Business Needs to Analytical Solutions: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business questions & hypotheses into structured analysis, defining key metrics to track success
Reporting: Develop, operationalise, and maintain dashboards & automated reports - to visualise key performance indicators for senior management and to aid operational decisioning for marketing teams
Experimentation: Design and evaluate A/B tests to validate hypotheses, using deep dives and segmentations to further guide the UA roadmap
Data Management: Ensure data accuracy and integrity, establishing best practices where there is no single source of truth



Requirements

What makes you a great candidate?


Strong understanding of the mobile advertising space - networks, bidding systems, & algorithms - and fluent with the key funnel metrics - CTR, CVR, CPI, ARPU, Retention, LTV
Fluent in SQL. Proficiency in Tableau and Python pluses
Strong analytical skills backed by statistical fundamentals
Strong problem solving acumen backed by the ability to tackle ambiguity
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work cross-functionally with Marketing, Product, and Data teams



Benefits

What will it be like to work at Carry1st?

Carry1st is a fast-paced and dynamic place to work. Our team is diverse and global as we operate fully-remotely across 25+ countries. At Carry1st, you will have the opportunity to...


Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
Grow with a VC-backed startup at the intersection of gaming and fintech
Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create



Some Additional Perks...


Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively
Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day


We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!

Learn More About Carry1st...


Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st
VentureBeat announced that Carry1st has raised $27 million to develop and publish mobile games in Africa
Remerge hosted Cordel on a podcast to discuss Carry1st and the African gaming market
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Commercial
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Insurance is all about life. And these days more than ever, it’s all about data. At If, we are developing technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for an analyst with a passion for data to help us accelerate our pace within analytics.

About The Role

You will be working in a cross-functional agile team, generating insights, and improving our digital B2B customer journeys. To succeed in your work, you will utilize flexible and robust data platforms, like Google Cloud and Databricks for data transformations and Power BI for analysis and visualization. This role blends data analysis, stakeholder collaboration, and actionable insights to elevate customer engagement and satisfaction. Changing market trends and influx of data in the largest insurance company in the Nordics offer you a great opportunity to develop yourself and contribute to If’s success in commercial insurances.

Responsibilities of the role include:


Design, develop and maintain operational reports to follow up and optimize performance (i.e., digital sales, CRM activities, etc.).
Deep dive analysis to understand drivers of business performance and customer satisfaction.
Develop analytical data assets/data products to be used in CRM-activities.
Identify and specify needs for new data and take part in implementing new data pipelines.
Provide strategic insights to improve our customer journey.
Supporting users in their understanding of data and analytics, including evaluation of business results and communication with business stakeholders.



About The Team

We strive to be an organization where you as an analyst can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. Even though the work is autonomous, you won’t be left alone. We are team players with a strong drive and ambition to always deliver the best results - and we take pride in having fun along the way. Together we are a large Nordic community of technology and data professionals – over 200 colleagues supporting and pushing each other forward. To learn more how we work and think around technology, data, and analytics, please visit our Tech blog: If Technology – Medium

We offer

In the same way that we place high expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:


An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
Possibility of hybrid workplace
Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
Great insurance benefits



Who are you?

We think that you have a strong interest for digital business and customer experience, but what gets you up in the morning is your interest in data and analytics. You want to work cross functionally to improve customer journeys and to help us understand new and existing customers even better. You have previously worked with analytics within CRM or sales and are comfortable with transforming large amount of data into actionable insights. And you are comfortable with talking to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

We believe in hiring talented candidates and giving them room to grow, but we hope you’ll recognize yourself from the following characterizations:


You have experience from a similar role.
You possess good data transformation and programming skills (e.g., SQL, Python).
You have data visualization experience from BI tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
You have gained some experience in using cloud platforms like Databricks and BigQuery
It would be great if you also have experience with web analytics tools like Google’s stack (incl GA, BigQuery and GTM), understanding of web technology (i.e., HTML or JavaScript), technical CRM understanding (for example with Salesforce) or experience working with CX data and its metrics like NPS.
You have a relevant university degree.
You are fluent in English, and in at least one Nordic language.



Additional information and recruitment process

Applying: Please apply through our recruitment system and attach your CV and answer in the questions on the application form. Please notice that we are not able to process any applications via email.

Application deadline: Last day to apply is 9th of February 2025.

Location: Turku, Espoo, Stockholm, Oslo, or Copenhagen

Employment type: Permanent and full-time

Traveling: Requires some occasional traveling in the Nordics

Background check: Final candidates will undergo a background check before a job offer can be presented.

Questions about the position or the process can be directed to Chapter Lead, Analytics Chapter, Business Area Commercial, Jani Lindén (jani.linden@if.fi).

We are eager to hear from you!

About Us

We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!
Show more
HTML:
Insurance is all about life. And these days more than ever, it’s all about data. At If, we are developing technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for an analyst with a passion for data to help us accelerate our pace within analytics.

About The Role

You will be working in a cross-functional agile team, generating insights, and improving our digital B2B customer journeys. To succeed in your work, you will utilize flexible and robust data platforms, like Google Cloud and Databricks for data transformations and Power BI for analysis and visualization. This role blends data analysis, stakeholder collaboration, and actionable insights to elevate customer engagement and satisfaction. Changing market trends and influx of data in the largest insurance company in the Nordics offer you a great opportunity to develop yourself and contribute to If’s success in commercial insurances.

Responsibilities of the role include:

  • Design, develop and maintain operational reports to follow up and optimize performance (i.e., digital sales, CRM activities, etc.).
  • Deep dive analysis to understand drivers of business performance and customer satisfaction.
  • Develop analytical data assets/data products to be used in CRM-activities.
  • Identify and specify needs for new data and take part in implementing new data pipelines.
  • Provide strategic insights to improve our customer journey.
  • Supporting users in their understanding of data and analytics, including evaluation of business results and communication with business stakeholders.


About The Team

We strive to be an organization where you as an analyst can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. Even though the work is autonomous, you won’t be left alone. We are team players with a strong drive and ambition to always deliver the best results - and we take pride in having fun along the way. Together we are a large Nordic community of technology and data professionals – over 200 colleagues supporting and pushing each other forward. To learn more how we work and think around technology, data, and analytics, please visit our Tech blog: If Technology – Medium

We offer

In the same way that we place high expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:

  • An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome
  • Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
  • Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
  • Possibility of hybrid workplace
  • Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
  • Great insurance benefits


Who are you?

We think that you have a strong interest for digital business and customer experience, but what gets you up in the morning is your interest in data and analytics. You want to work cross functionally to improve customer journeys and to help us understand new and existing customers even better. You have previously worked with analytics within CRM or sales and are comfortable with transforming large amount of data into actionable insights. And you are comfortable with talking to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

We believe in hiring talented candidates and giving them room to grow, but we hope you’ll recognize yourself from the following characterizations:

  • You have experience from a similar role.
  • You possess good data transformation and programming skills (e.g., SQL, Python).
  • You have data visualization experience from BI tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
  • You have gained some experience in using cloud platforms like Databricks and BigQuery
  • It would be great if you also have experience with web analytics tools like Google’s stack (incl GA, BigQuery and GTM), understanding of web technology (i.e., HTML or JavaScript), technical CRM understanding (for example with Salesforce) or experience working with CX data and its metrics like NPS.
  • You have a relevant university degree.
  • You are fluent in English, and in at least one Nordic language.


Additional information and recruitment process

Applying: Please apply through our recruitment system and attach your CV and answer in the questions on the application form. Please notice that we are not able to process any applications via email.

Application deadline: Last day to apply is 9th of February 2025.

Location: Turku, Espoo, Stockholm, Oslo, or Copenhagen

Employment type: Permanent and full-time

Traveling: Requires some occasional traveling in the Nordics

Background check: Final candidates will undergo a background check before a job offer can be presented.

Questions about the position or the process can be directed to Chapter Lead, Analytics Chapter, Business Area Commercial, Jani Lindén (jani.linden@if.fi).

We are eager to hear from you!

About Us
We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!

Title: Financial Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Would you like to become Satair’ s new Financial Data Analyst and evolve in a challenging and international context?

Do you want to provide quality work, managing and balancing a variety of stakeholders and interests? Are you eager to take on a lot of responsibility? Don’t hesitate - just come on board our Commercial Controlling team and take off!

What the job is …

You are setting the standards!

Your role will be to support the Controlling Team in the analysis of financial data sets related to the product & services scope through a solid expertise in analytics and tool development and to support the digital transformation of our Product & Services Controlling activity by being a credible and professional interlocutor to IT.

As Satair is a part of Airbus, you will be part of a bigger company but still be part of a small “village” in Copenhagen.

Among Other Things, You Will


Routing SAP source data into a BW environment to make it available for reporting by creating Datasets and Dataproducts in Skywise
Develop, test and implement suitable analytical models to identify meaningful patterns or trends from complex data sets and types
Continuously improve the controlling reporting & planning tools
Communicate findings through effective and easy-to-understand data visualizations adapted to the controlling needs
Be the credible and professional operational focal point for topics related to the digitalization of our finance activities within Finance and Satair overall
Support business execution in line with Ethics and Compliance rules, as well as escalate Ethics & compliance questions to the relevant stakeholder


Your challenges will be to


Deliver on time & quality analysis on financial data while seeking permanently for further automations
Be the focal point to IT Business Intelligence on Financial tools & systems
Understand Financial Controlling needs
Be able to work fully autonomous and remotely (manager in Hamburg)




We are looking for someone skilled!

Who are you?

You are educated in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration or equivalent with a strong interest and/or experience in data analytics. Ideally you have already gained experience with SAP systems (e.g. HANA/Analytics Cloud) and you have from your studies or previous work assignments detailed knowledge of data analytics tools (i.e. Qlik Sense, Skywise Slate). In addition, you have some basic understanding of key Financials Indicators in an industrial environment. You distinguish yourself by a strong analytical & creative mindset while enjoying working in a transnational environment where English is the primary language.

What does your next challenge look like?

At Satair, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.

We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow.

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers’ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.

With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.

Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany!

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options


Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your application and CV as soon as possible as we will be interviewing on an ongoing basis. Do not miss this opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company

Satair A/S

Contract Type

Permanent

Experience Level

Professional

Job Family

Improvement & Performance Management

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
*** Data Governance Analyst - Hybrid/Copenhagen - Contract ***




RED Global are currently looking for a Data Governance Analyst to work on a project with a key client of ours in Copenhagen, Denmark. This particular role is a long term contract opportunity offering an initial 12 Month Contract + possible extensions and requires someone who can work in Copenhagen 3 days per week.




We are looking for skills in the following:

Strong knowledge of data governance frameworks and best practices
Proficiency in data quality management and data access management tools and methodologies
Good knowledge of Data Governance enablers such as data catalogs, metadata management systems and workflow automation platforms
Familiarity with Life Sciences industry data and regulatory requirements is preferred
Familiarity with data governance tools such as Databricks Unity Catalog or Informatica Axon enablers is preferred.




If this is something that might be of interest then please apply directly and someone will be in touch to discuss the requirement further.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses samt laver MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi arbejder med en række spændende teknologier, herunder Databricks, Fabric, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory, Azure Synapse og Spark, og laver ikke bare dataudtræk, men bygger ting, der skal i Prod. Vi leder derfor efter flere profiler med erfaring indenfor enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som har lyst til at bygge dataløsninger for vores kunder.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. Cvation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datamigrerings- og datamoderniseringsprojekter
rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i data engineering, data science, Human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring og kan skrive Python - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme. Vi skal nok lære dig det, du mangler på Azure, IaC, MLOps etc.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Infrastructure as code er måden du arbejder på, f.eks. Bicep eller Terraform
Du har erfaring med nogle - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Spark - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.


Hvad tilbyder vi?


Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.


Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.


Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.


Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.


Interesseret?


Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.


Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:


Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com


Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
You will be responsible for developing solutions to our existing Microsoft Azure cloud-based data platform and building value-added Power BI reports to ambitious colleagues around the world.




Are you passionate about data and adding value through reports, and do you want to work in a global production company within the food industry?




At Palsgaard, we have set out on an ambitious growth journey to double our production capacity over the next couple of years. Part of that journey is to rethink our global business processes and how we use data to create more valuable insights and reports. We have started implementing a global ERP platform, Dynamics 365FO, and as part of this, extensive global reports become even more crucial to the business.




As our new BI consultant, you will be responsible for developing solutions to our existing Microsoft Azure cloud-based data platform and building value-added Power BI reports to ambitious colleagues around the world.




You will be part of our highly qualified, global IT team of 16 dedicated IT professionals. A team where we value an informal environment and pursue strong collaboration to achieve our goals and have fun while doing so - we always support each other in getting the job done. We value personal development and offer the opportunity to take on other responsibilities as you develop in the role.




You will report to Martin Nordestgaard, Team Leader for Global BI and Data Platform. The team currently consists of 2 colleagues. The position is placed at our headquarter in Juelsminde (DK) where you will experience a flexible workday, including the opportunity to work from home.




Responsibilities:

Further develop and maintain our cloud-based data warehouse.
Develop Power BI reports in cooperation with our Finance Business Partners and the existing BI team.
Improve and structure reports based on the principles of storytelling (Strategic -> Analytical -> Informative/Operational).
Delivering high quality analytical solutions after best practices and our governance in BI-development, data modelling and report design.




What do you need to apply?

Our ideal candidate holds a BI background such as for example a cand.merc.BI or equivalent with proven experience in a global company or as a consultant.

Technical skills
Advanced: Azure SQL DB and T-SQL, Azure Data Factory, analytical data modelling (star schema) and Power BI.
Basic: Microsoft Azure, Azure DevOps.
Basic understanding of ERP-systems and production companies.




As a person, you are a self-starter with a curious and analytical mindset and a constant focus on making progress to deliver a valuable product. As you will be working primarily with internal stakeholders on a variety of reports, you have great interpersonal skills and are able to communicate complex matters on multiple levels.




Additionally, you have a structured way of working, are good at critical thinking and therefore able to troubleshoot systematically.




As we work within a global scope, excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English and Danish are required.




What do we offer you?

A job with unique working conditions, including one extra week of holiday (7th week), health insurance etc., and the possibility of further career development.
A job with profit sharing through an extra pension scheme.
A job in a socially well-functioning atmosphere and informal environment.
A job in an expanding company that combines technological knowledge with practical value generation.
A job in a market leading company with high ESG standards.
A job in an international environment with clients, partners, and colleagues all over the world.




Do you have any questions?

If you want to seize this opportunity, then send us your application and resume. We hold interviews on an ongoing basis. If you would like to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Martin Nordestgaard at tel.: +45 4072 2788.




We are looking forward to hearing from you.




Please write in your application that you've seen the job at Techjob.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer (Advanced Audience Modelling)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a cutting-edge thinker with a passion for leveraging the latest in strongly typed data pipelines, AI-powered anomaly detection and cloud-first computing systems? Do you want to join an existing, high-output team of academic and professional experts to tackle some of the most complex challenges in advertising? If so, we’d love to meet you.




Our team is embarking on a highly strategic project at the intersection of data science, advertising technology, and audience insights, with a focus on privacy-friendly predictive modelling for audience segmentation and targeting. The system our team is designing will support 1/3rd of the world's ad campaigns, so the scope is huge, and the success of our team depends on our ability in the near term to demonstrate to key stakeholders the superiority of our system, and then follow up on that promise in the mid-long term.




What You’ll Do:

Collaborate with a high-performing team to explore, design, and implement proprietary models based on contemporary research papers. Your role will have a focus on designing and building out the supporting data pipelines and cloud infrastructure.
Explore advanced audience segmentation strategies using massive, multi-dimensional data sets spanning behavioural, social, and content engagement patterns.
Work on the full software engineering lifecycle, from first design to initial implementation, to maintenance of stable products everyone relies on.




Who You Are:

You have a strong academic background (PhD or Master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Data Science, or related field).
You’re passionate about solving real-world problems with advanced models and scalable architectures.
You have previous experience working end-to-end on a large project (not necessarily software engineering).
A strong communicator who thrives in collaborative environments and is eager to learn from and mentor others.
You want to learn about and work with strongly typed programming languages, cloud infrastructure, and huge data pipelines.
You understand the virtue of building an 80% solution first, and then iterating as needed afterwards.




Bonus Points:

If you have previous programming experience.
If you have contributed to one or more open-source projects.




Why Join Us?

Be a key player in shaping the future of privacy-first advertising and audience modelling using cutting-edge AI techniques and highly performant computing systems.
Join an elite team where your research and technical contributions will have a direct impact on strategic outcomes. Work with massive, industry-scale data sets and the latest machine learning techniques.
Growth opportunities; collaborate with leading minds in the field, present your work at major industry conferences, and push the boundaries of applied machine learning.




If you’re ready to innovate and collaborate on high-stakes projects with real-world impact, apply now to join my team and help us redefine the future of audience modelling.

Title: Research Analyst based in Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Quantify is growing rapidly, and we are now looking for a statistician, biostatistician or a quantitatively strong epidemiologist, economist, or other corresponding degrees, to join our RWE unit in Copenhagen as a Research Analyst, with start immediately (taking into account any applicable notice period).

For this particular position, we are looking for someone with a strong background in statistics and programming (preferably R), through university courses, thesis work and/or additional work experience. Experience with data management and statistical programming within epidemiology, health science, or medical research is highly valued, and we are looking for someone eager to build upon this knowledge to contribute to impactful real-world evidence studies.

To thrive at Quantify as a consultant, you have to be a flexible team player with strong communication skills, and strive to meet the needs of your clients, in addition to believing in our mission to improve health care for patients worldwide.

The Role

Responsibilities

As a Research Analyst, you will be part of a diverse team responsible for the design and execution of various projects within Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR). Examples of day-to-day activities include:


Investigate data availability and quality in different Nordic databases
Participate in the development of study protocols and statistical analysis plans
Access and retrieve real-world data
Develop code for data management and analysis in R or Stata
Perform quality control of statistical code
Prepare study reports and academic publications
Communicate the results to internal or external teams


While independent, solutions-oriented work will be required from the start, you will be supported by experienced team members and mentors who will help guide your work and support your professional development.

Your Qualifications


Master’s degree in statistics, epidemiology, economics, engineering, mathematical statistics, biostatistics, or another discipline with strong quantitative focus.
Demonstrated skills, including solid hands-on experience, with statistics, statistical programming and/or data management in Stata or R, is a requirement
A valid and current Danish work permit is mandatory
Driven and curious with an independent, solutions-oriented “hands-on” mentality
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team, on multiple projects simultaneously
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) in English is mandatory
Fluency in a Nordic language is a merit
Prior evidence of academic publications is a merit
Previous work experience from consultancy or health care sector is a merit


Quantify's Offer

We are an expert consultancy in health economics and outcomes research with Nordic roots and values. We create evidence to support the value of pharmaceutical products across many disease areas, through three internal business units; Real-world Evidence & Analytics (this position); Modelling, Access & Strategy; Evidence Review & Synthesis. Quantify is proud to work with medical innovators across the globe to improve patient lives.

We provide a workplace where you can develop your skills and knowledge in a fast-paced, high-impact environment. There are many opportunities for leadership, personal growth, and involvement in exciting initiatives. Through your work, you will play a key role in helping patients access life changing medicines in a variety of disease areas.

This position will be based at our Copenhagen office and we offer all staff the opportunity of a hybrid workplace model, where you can mix in-office and remote work to enjoy more autonomy and a better work-life balance.

Application

The deadline for submitting your application is 28th February 2025, but please note that we will be interviewing continuously and that this position might be filled before the end of the application period.

Contact information

If you have any specific questions about the role, please contact Fredrika Juhlin fredrika.juhlin@quantifyresearch.com
Show more

Title: CX Data Analyst | Tryg Privat
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bliv en del af Trygs team "Customer Relations" og hjælp os med at omsætte vores kunders behov til de bedste kundeoplevelser.

Vi skaber de mest værdifulde løsninger, når vi er datadrevne. Du er allerede vant til at omsætte både kvalitative og kvantitative data til indsigt, som vi kan arbejde med. Hvis du kan fortælle de historier, som dataene viser os, så er det dig, vi søger!

I Tryg Privat udvikler vi forsikringsprodukter til over 1 million danskere. Vores vigtigste opgave er at sikre gode kundeoplevelser, og vi er stolte af vores høje kundetilfredshed. Vi har ambitiøse mål om at forbedre os endnu mere, og som CX Data Analyst får du en nøglerolle i denne rejse.

Om jobbet | Skab udvikling

Rollen som vores nye CX Data Analyst er alsidig og bred. Du er analytisk af sind, kan omsætte forretningens behov og sprog til dataindsigter, har flair for design af datavisualisering og kan arbejde med store datamængder i Excel og Power BI. Du skaber fundamentet og indsigterne, som er afgørende for at forbedre kundeoplevelserne. Derfor er du også dygtig til både samarbejde og kommunikation.

Vi har et af Nordens største CX-data frameworks gennem Qualtrics, som danner grundlaget for vores CX-data. Din primære opgave vil være at arbejde med forretningens behov for indsigter inden for dette framework. Dette inkluderer alt fra CSAT-score og driverspørgsmål til ustruktureret feedback fra kundekommentarer, kundefornyelse og metadata, der kan segmentere og forfine indsigterne i vores kundebase.

Om dig | Tag ansvar

Vi ser gerne, at du har erfaring med at arbejde med kundeindsigter og løbende analyserer og rapporterer disse til forretningen. Du skal kunne analysere data i forhold til kundesegmenter og bestandssammensætning, samt sikre vores metodiske grundlag. Det er vigtigt, at du kan kvalificere problemområder i forhold til både kundetilfredshed og forretningsværdi.

Du vil fungere som bindeled til andre enheder og løbende kommunikere om kundetilfredshed og andre enheders områder. Derudover vil du være sparringspartner i projekter, der kræver "kundens stemme", og muligvis også drive projekter selv. Du deltager aktivt i og måske endda faciliterer tværnordisk vidensdeling.

Kort sagt, du ved, hvad der er vigtigt for vores kunder, og du formår at aktivere denne viden på tværs af vores enheder.

Om os | Mærk tilliden

Du vil blive en del af afdelingen "Customer Relations" i Tryg Privat. Customer Relations sikrer den bedste kundeoplevelse på tværs af kunderejser, implementerer kundeindsigter og sørger for overblik og forandringskommunikation i forhold til vores kunder og rådgivere. Her vil du arbejde sammen med specialister inden for adfærdsdesign, servicedesign, analytics og kommunikation. Afdelingen er en del af forretningsområdet "Customer Excellence", hvor vi i tæt samarbejde med vores søsterafdelinger stræber efter at skabe tryghed og gode kundeoplevelser.

Lyder det som dig? | Søg allerede i dag!

Hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder for ”Customer Relations”, Charlotte Mørch, på mail: charlotte.moerch@tryg.dk.

Da vi løbende afholder samtaler, vil vi bestemt anbefale, at du sender os dit CV og ansøgning allerede i dag og senest d. 7. februar 2025.

Diversitet & inklusion skaber et stærkere Tryg

Vi mener, at mangfoldighed i tankegang er afgørende for vores fremtidige succes, og vi ønsker at afspejle det samfund, vi er en del af. Derfor arbejder vi målrettet på at sikre en mangfoldig og inkluderende arbejdsplads, hvor du føler dig respekteret, kan være dig selv og har lige muligheder for at udvikle dig og gøre karriere.

Vi opfordrer derfor alle, uanset køn, alder, oprindelse eller baggrund, til at søge stillingen.

Læs mere om, hvordan det er at arbejde i Tryg

Sammen om din karriereudvikling

Hos Tryg har vi høj medarbejdertilfredshed og et stærkt tværfagligt miljø med gode karrieremuligheder. Udvikling og læring er en konstant proces hos os, og vi ønsker, at du vokser og udvikler dig sammen med os.

Uanset om du vil udvide dine faglige kompetencer, tage næste skridt i karrieren eller udforske nye områder, støtter vi dig på din udviklingsrejse.

Udforsk dine muligheder her

Er vores kendetegn også dine?

Vis tillid

Hos Tryg bygger vi på hinandens tillid, når vi bevæger os ud på ukendt grund som morgendagens tryghedsskaber. Vi tror på, at tillid og frihed under ansvar motiverer din nysgerrighed og dit mod til at gå nye veje. Du får ledere og kolleger, der lægger vægt på både trivsel og resultater.

Hos Tryg oplever du en kultur, der bygger på tillid, ansvar og udvikling hele vejen rundt..

Tag ansvar

Når du starter i Tryg, vil du hurtigt opdage, at ansvar er noget, der fylder. Jo mere ansvar, du vil have, jo mere får du, når du viser, at du kan leve op til det.

Her får du mandat til at udforske nye muligheder, koncepter og løsninger, der skaber tryghed for kunder, kollegaer og samfund i dag og i morgen.

Skab udvikling

I Tryg går du forrest og skaber udviklingen sammen med dine kolleger. Det kræver både mod, vilje og evnen til at gå nye veje. Her tør vi tage chancer, og det giver dig frihed til at forfølge dine idéer og skabe noget nyt.

Det giver store muligheder for dig, som kan, vil og tør sætte tryk på din egen og på Trygs udvikling.

Vi ser gerne, at du har erfaring med at arbejde med kundeindsigter og løbende analyserer og rapporterer disse til forretningen. Du skal kunne analysere data i forhold til kundesegmenter og bestandssammensætning, samt sikre vores metodiske grundlag. Det er vigtigt, at du kan kvalificere problemområder i forhold til både kundetilfredshed og forretningsværdi.

Du vil fungere som bindeled til andre enheder og løbende kommunikere om kundetilfredshed og andre enheders områder. Derudover vil du være sparringspartner i projekter, der kræver "kundens stemme", og muligvis også drive projekter selv. Du deltager aktivt i og måske endda faciliterer tværnordisk vidensdeling.

Kort sagt, du ved, hvad der er vigtigt for vores kunder, og du formår at aktivere denne viden på tværs af vores enheder.

Om os | Mærk tilliden

Du vil blive en del af afdelingen "Customer Relations" i Tryg Privat. Customer Relations sikrer den bedste kundeoplevelse på tværs af kunderejser, implementerer kundeindsigter og sørger for overblik og forandringskommunikation i forhold til vores kunder og rådgivere. Her vil du arbejde sammen med specialister inden for adfærdsdesign, servicedesign, analytics og kommunikation. Afdelingen er en del af forretningsområdet "Customer Excellence", hvor vi i tæt samarbejde med vores søsterafdelinger stræber efter at skabe tryghed og gode kundeoplevelser.

Lyder det som dig? | Søg allerede i dag!

Hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder for ”Customer Relations”, Charlotte Mørch, på mail: charlotte.moerch@tryg.dk.

Da vi løbende afholder samtaler, vil vi bestemt anbefale, at du sender os dit CV og ansøgning allerede i dag og senest d. 7. februar 2025.

Diversitet & inklusion skaber et stærkere Tryg

Vi mener, at mangfoldighed i tankegang er afgørende for vores fremtidige succes, og vi ønsker at afspejle det samfund, vi er en del af. Derfor arbejder vi målrettet på at sikre en mangfoldig og inkluderende arbejdsplads, hvor du føler dig respekteret, kan være dig selv og har lige muligheder for at udvikle dig og gøre karriere.

Vi opfordrer derfor alle, uanset køn, alder, oprindelse eller baggrund, til at søge stillingen.

Læs mere om, hvordan det er at arbejde i Tryg

Sammen om din karriereudvikling

Hos Tryg har vi høj medarbejdertilfredshed og et stærkt tværfagligt miljø med gode karrieremuligheder. Udvikling og læring er en konstant proces hos os, og vi ønsker, at du vokser og udvikler dig sammen med os.

Uanset om du vil udvide dine faglige kompetencer, tage næste skridt i karrieren eller udforske nye områder, støtter vi dig på din udviklingsrejse.

Udforsk dine muligheder her

Er vores kendetegn også dine?

Vis tillid

Hos Tryg bygger vi på hinandens tillid, når vi bevæger os ud på ukendt grund som morgendagens tryghedsskaber. Vi tror på, at tillid og frihed under ansvar motiverer din nysgerrighed og dit mod til at gå nye veje. Du får ledere og kolleger, der lægger vægt på både trivsel og resultater.

Hos Tryg oplever du en kultur, der bygger på tillid, ansvar og udvikling hele vejen rundt..

Tag ansvar

Når du starter i Tryg, vil du hurtigt opdage, at ansvar er noget, der fylder. Jo mere ansvar, du vil have, jo mere får du, når du viser, at du kan leve op til det.

Her får du mandat til at udforske nye muligheder, koncepter og løsninger, der skaber tryghed for kunder, kollegaer og samfund i dag og i morgen.

Skab udvikling

I Tryg går du forrest og skaber udviklingen sammen med dine kolleger. Det kræver både mod, vilje og evnen til at gå nye veje. Her tør vi tage chancer, og det giver dig frihed til at forfølge dine idéer og skabe noget nyt.

Det giver store muligheder for dig, som kan, vil og tør sætte tryk på din egen og på Trygs udvikling.

Title: Data Partner
Description:
Do you thrive when you can improve the business by connecting Data – Processes – People through Microsoft Power Platform? Are you an experienced Business Intelligence (BI) developer?

Then you could be the new Data Partner in AME. Apply now and join Novo Nordisk!

The position
In Novo Nordisk, we are on a growth journey and are scaling our aseptic manufacturing operations rapidly. The Aseptic Manufacturing Engineering (AME) area is a growing global support function that supports the network of production sites with operational readiness and excellence, maintenance practices, process management and standardisation. In this context, we have created a new position and are looking for a Data Partner. This role will be responsible for developing and supporting process digitalisation solutions as well as business intelligence across the area.

Key responsibilities of the role:



Improve existing business processes through the development and maintenance of Microsoft Power Platform solutions, such as PowerApps, PowerBI, and PowerAutomate Flows.
Create transparency and support decision making by leveraging and visualising data in user-friendly BI solutions using PowerBI, Tableau and Alteryx.
Implement digital transformation initiatives and drive the digital mindset across the area.
Define and deploy the governance around the Process Digitalisation and BI pipeline within the area incl. training setup.
Actively contribute as a team player by sharing ideas and inputs.




Qualifications

To succeed in this role, you have:



MSc Degree in Engineering, IT, Business, or similar field.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, BI Developer or similar role supporting managers, project managers and specialists with digitalisation.
Knowledge and experience of Microsoft Power Platform, Tableau and Alteryx will be needed.
Professional proficiency in English.
Managing stakeholder relationships to ensure successful outcomes.




On a personal level, you are very structured and transparent around work planning and progress. You are flexible, proactive, self-driven and team oriented. You are eager to learn, and you are curious of nature. In exchange, we offer you an opportunity to work with extraordinary talent and benefit from a range of possibilities for professional and personal development.

About The Department

As Data Partner, you will join AME Business Support which is a diverse and evolving team that works across the departments in the area to support Strategy, Finance, LEAN, Health and Safety, Training, Digitalisation and Department Administration activities. Our mindset is ambitious but pragmatic as the area and the team is newly established. We share the same goal of supporting our area in transforming how we approach scaling of our aseptic manufacturing.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today, is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing, and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information, please reach out to Senior Manager, Carl-Johan Ekhall, (+45) 3075 9357

Deadline
26 January 2025

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more
