Title: Bi & Data Analyst til afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Motiveres du af udvikling, store datamængder og analyser, der skaber reel værdi? Vil du arbejde med data fra kildesystemerne helt ud til brugerne? Hvis ja, tilbyder vi dig muligheden for at blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk fællesskab, hvor lysten til udvikling og optimering er essentielt, og hvor vi sammen bygger fremtidens løsninger.




Rollen og hvad du kan forvente

Hos MineTilbud er afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi en central partner for alle forretningsområder, fra marketing, salg og drift til IT-udvikling. Vores fokus er at levere de rette data, på det rette tidspunkt, til de rette modtagere. For at styrke vores forretning med faktabaseret ledelse og databårne beslutninger søger vi en forretningsorienteret BI & Data Analyst, der brænder for at forstå, optimere og visualisere forretningsdata i høj kvalitet. Størstedelen af dit arbejde vil foregå i PowerBI og Excel, hvor du skal udtrække data fra vores underliggende datawarehouse, som ligger i Amazon Web Services, og illustrere det i PowerBI.

Som det første teammedlem i afdelingen udover virksomhedens chef for Økonomi og Strategi vil du arbejde i tæt kontakt med både CEO og det øvrige ledelsesteam. Du får en central rolle med stor kontaktflade, og i takt med områdets udvikling får du mulighed for at præge det fremtidige BI-landskab og forme din rolle i denne udvikling.




Primære arbejdsopgaver

Modellering og effektivisering af data
Implementering af forretningslogik i Power BI
Udledning af forretningsindsigt fra forskellige datakilder
Udarbejdelse af rapporteringsløsninger
Visualisering og formidling af data til brug for forretningsdrift og udvikling
Være en engageret kollega, der bidrager til et stærkt fællesskab




Din baggrund og kvalifikationer

For at være den rette til denne rolle er det en forudsætning, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du i minimum 2 år har arbejdet med Power BI og haft tæt kontakt med interne stakeholders. Du har en relevant uddannelse på BSc- eller MSc-niveau og en stærk kommerciel forståelse.




Som person er du nysgerrig og opsøgende, har gode kommunikationsevner og lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vækst og udvikling er i fokus. Du er selvstændig, detaljeorienteret og har en struktureret og resultatorienteret tilgang til opgaver. Erfaring med Amazon Web Services er en fordel. Da North Media primært er en dansk virksomhed, er det et krav, at du behersker dansk og engelsk flydende, både mundtligt og skriftligt.




Den der kan og vil og gør, får også lov

Du bliver en del af en dynamisk og innovativ virksomhed i rivende udvikling. Vi er en arbejdsplads med dedikerede og dygtige kollegaer og en uformel omgangstone. Med det rette engagement får du stor indflydelse på din hverdag. Vi tilbyder lækker frokost- og frugtordning, mulighed for at tage aftensmad med hjem, kaffe og te ad libitum fra vores café, træningsfaciliteter i eget motionsrum samt diverse sociale arrangementer.




For mere information om rollen og hvorfor det at arbejde hos MineTilbud gør dig til en del af et stærkt, udviklende og inkluderende fællesskab, kan du kontakte Mayse Lind, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, på telefon +45 2154 9818. Vi afholder samtaler løbende og opfordrer interesserede kandidater til at søge snarest muligt.




Om MineTilbud

MineTilbud tilbyder en stærk medieplatform og teknologi, der giver retailers, brands og e-commercere mulighed for at tage del i hele kunderejsen ved at udkomme med relevant indhold på tværs af platforme. MineTilbud er en virksomhed med en skalerbar volumenforretning og et fundament bygget på effektiv håndtering af store mængder materiale og data – hurtigt, sikkert og til en lav enhedspris. Vi står over for spændende forandringer og udviklingsprojekter, hvor vores store datamængder spiller en central rolle i at forstå og styre forretningen. Som BI & Data Analyst får du en unik mulighed for at påvirke virksomhedens fremtid og bidrage til databaserede beslutninger.




MineTilbud er ejet af North Media A/S, hvis selskaber udvikler og driver platforme til transaktioner mellem erhvervslivet og forbrugerne inden for tilbud fra detailhandlen, lejeboliger, jobannoncering og digitale adgangssystemer. North Media A/S er børsnoteret på Nasdaq Copenhagen.

Show more

Title: Master Data Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
emagine is seeking an experienced Master Data Specialist for a client within the pharmaceutical industry.

Job Description:


Business Context Analysis: Gain an understanding of the business context and the specific master data requirements.
Master Data Setup: Ensure proper configuration of relevant master data within the solution.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to pinpoint pain points, and suggest process improvements.
Migration Support: Assist product analysts with master data-related tasks during project phases.
Tool Utilization: Participate in the testing and development of new tools for mass creation or modification of master data.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work with site-specific stakeholders, to collect requirements and address any concerns.
Documentation: Develop and maintain a standardized approach for master data.


Required Skills:


Experience in analyzing business contexts and master data requirements.
Experience with master data setup and management.
Experience in engaging with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide support.
Experience in Supply Chain
Experience in SAP solutions


Location: Copenhagen Metropolitan Area

Allocation: Fulltime, hybrid

Duration: 10-12 months
Show more

Title: Student data scientist at Center for Humanities Computing
Company: Centre for Educational Development (CED), Aarhus University
Description:
Center for Humanities Computing (CHC) has openings for student data scientists to work in research projects and support (8 hrs./week). CHC is a research and development unit at Aarhus University that collaborates with researchers from arts and humanities (Faculty of Arts) at Aarhus University. As a student data scientist in CHC, your job responsibilities include writing well-developed and testable code using the software development practices of CHC, working with stakeholders to develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to their research data, developing processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy. Student data scientists are expected to participate in CHC's common activities when they are related to their project(-s) specifically. Participation in other activities is optional.

The employment will commence March 3rd 2025, or as soon as possible thereafter, and end when the candidate graduates.

Qualifications

Applicants must:


have experience with Linux and Linux terminal
be able to write scripts in Python and bash
have a basic understanding of Git
be open and ask a lot of questions because there will be a bit of a learning curve


Furthermore, it will be considered an advantage if applicants have:


experience with CUDA, TensorFlow, and PyTorch
interest in NLP or Computer Vision


Read more about the center here: Center for Humanities Computing | Aarhus University

If you have any questions, please contact Ross Deans Kristensen-McLachlan rdkm@cc.au.dk

Salary and terms of employment

In accordance with the current collective agreement between the Ministry of Taxation and PROSA.

Aarhus University’s ambition is to be an attractive and inspiring workplace for all and to foster a culture in which each individual has opportunities to thrive, achieve and develop. We view equality and diversity as assets, and we welcome all applicants.

Faculty of Arts

The Faculty of Arts is one of five main academic areas at Aarhus University.

The faculty contributes to Aarhus University's research, talent development, knowledge exchange and degree programmes.

With its 700 academic staff members, 200 PhD students, 9,000 BA and MA students, and 1,500 students following continuing/further education programmes, the faculty constitutes a strong and diverse research and teaching environment.

The Faculty of Arts consists of the School of Communication and Culture, the School of Culture and Society and the Danish School of Education. Each of these units has strong academic environments and forms the basis for interdisciplinary research and education.

The faculty's academic environments and degree programmes engage in international collaboration and share the common goal of contributing to the development of knowledge, welfare and culture in interaction with society.

Read more at arts.au.dk/en

The application must be submitted via Aarhus University’s recruitment system, which can be accessed under the job advertisement on Aarhus University's website.

Title: Quantitative Analyst for US Trading Team
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst for US Trading

At MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and drive the green transition.

We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious US Power Trading team. This is your opportunity to play a key role in the dynamic and evolving US power market, working alongside talented traders and analysts who share your drive for excellence and innovation.

Why join us?

At MFT Energy, we combine a startup mindset with the strength of a global organization. We believe in empowering individuals to make data-driven decisions in a fast-paced environment where collaboration, innovation, and entrepreneurial thinking are the cornerstones of our success.

As a quantitative analyst in MFT, you’ll be at the heart of our US power trading team, which specializes in navigating one of the world’s most complex and fast-moving energy markets.

Here’s What You’ll Be Doing


Modelling: Build Mathematical models to support trading strategies
Data infrastructure: Enhance and streamline data pipelines, ensuring robust analytics and efficient operations.
Team collaboration: Work closely with traders and analysts to translate market insights into actionable tools and models.
Innovation: Research and implement new technologies and methodologies to stay ahead in energy market modeling and analytics.


What We’re Looking For


Master’s or PhD in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or another quantitative field.
Proficiency in Python and a statically typed programming language.
Experience designing and maintaining reliable, automated systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills preferable with strong knowledge of Statistics.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


You should expect technical tests as part of the recruitment process.

Our ideal candidate

You thrive in high-pressure environments. You have a desire to solve complex problems optimally from the ground up with next level curiosity. Furthermore, it's an expectation that the candidate is passionate about stock markets, gaming, betting, science fiction, manga or similar (passion being the keyword).

What We Offer


A dynamic, entrepreneurial work environment where the best ideas win.
Talented and ambitious colleagues who challenge and support you.
Competitive benefits and a people-first leadership approach.
Mind boggling daily lunch conversations (e.g. physicists explaining space-time and Schrödinger's cat or lectures on differences between wizards and sorcerers).


Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations - Please send us the following information: your CV, a link to your GitHub or other passion projects examples, your grades, and answers to the four questions in the application form. No cover letter needed.

For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Start date: As soon as possible

We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

We are a global and independent energy trading hub specializing in power and gas, trading 24/7 across 39 countries. With MFT Energy's unique partner model, we empower entrepreneurs to become the best and make the most of their talent. We believe the most successful way to advance our business is to extend a sense of ownership to as many employees as possible.
Show more
HTML:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst for US Trading

At MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and drive the green transition.

We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious US Power Trading team. This is your opportunity to play a key role in the dynamic and evolving US power market, working alongside talented traders and analysts who share your drive for excellence and innovation.

Why join us?

At MFT Energy, we combine a startup mindset with the strength of a global organization. We believe in empowering individuals to make data-driven decisions in a fast-paced environment where collaboration, innovation, and entrepreneurial thinking are the cornerstones of our success.

As a quantitative analyst in MFT, you’ll be at the heart of our US power trading team, which specializes in navigating one of the world’s most complex and fast-moving energy markets.

Here’s What You’ll Be Doing

  • Modelling: Build Mathematical models to support trading strategies
  • Data infrastructure: Enhance and streamline data pipelines, ensuring robust analytics and efficient operations.
  • Team collaboration: Work closely with traders and analysts to translate market insights into actionable tools and models.
  • Innovation: Research and implement new technologies and methodologies to stay ahead in energy market modeling and analytics.

What We’re Looking For

  • Master’s or PhD in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or another quantitative field.
  • Proficiency in Python and a statically typed programming language.
  • Experience designing and maintaining reliable, automated systems.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills preferable with strong knowledge of Statistics.
  • Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

You should expect technical tests as part of the recruitment process.

Our ideal candidate

You thrive in high-pressure environments. You have a desire to solve complex problems optimally from the ground up with next level curiosity. Furthermore, it's an expectation that the candidate is passionate about stock markets, gaming, betting, science fiction, manga or similar (passion being the keyword).

What We Offer

  • A dynamic, entrepreneurial work environment where the best ideas win.
  • Talented and ambitious colleagues who challenge and support you.
  • Competitive benefits and a people-first leadership approach.
  • Mind boggling daily lunch conversations (e.g. physicists explaining space-time and Schrödinger's cat or lectures on differences between wizards and sorcerers).

Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations - Please send us the following information: your CV, a link to your GitHub or other passion projects examples, your grades, and answers to the four questions in the application form. No cover letter needed.

For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Start date: As soon as possible

We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

We are a global and independent energy trading hub specializing in power and gas, trading 24/7 across 39 countries. With MFT Energy's unique partner model, we empower entrepreneurs to become the best and make the most of their talent. We believe the most successful way to advance our business is to extend a sense of ownership to as many employees as possible.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Do ETL processes, workflow automation, and data transformation excite you? Are you ready to grow your career in Data Engineering and help shape the future of the automotive industry? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Data Engineer.




We are a high-growth SaaS and analytics company that works predominantly in the automotive industry, where we bridge the gap between data and insights, providing our clients with the necessary tools and intelligence to make informed decisions and optimize their operations. We build automations and utilize prediction models for our prestigious clients so they can take action on data. We work with the biggest clients in the industry such as Audi, VW, Porsche, SKODA, Seat, Peugeot, Opel, Suzuki, KIA and Citroën.

We are looking to hire a full-time Data Engineer to join our growth journey and help us to continue to deliver outstanding products and services to our customers.




The Position

As a Data Engineer at ag analytics, you will be able to leverage your analytic skills to gain insights from a diverse range of data sources. You will be working in our Data Science department, where your main tasks will include:

· Building, maintaining, and optimizing ETL workflows using tools such as Apache Airflow.

· Developing R and Python scripts for data processing and analysis.

· Automating data workflows and ensuring efficient execution.

· Integrating APIs to enhance data accessibility.

· Ensuring data quality through robust testing and validation of workflows.

· Collaborating with cross-functional teams to support analytics and reporting needs.




With exposure to a wide range of technologies, you will have the chance to expand your knowledge and develop your career in a dynamic and challenging environment.




About You

You have a background in data science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, or other relevant scientific education. You have practical experience working with R and Python and are curious to know more and develop your skills within both Data Science and Data Engineering.

At ag analytics, we believe that passion is the key to success. We are not just looking for individuals with a specific set of hard skills; rather, we are seeking individuals who are truly passionate about data analytics, technology, and making a difference in the world. We believe that with the right mindset and drive, skills can be developed and honed over time. Our clients expect the best from us, so we expect you to be a self-starter, take responsibility, and keep deadlines. You take ownership of your tasks, you are curious and willing to learn and improve. You work in a structured manner, have an eye for detail and ensure we always deliver the highest quality.




Skills and Qualifications

· Experience in building ETL pipelines and workflow automation.

· Good knowledge of programming languages such as R and Python.

· 2-4 years of practical experience.

· Highly structured and committed to delivering reliable, high-quality solutions.

· Good verbal and written English skills.

· Enjoys working on dynamic and diverse data projects.




Nice-to-Have

· Experience working in a Scrum environment.

· Practical experience with Apache Airflow.




About Us

ag analytics is a highly international scale-up with a team of over 40 who are passionate about predictive data analytics. Our offices are on Højbro Plads in the tech start-up community Matrikel 1. We are highly focused on delivering best-in-class solutions to our customers while learning and developing at the same time. We have an informal and relaxed team atmosphere with team events, breakfasts and Friday bars. You can read more about us here www.aganalytics.dk




Please note: this is not a remote role, you will be working in our Copenhagen office.




How to apply

Please apply using the ‘apply’ button, we do not accept applications via email. We interview on an ongoing basis so please apply as soon as possible. We expect to begin responding to the applications at the beginning of January 2025.




If you have any questions about the role, please contact our Head of Engineering, Jan Vittrup Hansen at jvt@aganalytics.dk




We look forward to hearing from you.

Show more

Title: Student Helper - Business Intelligence
Description:
Student Helper - Business Intelligence at Advansor




Advansor is looking for a Student Helper - Business Intelligence to become part of a successful company driven by climate actions.




The Student Helper should be able to work approximately 2 days per week. The total number of working hours can also be spread over more than 2 days, but the exact working schedule will be planned on an ongoing basis.




Your role

The Controlling department at Advansor acts as support function for management, providing data for decision-making.




You will participate in project work related to data management, governance and implementation of new systems in co-operation with IT and Accounting. This also means that you will cooperate with departments across the entire organisation.




Your main tasks will include:

Play a role in our efforts on data governance
Participate in securing Optimal use of data to support business strategies
Analyses and reports, including creation and updating reports and dashboards in PowerBI
Participate in project work on data governance and business intelligence
Secure that data is structured, accessible and easy to understand for technical and non-technical colleagues
Participate in the development and implementation of new governance structure, securing correct collection, structuring and use of data
Work with different data models and data protection as well as participating in practical data tasks
Securing that all data efforts are connected to the strategic targets of the company




What does the position require from you?

You are probably studying Cand. Merc. BI or Cand. Merc. IT, but it is not a requirement. You are fluent in English as you will be working with colleagues of many different nationalities.




In order to succeed in the position, you must be curious about how things work and have the desire to learn new things. It is only positive if you are critical and open to ask questions – better too many than too few.




The tasks you will handle require some knowledge about PowerBI. You don’t have to be an expert, but you must be willing to learn. In general, you are expected to take responsibility for own learning.




When working in the Controlling department, no two days are the same. Unplanned tasks will always come up, so you should be comfortable with handling sudden changes in priorities.




Knowledge to DAX will be an advantage but is not a requirement.




We offer

As part of Team Advansor, you will get to work with more than 350 competent colleagues of more than 35 different nationalities and join us in our mission: to design and produce the world’s best sustainable climate solutions. You will become part of a highly ambitious company that values a good working environment, diversity, and teamwork.




The company is located in Brabrand close to E45 with good access and within walking distance to the bus stop.




If you are interested in the position, please send your application and CV in English online through our website. We aim for a start date mid-February, but it is not a prerequisite for employment that you will be able to start exactly then.




Please contact Malene Birck Jensen, Operation Controller at mbj@advansor.com if you have any questions about the position or Advansor as a workplace.




We look forward to receiving your application.




Sustainable CO2 climate solutions

As a market-leading manufacturer, we have designed and produced more than 16,000 CO2 systems for sustainable commercial and industrial cooling and heating around the world since 2006.




Many people associate CO2 with global warming. We’re cool with that. Literally. Because CO2 is the most climate-friendly refrigerant: It is non-toxic, non-flammable and does not harm our drinking water. That is why we are ’cool with CO2’.

Title: Market Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Maersk Offshore Wind is on a growth journey where we are scaling up our business and organization. Therefore, we are looking for a Market Intelligence Analyst analyzing, interpreting, and delivering market data and trends to form the basis for our business decisions.




We Offer




As our new Market Intelligence Analyst, you will be part of the Commercial team in Copenhagen and where you will be working closely with other team members, particularly our Regional Commercial Heads. We work hard and we have fun doing so. As a team, we see our different backgrounds and experiences as a source of strength. Our structure is lean and flat, and you will have significant independence to impact your role, as well as be expected to collaborate across disciplines.




We are owned by A.P. Moller Holding, operating independently with the trust and empowerment to do what is right for us, while proudly bearing the Maersk name and values.




The position will be based in our headquarters in Lyngby until March 2025 where we will move to a new office in Nordhavn. We offer various benefits, including a delicious breakfast and lunch, massage services, comprehensive health insurance, and, of course, a team of fantastic colleagues.




Key Responsibilities




As our Market Intelligence Analyst, you will be working with other members of our Commercial team in our HQ in Copenhagen and reporting to the Chief Commercial Officer. Travelling will to a limited extent be required to support the business. Your key responsibilities will be:




Being key responsible for market intelligence information and our overall market understanding. This involves market size, market shares, competitors and vessels and understanding how and why these shift over time.
Collecting and updating the yearly data gathering and analysis forming the basis for our global sales plan and regional strategies. This is a key deliverable during the first 6 months.
Developing data visualizations, dashboards, and other business intelligence tools, facilitating informed and data-driven decision-making processes.
Assessing quality and relevance of different databases and subscriptions.
Performing deep dive analyses on specific markets or product areas.




Who are we looking for?




You have preferably 2 – 5 years of experience from a similar position within the offshore wind B2B market. This experience has given you a good understanding of the offshore wind market as a whole and its business drivers.
You have excellent data management skills and talent to handle large data sets and integrations across different sources and platforms such as PowerBI, Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint.
You have strong analytical and data management skills and can translate metrics, research, and trends meaningfully into our sales and strategy context.
You have strong communication and writing skills in English that enable you to present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner and with a strong attention to detail.
You thrive in a dynamic work environment and are used to working independently, while at the same time being a team-player.




How to apply




If you can imagine yourself in this role, we look very much forward to hearing from you. Please apply through our website no later than 1st February 2025. We will review and interview on an ongoing basis we encourage you to apply sooner rather than later.




About Maersk Offshore Wind




Drawing on decades of maritime capabilities to operate large assets and execute complex offshore projects, Maersk Offshore Wind is committed to solving the energy challenges of tomorrow by providing innovative offshore wind installation services worldwide, supporting the rapid growth and development of the offshore wind industry. Maersk Offshore Wind is part of the A.P. Moller Group and headquartered in Denmark. Read more on our website: https://maerskoffshorewind.com/

Title: Junior System Engineer
Place: Sønderborg Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are rapidly growing our global business and we are looking for new colleagues.

Do you want to kick-start your career in system engineering in a company that develops systems to help keep people and society safe?

We are looking for Junior System Engineers to join our growing organization. You will become part of a large team of experienced and highly competent System Engineers where you will be able to learn from them and grow into the role as System Engineer.

Your role

As Junior System Engineer, you will interact with the other System Engineers and help with the technical part of projects. Based on customer requirements and internal design processes, you will plan the system design in close cooperation with other System Engineers. You will:


Participate in customer projects as part of the system engineering team
Support the team with requirement breakdown in our system
Participate in internal and external design and document reviews
Support the team with data collection in various parts of the organization
Support the team with collection of equipment data



Your profile

This opportunity requires a person who likes to learn and work with many stakeholders. The candidate we are looking for is a team player with initiative and interpersonal skills. You have a broad technical background and work in a structured way.

We expect you to hold a degree within engineering, computer science or a technical education with equivalent experience. This is a perfect opportunity for a recent graduated candidate.

We are in a global environment and therefore look for candi­dates with various backgrounds and experiences. We interact with each other and therefore need good communicators, who like to interact with stakeholders and who speak/write English.

What can you expect from us?

Saab Danmark is a company that is growing and you will therefore experience a company that is dynamic and able to adapt. In the Saab group we have a saying ”Business is done between people”, and this is also the environment you can expect here. We offer:


Initial learning process with mentorship and support
Good career and development opportunities in a professional company
A vibrant and international atmosphere with colleagues from all over the world
Benefits that support our employees’ wellbeing
A variety of social activities, lunch scheme, pension as well as flexible work conditions
Focus on our teams, good cooperation and giving our employees the ability to take ownership of their tasks.



As a condition of employment, candidates will be required to participate in a background investigation and/or successfully demonstrate eligibility to receive applicable government security clearance(s).

About Saab Danmark A/S

Saab in Denmark is part of the Saab Group with headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. At the same time, Saab Danmark is an independent legal company with a flat organizational structure. Our main area of business is delivering integrated communication solutions to civil and military markets at home and abroad.

You can find further information about our integrated communication solution TactiCall on www.saab.com/naval.

Workplace

Saab Danmark A/S

Porten 6-8

6400 Sønderborg

________________________

Application

As we interview candidates continuously, send in your application now.

________________________

Contact regarding the job content

hr@dk.saabgroup.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
DATA ENGINEER 

Data is an incredibly important asset to our organisation, and now is your chance to join our digital business transformation and contribute to shaping the future of data in Lind Capital. 




Who we are 

At Lind Capital, we take a different approach to trading. We're a team of 20+ market specialists and analytical thinkers who collaborate to combine technical expertise with market understanding. With no external investors, we are free to focus on making the best possible trades using quantitative models. 




Data in Lind Capital 

Data is central to Lind Capital’s success and key to our future growth, and therefore we are looking to expand our resources within the area. You become part of our international technology team which currently consists of 8 software engineers, data engineers and data scientists. On a daily basis, you will be working in one of our cross-functional squads of professionals who enjoy solving complex problems together in our effort to advance on our tech and data journey. 




The job 

The main tasks of your team are to develop and maintain solutions solving complex business problems by utilizing vast amounts of structured and unstructured data. As our new Data Engineer, you will play an important role in preparing and serving data for both trading applications, analytics and our machine learning models. Also, you will play an important role in the development of data solutions and data usage at large.  

If you are skilled and motivated to build solutions to bring raw data into actionable output, you will be able to make a big impact in our organization.  

More specifically, your tasks will include: 

Collaborate closely with data scientists, software and ML engineers in a cross-functional setting identifying and facilitating both analytics and ML requirements for data
Design, develop and maintain batch and streaming data pipelines from end-to-end.  
Enable both batch and live serving of data for applications, analytics and ML models. 
Build data quality monitoring tools and improving pipeline observability. 
Develop our data management framework. 
Build and maintain our infrastructure in AWS using infrastructure-as-code tools.  
Contribute to our data strategy and promote good engineering practices.  




You make the difference 

Technical capabilities are required, but personality makes the difference. We aim for a cooperative work environment with a high level of knowledge sharing. A work environment where everybody assumes personal responsibility, and where teamwork and communication skills are essential. 

The trading strategies we pursue are all based on a complex combination of tech, data, numbers, and market know-how. This means your ability to go beyond your comfort zone and engage with experts in other areas is paramount to our success. 

You are a team player and have an open-minded attitude. You can communicate ideas and technical topics honestly and clearly – also to non-experts – while respecting the views of others on the team. You are eager to understand and find solutions, allowing you to quickly adapt to changing situations and come up with new ideas.  

We're looking for someone who brings: 

Clean and efficient Python code (experience with other programming languages is a plus). 
Practical experience in creating and maintaining data intensive solutions from a similar role. 
Experience with orchestration frameworks like Apache Airflow. 
Experience with containerization frameworks like Docker. 
Experience with SQL and NoSQL DBMS for both transactional and analytical workloads. 
Experience with Big-data solutions for distributed storage and computing like Hadoop or Spark. 
Familiarity with cloud providers (preferably AWS), time series data, CI/CD pipelines, GIT and/or infrastructure as code.  




We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all the listed qualifications. 




Life at the office 

We bring together talented people from diverse backgrounds. You will become part of an informal and diverse work environment where we focus on creating results together, and where you will be empowered to make decisions. We generally dislike meetings, PowerPoints, politics, and committees, but prefer to look at the code or the chart together over the screen for a few minutes and make the decisions there and then. 

We value work-life balance and support our team members' personal and professional commitments. While our dynamic work environment may require additional work hours, we ensure flexibility works both ways - whether you need time for personal appointments, family responsibilities, or other important life events. Our focus is on results and impact rather than rigid schedules. 




The practical stuff 

This position is based in Aarhus, Denmark. We operate in English and welcome international candidates. 

Start date: As soon as possible. 

To apply, please submit your CV and motivation letter. 

Applications will be processed on a rolling basis.

Our focus is on results and impact rather than rigid schedules. 


The practical stuff

To apply, please submit your CV and motivation letter. 

Applications will be processed on a rolling basis.

Title: Data Insights Consultant
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Topsoe is a leading global provider of technology and solutions for the energy transition. We combat climate change by helping our customers and partners achieve their decarbonization and emission reduction goals.

Based on decades of scientific research and innovation, we offer world leading solutions for transforming renewable resources into fuels and chemicals for a sustainable world, and for efficient and low-carbon fuel production and clean air.

We were founded in 1940 and are headquartered in Denmark, with over 2,800 employees serving customers all around the globe. To learn more, visit www.topsoe.com.

Who We’re Looking For

Can you identify needs, build, and apply BI reports to support the business and for decision-making, or do you have an interest within this area? Do you like to work, and help colleagues from many different departments and across functions? Then you might be the Data Consultant we are looking for!

Our team supports the business with tools and insights to make data-driven strategic and tactical improvements. We are a smaller team within the Business Finance organization with lots of ambitions, so there will be plenty of opportunity to make a difference and set the agenda on data communication, presentation and understanding together with the rest of the organization. Your role will be very diverse. One day you might be developing new insights reports, and the next day you will innovate existing analyses and reports – and discuss next-level solutions with stakeholders or managers.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Identifying and designing value-adding insights solutions
Interpreting business requests and clarifying data requirements
Assisting and advising on data models and scoping of new BI projects
Collaborating with highly skilled colleagues including Data analysts, Application Specialists, Business Partners, and Managers to service our clients coherently
Promoting new insights/reports (descriptive and prescriptive).


Our primary tools - knowledge to the tools is not a requirement:


SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud)
Excel and SAP Analysis
Eclipse IDE (Eclipse Modeling Tools)
PowerBI
PowerPoint and Think-cell.


What You’ll Bring

The preferred candidate has some years of experience from similar jobs, e.g., Business Analyst, BI Consultant or Data Analyst in either other companies or consultancy firms. It is a plus but not a requirement to have consultancy experience.

The right candidate could also be newly graduated and hold a master’s degree within Economics or Data Science or equivalent. If this is the case, together we will find the right balance between tasks and responsibilities to match your profile.

Why join us

There are many reasons to join us. To mention a few, you will get:


A job with a purpose: We are on a mission to solve the world’s climate crises. We are using our cutting-edge technology for a better world
A platform to grow from: We have personal and professional development high on our agenda, and we will provide you with tools and tasks to make you learn and grow
We care about you: We believe in the strength derived from diversity, and we strive to build trust in- and collaborate with one-another.


How You Can Apply

Please contact Andreas Bøttger, Finance Director, Commercial Business Finance & Data Insights, via ANBG@topsoe.com or +45 4188 9521 if you want to know more about the position.

If you would like to be part of a team of skilled and professional colleagues in an informal organization, please submit your application and resume in English through our website www.topsoe.com.

To ensure a secure and trustworthy work environment, our recruitment process may include background checks and criminal record requests.

Application deadline

February 15th, 2025.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Drive meaningful change

Are you ready to shape the future of data-driven decision-making? At Abacus Medicine, we’re looking for a passionate Data Engineer with 0 to 3 years of experience, eager to make an impact. Join us in creating cutting-edge data solutions that power business insights and innovation. If you're excited about Data Engineering, working with the latest technologies, and thrive on learning, this is the place for you.




Get a glimpse of our world

Abacus Medicine is searching for a driven Data Engineer to join the Data Engineering team, where you will play a pivotal role in building scalable and robust data solutions. The team is responsible for our cloud data platform and the systems and processes that take in raw data and produce high-quality data that supports downstream use cases such as BI solutions, insight generating analytics, and AI/ML solutions. We leverage a modern data tech-stack to develop robust data solutions and drive the corporate focus to enable data-driven decision-making. The position offers an opportunity to develop your data management skills in and shape the design of a modern cloud data solution.




Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

As a Data Engineer, you will take on responsibilities such as:

Design, develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines that perform data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes from various sources, ensuring data quality and efficiency.
Work on projects in the field of data engineering that directly impact our data-driven initiatives. Relating to data integration solutions, data quality, storage optimization, upgrading our architecture, and more.
Stay up to date with emerging data engineering trends and technologies to further develop our modern data cloud platform.
Leveraging our scalable monitoring tool and cutting-edge data observability platform to monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, identifying and resolving issues proactively and build solutions with the aim of reducing time to detection and time to resolution.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and other data professionals and stakeholders throughout the business to gather requirements and design robust data solutions, merging the expertise from different domains to find the best solution for each data challenge.
Optimize big data storage and data retrieval processes.




The Tech-Stack that you will be working with:

Azure Databricks
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data/Delta Lake
Python
PySpark
SQL
Azure DevOps
Monte Carlo, Data Observability Platform
Git
And more!




Fuel for your success in the role

To succeed in the job, it is important that you are passionate, possess technical skills, and have a genuine interest in working with new cloud technologies. Your motivation to deliver high-quality data services, which serve as a foundation for impactful decision-making and advanced analytics across the organization, will be crucial to your success. You thrive in a dynamic and ambitious team environment and approach problem-solving with a creative mindset.

In Data & Analytics, we promote continuous learning and development and help our data engineers to expand their expertise and knowledge in various domains. These are some key qualifications for this role:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
0-3 years of experience in Data Engineering or a related field.
Proficiency in Python programming.
Familiarity in working with source control such as git.
Basic knowledge of SQL.
Experience in data manipulation, data wrangling, and data cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity.
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
Proactive mindset with a continuous learning approach to keep up with evolving technologies in the data engineering field.
Good oral and written communication skills in English.







It is an advantage (but not a requirement) if you have knowledge or experience with:

Cloud platforms, such as Azure, AWS or GCP.
Azure Data/Delta Lake for efficient storage and processing of big data.
Apache Spark and Databricks for data processing and analytics.
Experience with PySpark.
Experience with Azure Data Factory, or familiarity with other similar data integration and orchestration tools.
Data governance and data modelling best practices
Understanding of CI/CD practices.




Your future colleagues

In the D&A department, we are responsible for developing and maintaining Abacus' datahub, as well as implementing our BI platform, facilitating data-driven projects, and developing advanced analytics models (ML). The department comprises 6 Data Scientists, 5 BI developers, 3 Data Analysts, and 5 Data Engineers.




Our team consists of individuals from diverse nationalities, expertise areas, educational backgrounds, and ownership responsibilities across our data platforms and services. This diversity creates a strong environment for collaboration, technical synergies, and support among units, all while maintaining a positive and motivating work environment.

In summary, our goal is to create innovative data-driven solutions for core business problems within a friendly and professional work setting.




Would you like to know more about us?




If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.




Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.




Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,300 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Title: Data Engineer (Consultant)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Consultant in Data Engineering at Netlight Copenhagen




Come work with us!




Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and foster personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.




About us

Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as a top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity, and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing across 12 offices in 8 countries, from Europe to North America.




What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Data Engineering at Netlight?

In our central Copenhagen office (Amagertorv 29), a collaborative community of around 90 colleagues drives innovation and technology across the IT sector. As a consultant at Netlight, you will play a pivotal role in shaping current and future products, systems, and technical solutions. This entails contributing to the growth and scaling of existing and emerging products and companies, while continuously learning and mastering a variety of technical tools.




As a consultant within the data area, you will help our clients in roles such as Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer, Data Architect to name a few. We build comprehensive data platforms that encompass data warehousing & data lake infrastructure, data modeling, and the implementation of ETL/ELT data pipelines, whether batch or real-time. We design and implement innovative data products, incorporating elements of backend and cloud engineering. We are at the forefront of advising clients around emerging topics such as data governance, AI and data mesh. At Netlight, you define your career path, clients you engage with, your role (based on your strengths, interests, and experience), and your connections with mentors, coaches, EDGE networks, and social circles.




Main responsibilities

Netlight prides itself on technological agnosticism, meaning that we adapt to our clients’ needs while solving intricate challenges. As a consulting force, we lead the technological frontiers and encourage constant growth. You will be challenged by us, our clients, and in turn, you will challenge them. Collaboratively, we foster growth and harness potential.




As a Netlight consultant, you are:

Passionate about leveraging technology for innovation and value creation
Striving to evolve as a valuable collaborator, leader, and tech expert
Committed to understanding clients’ visions and strategies to help them achieve their aspirations




We imagine that you:

Hold or will soon graduate with a master’s degree in Technology, Computer Science, IT, Software Development or related fields
Or hold a bachelor's degree in one of these areas plus two years of full-time working experience in a relevant IT-field
Bring experience as a young professional in software development, data engineering, or related domains
Have professional exposure from internships, part-time/full-time positions, or similar contexts in agile software engineering roles
Verbal and written proficiency in English
Based in Copenhagen or willingness to relocate to Copenhagen




Get in touch

Netlight is always on the lookout for new talents. If our vision resonates with you, we encourage you to submit your application. We will respond within two weeks if your profile aligns with the current requirements.




We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their unique perspectives and skills. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply and are dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all.




We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
If you are passionate about modern data platforms and want to be part of shaping Tryg's future, we would like to hear from you! Help us create value from data and build our new data platform!

About the job | Data Engineer

Tryg has a long tradition of working with data to understand risks. We are now taking this experience to the next level and expanding our activities to many different customer-centric initiatives. As data from the customer touchpoints is scattered in a series of different systems, we are building a data platform to obtain easy, purpose-driven, and compliant access to data.

In your role as our new Data Engineer, you will get full responsibility for implementing one or more data sources in the data layer. The work comprises technical disciplines such as data analysis, understanding of the ACORD data model, implementation of streaming ETL, and data quality tests.

As the best solutions are made in collaboration, you will engage with people from across the organization and will work closely with data scientists, app developers, business analysts, and business sponsors. You will join a large and ever-growing data engineering community in Tryg of like-minded people.

Our tech stack is ever-growing and evolving ensuring we stay up to date with the technology, as we often have to work on the edge of streaming. As a data engineer, you will mainly be exposed to:


SQL and SQLMesh – This is used to write the transformation logic
Trino and RisingWave – These are our execution engines
Kafka – Kafka is used as the streaming platform. Our pipelines work purely on Kafka; both input and output
GIT – Everything must go into a Git repository, and together with our DevOps team we are moving toward a GitOps setup.
GraphQL – Used as an integration layer to other systems to read data from


Through your collaboration with our Platform team you might also be exposed to the following technologies:


Docker
K8S
Operators
CI Pipelines


About you | Curious about learning new technologies

As mentioned the data engineering tech stack is heavily focused around Kafka and streaming. It is an advantage if you can demonstrate experience with some of these, but your great curiosity and an eternal willingness to invest in your own development are more important. We are constantly looking for smarter ways of working and your contribution is important. Prior work exposure with the Insurance domain is an advantage but not a pre-requisite.

We imagine that you are curious by nature and that you have a great appetite to get things done. You are very self-driven but enjoy working together with others. The team is scattered across many countries, so communicating online - both written and verbal - is not an issue for you.

You most likely have a background in a data-related field, and are used to analyzing and understanding large datasets. Solid experience with data analysis or Java development is wanted, but the lack of it can be compensated with analytical skills, a can-do attitude, and a willingness to learn from your experienced colleagues. Up until now you might only have worked with batch processing but want to expand your skillset with streaming – a journey we look forward to accompanying you on!

About Us

This is the very right moment to join us, as we focus strongly on digitalizing and innovating our services and business processes. Data is an incredibly important asset for Tryg, and you will have a large impact on the platforms we develop.

You will be part of a dedicated team of top professionals who implement Tryg's strategic ambitions based on a highly amplified data architecture. You will have a great deal of personal responsibility and have wide opportunities to learn and grow your knowledge.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Please send your application as soon as possible and no later than February 11th, 2025. We will be conducting interviews continuously and close the recruitment process when we find the right candidate.

The interview process consists of three interviews: 1) a technical interview with a take-home task given beforehand, 2) an interview where we talk about the team and tasks, and 3) an interview where the talent acquisition partner from HR participates as well.

If you have any questions about the role, please feel free to contact Andreas Harmuth, Data Engineering Manager, by email andreas.harmuth@tryg.dk or phone +45 29 12 90 70.

Job Requisition ID: 26895

We encourage everyone regardless of gender identity, age, background, disability or origin to apply for the position. We are proud to have high employee satisfaction, strong professionalism and equal opportunities to develop your career in the Tryg Group. Tryg is the largest non-life insurance company in Scandinavia with activities in Denmark, Norway and Sweden. Every day we strive – each in our own way – to create peace of mind and affect the lives of most Scandinavians. Read more at www.tryg.com
Show more

Title: Data Analyst with Focus on Geomagnetic Data Processing – DTU Space
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Join DTU Space on geomagnetic data processing!

Are you passionate about unravelling the mysteries of Earth’s magnetic field? Do you have a keen eye for detail, a self-motivated attitude, and strong problem-solving skills? If so, we invite you to apply for a researcher position at DTU Space, where you'll contribute to cutting-edge research in geomagnetic data processing.

About The Role

In this position, you'll work at the forefront of geomagnetic research, collaborating with an interdisciplinary team to process and analyze magnetic data. Your expertise will contribute to a deeper understanding of Earth's magnetic field, with the potential to make a significant impact in the field.

What We’re Looking For

We’re seeking someone who:


has solid knowledge of Earth's magnetic field and is familiar with magnetic data
is experienced in using MATLAB or Python for data processing
ideally, has prior experience with processing magnetic data
is comfortable working with the Linux operating system (this is a plus).


In addition to technical expertise, we value a team player who communicates effectively, thrives in a collaborative environment, and takes initiative.

Why join us?

At DTU Space, you’ll be part of a dynamic and supportive research community dedicated to pushing the boundaries of science and technology. Your work will play an integral role in advancing our understanding of geomagnetism and its applications.

If you meet the qualifications above and are excited about contributing to this fascinating field, we’d love to hear from you.

Salary and appointment terms

The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations.

The position is part-time (up to 15 hours per week) in agreement with the candidate. The position is temporary, lasting until 31 December 2026.

The starting date is 1 March 2025, or as mutually agreed.

Application and contact

Please submit your online application no later than Friday, 31 January 2025. Open the “Apply now” link, fill out the form and attach your motivated application, CV and exam certificates.

If you would like additional information about the position, please contact professor and head of the division of Geomagnetism and Geospace Nils Olsen, email nio@space.dtu.dk .

Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply. As DTU works with research in critical technology, which is subject to special rules for security and export control, open-source background checks may be conducted on qualified candidates for the position.

About DTU Space

DTU Space is Denmark's largest space research institute and a recognized international institution. With space as the starting point, we develop new technology, conduct research, educate engineers and PhD candidates, and provide advice, innovation and collaboration nationally and internationally.

Technology for people

DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.

Title: BI Developer
Description:
🌟 We're Hiring: BI Developer

We are seeking a passionate and skilled BI Developer to join our innovative team. If you excel in Tableau, data visualization, and analytics, and are eager to contribute to a mission-driven organization making a real difference, we'd love to hear from you! This position is open to candidates in the United States and Denmark, with a preference for those in the Copenhagen area.

🎯 Role: As a BI Developer, you will play a key role in transforming raw data into actionable insights. Your work will drive data-based decision-making and empower our teams to improve outcomes for our clients and organizations.

📍 Location: Remote (Denmark 🇩🇰 or United States 🇺🇸).

🙋‍♂️ About You: We're looking for a detail-oriented individual with a passion for data and visualization. Proficiency in Tableau and SQL is essential, along with the ability to analyze complex datasets and build user-friendly dashboards. Experience in ETL processes, statistical analysis, and other BI tools is a plus.

🛠️ Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports in Tableau to support various business functions
Collaborate with the director of research and outcomes, and tech team, to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and availability
Translate clinical indicators and key metrics into actionable dashboards and data visualizations
Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business strategies
Stay up-to-date with the latest features and best practices for Tableau and other relevant BI tools
Document processes, dashboards, and reporting methodologies for future reference
Evaluate and enhance BI tools and processes to improve data-driven decision-making capabilities


🌟 About Hi Rasmus:

Hi Rasmus is a cutting-edge SaaS solution empowering BCBAs, Speech Therapists, and Occupational Therapists to deliver effective, evidence-based programming for their clients. We're redefining the standards of care through technology, with a mission to empower providers and enhance outcomes for individuals and families affected by autism.

🌍 Hi Rasmus is currently improving the lives of kids on 5 continents, in 61 countries, and in all 50 US states, but the opportunities are endless! Join us in empowering therapists and transforming lives—one child at a time.

Requirements

🎓 Qualifications:


Proven experience with Tableau (certification is a plus!)
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analyzing datasets
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work collaboratively with team members
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment


🛠️ Preferred Skills:


Knowledge of ETL processes and tools
Experience with other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikView, Looker) is advantageous
Understanding of statistical analysis and predictive modeling techniques



Benefits

💵 Compensation


Competitive salary starting at $60,000 annually


💙 Perks & Benefits You'll Love


100% covered healthcare premium for employee-only standard plan (Family can join too, with a variable cost)
Optional group benefits: dental, vision, life, AD&D, short- & long-term disability, and even pet insurance
Professional development opportunities and room for growth within the company


🏖️ Time Off to Recharge


Paid Time Off: 10 vacation days, 5 sick days, 7 paid holidays + 3 floating holidays for ultimate flexibility


🏡 Work Style That Works for You


A fully remote and flexible work environment—work from wherever feels right!
Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the Autism healthcare space

Title: Data Center Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

At Smart Solutions Technologies (SST), we are a global leader in third-party IT technical support, dedicated to keeping businesses on the cutting edge. Our elite team of engineers works around the clock to ensure seamless system operations for clients worldwide. With a focus on quality, speed, and precision, we offer clear, reliable solutions that propel businesses forward.




Job description

Freelance Data Center Engineer (Copenhagen, Denmark)




Are you a skilled Data Center Engineer looking for flexible work opportunities? Join our team as a freelance Data Center Engineer! Here’s what you need to know:

Position: Freelance Data Center Engineer Location: Copenhagen




Job Overview:

We’re looking to onboard Data Center Network Field Engineers to support our client's data centers in Copenhagen. As a freelance Data Center Engineer, you’ll be part of our on-demand ticket-based dispatch team. Your role involves completing specific tasks outlined in assigned tickets. While this isn’t a full-time position, it offers flexibility and the chance to work with a global tech giant.




Here’s a quick summary:

- Role Type: Freelance/Casual (not a full-time position).

- Payment: Based on tickets received, with agreed rates (hourly, half-day, full-day)




-Work Details:

- Tasks will be assigned via tickets (volume may vary based on client's needs).

- Tickets typically come with 1-3 days’ advance notice to help you plan your availability.

- Flexibility is crucial as ticket schedules are difficult to adjust.




Detailed JD Below:

Job Responsibilities:

- OTDR, LSPM, BER, OSA(Optical Spectrum Analysis) & other fiber testing/cleaning tools
(testing, configuration, reporting), provisioning, install cables or optics for new circuits.
physical cabling, cable management, northbound cabling, (Fiber/Copper/Power).
- Support network and server teams by assisting with rack and stack and running cables.
Planned/Predictive maintenance or circuit migration support
- Labelling, patching, and asset tagging activities, perform installation as needed either
through physical or network medium.
- Follow specific task instructions and provision necessary reporting as necessary and
support either through phone, remote tools, or in person at onsite.
- Conduct failure analysis, perform functional testing of entire system/Identify failed
Component, planned maintenance or circuit migration support.
- Updating and recording of activities in relevant IT Ticket management system,
coordinating and agreeing attendance time and date with key stakeholders.







BreakFix/Technical Task List :

- Testing of fiber, high loss/break fiber Identification by OTDR/LSPM/VFL. Cleaning
fibers, replace the faulty optical cable. Installing loop backs, Optical Spectrum Analysis, BER
testing/MPO fiber testing etc
- Inserting/removing media, replacing defective components, assist with fault diagnosis
and investigation with RMA Processing.
- Configuring remote access, basic storage array configuration, replacing faulty cables.
- Rebooting routers, servers, storage devices or other equipment, tape management
and Maintenance
- Providing loop-back cables to test circuits remotely, re-seating or replacing
components or cables
- Power cycling, running diagnostics commands, conducting whole unit replacement.
- Deployment/Inscope Configuration activities:
- Servers (virtual & physical), storage & backup devices, server/routers appliances.
- Hyper converged infrastructure, tape storage units.
- Power distribution units up to 3KVA, UPS, earthing system, HVAC,
- Network switches, SAN fabric switches, KVM Units, WAN optimization devices.
- Firewalls, access points, routers, physical cabling, cable management with
remote assistance to team.
- Site Survey, Site Inspection and Site audit services with site maintenance & vendor
meet services.
Preferred Skillsets: Technical Experience:
- Fiber/Data/Copper cable installation, maintaining & Testing of both wired, wireless
and Fiber networks include working with MPO fibers.
- Infrastructure (Data center and network) hardware architecture as to understand the
procedure shared by L3 teams during troubleshooting, HS&E support.
- Knowledge of router/server/client operations in a domain environment including
active directory.
- Understanding of current and legacy hardware Infrastructure platforms.
- Good understanding of IT principles such as networks, hardware.
- hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting Infrastructure (DC & Network)
equipment's, rack, and stack of the equipment/cable.
- Hands-on experience in IMAC and break-fix activities related to infrastructure
environment.
- Ability to identify defective spares and replace them with provided good spares as
instructed and by physical observations.
- Knowledge of TCP/I P standards and networking. Experience with Tape management
activities.
- Best practices control and monitoring of server infrastructure, familiarity with backup
and recovery software and methodologies.
Preferred Skillsets: Project Management Experience:
- Task queue management, governance (SLA/KPI management, problem
Escalation/RCA/CAR), external vendor management.
- Customer facing skills, able to communicate clearly and effectively both with client
and the customer.
- Logical and analytical approach to work, accurate documentations.
- Independent working and manage team, as well as collaboration with team members.
- Intense focus on quality work, productive, proactive and efficient.




Work Experience:

- Years 5-8 years of Data center infrastructure, enterprise IT infrastructure or equivalent.
- Years 3+ Years of experience in fiber cabling, and testing of Optical fiber cable by OTDR,
LSPM, and other fiber test tool, BER test, OSA(Optical Spectrum Analysis), Traffic detector,
installation, configuration and troubleshooting of low-voltage electrical system “AC”)/(“DC”)
power, Ethernet cabling,




Equivalent Qualifications:

- Education BSc. degree in computer science or related field or equivalent associate
degree (A.A.) or equivalent from three-year college or technical school with an emphasis in
electronics required, bachelor's Degree preferred.
- Certification CCNA, Network+, CCNP, CCDP, CCIE or equivalent with fiber testing
certification.
- Tech certification knowledge of ITIL and experience of working within an ITIL
environment would be preferred.

Company Description

At Smart Solutions Technologies (SST), we are a global leader in third-party IT technical support, dedicated to keeping businesses on the cutting edge. Our elite team of engineers works around the clock to ensure seamless system operations for clients worldwide. With a focus on quality, speed, and precision, we offer clear, reliable solutions that propel businesses forward.


Job description

Freelance Data Center Engineer (Copenhagen, Denmark)


Are you a skilled Data Center Engineer looking for flexible work opportunities? Join our team as a freelance Data Center Engineer! Here’s what you need to know:

Position: Freelance Data Center Engineer Location: Copenhagen


Job Overview:

We’re looking to onboard Data Center Network Field Engineers to support our client's data centers in Copenhagen. As a freelance Data Center Engineer, you’ll be part of our on-demand ticket-based dispatch team. Your role involves completing specific tasks outlined in assigned tickets. While this isn’t a full-time position, it offers flexibility and the chance to work with a global tech giant.


Here’s a quick summary:

- Role Type: Freelance/Casual (not a full-time position).

- Payment: Based on tickets received, with agreed rates (hourly, half-day, full-day)


-Work Details:

- Tasks will be assigned via tickets (volume may vary based on client's needs).

- Tickets typically come with 1-3 days’ advance notice to help you plan your availability.

- Flexibility is crucial as ticket schedules are difficult to adjust.


Detailed JD Below:

Job Responsibilities:

  • - OTDR, LSPM, BER, OSA(Optical Spectrum Analysis) & other fiber testing/cleaning tools
  • (testing, configuration, reporting), provisioning, install cables or optics for new circuits.
  • physical cabling, cable management, northbound cabling, (Fiber/Copper/Power).

  • Planned/Predictive maintenance or circuit migration support

  • through physical or network medium.

Title: Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:


Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers


What you’ll Need to Succeed:


Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills


It’s Great if you Have:


Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

Title: Senior IT Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a talented individual to join our IT Technical Support team at Marsh, Denmark. This role will be based in Copenhagen, and is based onsite five days per week.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

We will rely on you to:


On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.


What you need to have:


Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality


What makes you stand out:


Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.


Why join our team:


We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders.
We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues, clients and communities.
Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well-being.


Marsh McLennan﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ (NYSE: MMC) is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ and Oliver Wyman﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿. With annual revenue of $23 billion and more than 85,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit marshmclennan.com﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿, or follow on ﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿LinkedIn﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ and X.

Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
