Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll conceptualise, develop, implement, and deploy systematic trading algorithms in the European short-term power markets. You’ll be able to contribute to the strategy development with your quantitative and programming skills and track performance in the market.

Welcome to European Power

You’ll be part of the Digital Trading team where you, together with your colleagues, will work on automated trading strategies from inception to deployment. You’ll be part of a newly established team where you’ll collaborate closely with traders to extract the most value from our 10 GW portfolio of renewable assets and create additional value with our proprietary trading strategies. As a team, we're commercially focused but technically savvy. We collaborate in an informal, laid-back environment where every voice is heard so that we all bring the best ideas forward.

You’ll play an important role in:


developing and perfecting our balancing algorithm to ensure the best execution of our assets
conceptualising and developing trading strategies in close collaboration with traders
continuously improving production strategies to drive profits
analysing data and training statistical models to predict prices and fundamental variables
writing robust, well-tested code and deploying it to production.


To succeed in the role, you:


have knowledge of, or an interest in learning about, the energy markets
like to work on interesting mathematical problems but are motivated by releasing your solutions in the real world
have a get-stuff-done mentality and are comfortable with trade-offs between speed and quality when needed
are numerically literate and have a good understanding of statistics and data science concepts
have professional experience as a Python developer and have a solid grasp of best practices within DevOps.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.
Show more
HTML:
Join us in this role where you’ll conceptualise, develop, implement, and deploy systematic trading algorithms in the European short-term power markets. You’ll be able to contribute to the strategy development with your quantitative and programming skills and track performance in the market.

Welcome to European Power

You’ll be part of the Digital Trading team where you, together with your colleagues, will work on automated trading strategies from inception to deployment. You’ll be part of a newly established team where you’ll collaborate closely with traders to extract the most value from our 10 GW portfolio of renewable assets and create additional value with our proprietary trading strategies. As a team, we're commercially focused but technically savvy. We collaborate in an informal, laid-back environment where every voice is heard so that we all bring the best ideas forward.

You’ll play an important role in:

  • developing and perfecting our balancing algorithm to ensure the best execution of our assets
  • conceptualising and developing trading strategies in close collaboration with traders
  • continuously improving production strategies to drive profits
  • analysing data and training statistical models to predict prices and fundamental variables
  • writing robust, well-tested code and deploying it to production.

To succeed in the role, you:

  • have knowledge of, or an interest in learning about, the energy markets
  • like to work on interesting mathematical problems but are motivated by releasing your solutions in the real world
  • have a get-stuff-done mentality and are comfortable with trade-offs between speed and quality when needed
  • are numerically literate and have a good understanding of statistics and data science concepts
  • have professional experience as a Python developer and have a solid grasp of best practices within DevOps.

Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

Title: SQL Developer med SAS kendskab
Description:
Vil du være med til at nyudvikle på - og vedligeholde EGSD's Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence platform til Danmarks bedste lønsystem, til kunder i det offentlige Danmark? Brænder du for at arbejde med komplekse opgaver?

Så er du måske én af de softwareudviklere, som vi er på jagt efter!

Hos EG Silkeborg Data har vi en ambition om at være den offentlige sektors mest værdifulde samarbejdspartner. Vi udvikler og varetager driften af produkter inden for bl.a. Løn, Økonomi, Medarbejderadministration, Organisation og Ledelsesinformation til kunder i det offentlige Danmark. Når vi gang på gang leverer unikke kvalitetsløsninger til kommuner og regioner, skyldes det, at vi er engagerede og alle brænder for at fastholde og udvikle det danske velfærdssystem gennem digitalisering.

Byg Bro mellem Data og Beslutninger

Medarbejderne i de offentlige institutioner forventer at få den rette løn til den rette tid, og det er vores ansvar at sikre at det sker. Lønberegning er komplekst, så høj kvalitet i vores løsninger og i vores leverancer er vigtig, for at sikre en høj kundetilfredshed. Data & BI Teamet bidrager til at skabe det bedste datagrundlag for at hjælpe vores kunder med at tage de rigtige beslutninger.

Alt data bliver trukket ud fra vores forskellige kildesystemer, og det ender i DB2 eller Oracle tabeller. Vi samler det hele sammen i vores Data Warehouse, hvor vi bearbejder og strukturerer dataene, så de kan præsenteres enten på sd.dk/sddw (SAS) eller via vores IBM-Cognos løsning som læser data fra vores ms-sqlserver.

Du kan se frem til en dagligdag med opgaver som:


Drift/overvågning af dataflow til DW og BI - primært decentralt, men også Host.
3. level teknisk support (kundehenvendelser, som vores kolleger i support har brug for hjælp til).
Bug fixing fra DataInput til DataOutput.
Opdatere sikkerhed/servicepacks/hot-fixes på vores MS-Server og SAS installation.
Fejlsøgning/Datadetektiv.
Analyse og opgavebeskrivelse ifm. nye kundekrav/-opgaver.
Udvikling på og af vores eksisterende platform og teknologistak.
Datastrategi: hvor skal vi hen på længere sigt.
Forvaltning og vedligehold af en platform med stor kompleksitet.
Sikre høj kvalitet i løsningen gennem reviews og test.


Du kommer med viden om og erfaring med én eller flere af nedenstående kompetencer i værktøjskassen.

Vi forventer du har erfaring med:


Microsoft SQL server.
SSIS.
SQL Performance.


Derudover vil det være en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du har kendskab til:


Visual Studio.
TFS/GIT.
SAS backend.
Linux.
Oracle queries.
Database: Oracle og DB2.
DB2 queries AQT.
Forståelse af Data arkitektur, begreber som Fact/Dimensioner, Star-schema og Snowflake.


For at blive en succes i rollen, er det vigtigt, at du…


Har stærke analytiske evner, og har mod på at sætte dig ind i et komplekst område.
Er god til at kommunikere med kollegerne omkring dig, hvad enten det f.eks. er en forretningsudvikler en kollega fra support- eller salgsteamet.
Kan samarbejde i et globalt setup med kolleger i både Danmark og Polen, så det er vigtigt, at du er flydende i engelsk, både mundtligt og skriftligt.
Og ikke mindst, at du er en teamspiller, der byder ind med energi, humør og viljen til at lykkes.


Hvad kan du forvente af os?


Fleksible arbejdstider, hvor du selv har mulighed for at planlægge din arbejdsdag.
Mulighed for hjemmearbejdsplads og hjemmearbejde efter behov eller arbejde på vores kontor primært i Aarhus.
Mulighed for at sætte dit fingeraftryk på metoder og løsninger.
Stillingen er i en spændende virksomhed, der er i en rivende udvikling.
Attraktiv frokost-, frugt og kaffe/the-ordning.
Aktiv personaleforening der arrangerer gode sociale events
Sundhedsforsikring.
In-house klinik med f.eks. fysioterapeut som supplement til sundhedsforsikring.


Hvis du vil vide mere

Er du interesseret i at høre mere, inden du søger, er du velkommen til at kontakte manager Karen Elbæk på telefon +45 20 85 94 76. Ansøgningerne vurderes løbende, og vi ansætter når den rette kandidat er fundet. Så send gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Alle henvendelser behandles fortroligt.

Vi udvikler fremtidens vertikale software, der påvirker kunderne og samfundet på en bæredygtig måde. Vi stræber altid efter at blive bedre: Vi er et dedikeret team af innovatører og problemløsere. Som en integreret del af vores kultur tager vi ansvar for vores bidrag til kunderne, hinanden og det samfund, vi lever i.

Læs mere Om EG og se også vores flotte video, som viser hvordan vores software gør en forskel We are EG - YouTube. Du kan også se vores nyeste video her, hvor fire af vores engagerede kolleger giver dig et indblik i deres arbejde hos EG.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Vil du være med til at drive dataindsigter, der gør en forskel?

Hos DK Company søger vi en BI Developer, der med erfaring og engagement kan være med til at styrke vores BI-løsninger. Du vil spille en vigtig rolle i at omsætte komplekse datasæt til brugbare indsigter og rapporter, der understøtter strategiske beslutninger og skaber værdi for forretningen.




Om at være BI Developer

Som BI Developer hos DK Company bliver du en vigtig del af vores BI-team, der arbejder på at skabe robuste og brugervenlige dataløsninger. Du tager ansvar for at udvikle rapporter og dashboards i Power BI og sikrer, at forretningens behov omsættes til konkrete løsninger med høj værdi.




Din rolle er både praktisk og analytisk, og du vil arbejde tæt sammen med kolleger i hele organisationen for at levere dataløsninger, der gør en forskel. Samtidig har du mulighed for at videreudvikle dine kompetencer gennem samarbejde med erfarne kolleger og adgang til de nyeste teknologier.




En typisk dag kan starte med teamets standup-møde, hvor dagens opgaver prioriteres. Herefter arbejder du med at designe og optimere Power BI-rapporter, der både har et solidt teknisk fundament og en intuitiv brugerflade. Du samarbejder med Business Partners, Data Engineers og øvrige BI Developere for at sikre, at løsningerne lever op til forretningens krav, og du bidrager til at forbedre eksisterende rapporter gennem performanceoptimering og feedback fra brugerne.




Ansvarsområder og fokus i rollen

Udvikle og vedligeholde Power BI-rapporter og dashboards, der er intuitive og brugervenlige, og som skaber værdi for forretningen.
Opbygge og optimere datamodeller med fokus på præcision, performance og brugervenlighed.
Supportere og uddanne brugere, så de kan få det fulde udbytte af Power BI-løsningerne, og yde løbende teknisk support ved behov.
Tage ejerskab for dine løsninger og sikre deres stabilitet og kvalitet over tid.
Samarbejde tæt med Business Partners, Data Engineers og øvrige BI Developere for at forstå forretningens krav og sikre, at dine leverancer opfylder behovene.
Deltage i forbedringsarbejde ved at identificere optimeringsmuligheder og løbende justere eksisterende rapporter og løsninger.




Om hvordan du lykkes i rollen

For at lykkes som BI Developer hos DK Company kræves en kombination af teknisk ekspertise, forretningsforståelse og stærke samarbejdsevner. Du har erfaring med Power BI og SQL og er fortrolig med at arbejde med datamodellering og rapportering.




Du har en analytisk tilgang og evner at omsætte komplekse data til handlingsorienterede indsigter, der skaber værdi for forretningen. Samtidig motiveres du af at samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af organisationen og tager ansvar for at levere løsninger af høj kvalitet.




Du har en naturlig nysgerrighed og en lyst til konstant at forbedre dig, lære nye teknologier og udforske innovative måder at arbejde med data på. Din stræben efter at udvikle dine færdigheder gør dig til en værdifuld del af teamet, og du bidrager til en kultur, hvor vi hele tiden arbejder på at blive bedre.




Tre vigtige kvalifikationer for rollen

Teknisk ekspertise: Erfaring med Power BI og DAX samt forståelse for datamodellering og rapportering. Erfaring med SQL er en fordel.
Forretningsforståelse: Du har en stærk evne til at forstå og omsætte forretningsbehov til dataløsninger. Erfaring fra modebranchen eller tilsvarende dynamiske og sæsonprægede brancher er en klar fordel.
Samarbejdsevner: Stærke kommunikationsevner og evnen til at samarbejde på tværs af teams og interessenter.




Din nysgerrighed og ambition om at udvikle dig sikrer, at dine løsninger ikke blot skaber værdi i dag, men også er fremtidssikrede. Du tager ansvar for dine opgaver og arbejder struktureret for at levere resultater af høj kvalitet. Med din positive energi og engagerede tilgang bidrager du til en kultur, hvor samarbejde og løbende forbedringer er i fokus, og hvor vi skaber værdi på tværs af organisationen.




Du kan forvente mindre rejseaktivitet (ca. 10-15 dage årligt) mellem vores danske lokationer i København, Ikast og Vejle, hvor du vil samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af afdelinger og teams.




Om DK Company og Teamet

DK Company A/S er en af Europas førende modekoncerner med 26 brands, der spænder fra casual til luksuriøst design. Vi opererer globalt og har en stærk tilstedeværelse både online og i detailhandlen. Med en kultur præget af innovation og kvalitet arbejder vi målrettet på at skabe værdi for vores kunder, medarbejdere og partnere.




BI-afdelingen er midt i en spændende transformation, hvor vi videreudvikler vores Power BI-løsninger og migrerer vores datawarehouse til en moderne dataplatform i Microsoft Fabric. Vi fokuserer på at levere avancerede dataløsninger, der understøtter forretningens mål, og vores team er præget af samarbejde, innovation og en uformel omgangstone med plads til både faglig og personlig udvikling.




Som en del af DK Company bliver du en del af et inspirerende arbejdsmiljø med fokus på innovation, udvikling og samarbejde.




Hvad vi kan tilbyde

En vigtig rolle i en moderne BI-afdeling med masser af læringsmuligheder.
Mulighed for at arbejde med de nyeste teknologier inden for data og analytics.
Et fleksibelt og socialt arbejdsmiljø med personalegoder som sundhedsforsikring, pensionsordning og rabat på vores brands.
Sociale aktiviteter og teamarrangementer, der styrker fællesskabet.




Praktiske oplysninger

Arbejdssted: København.
Referencer: Stillingen refererer til Business Intelligence Manager.
Ansættelsesvilkår: Løn og vilkår matcher din erfaring og baggrund.




Om ansøgningen

Har du lyst til at blive vores nye kollega, så send din Ansøgning og dit CV til os via linkedIn "Easy Apply". Du har kun mulighed for at vedhæfte 1 fil, hvorfor du bedes samle både ansøgning og CV i samme fil.

Vi afholder løbende samtaler, så vi ser gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt.




For spørgsmål om stillingen, kontakt Business Intelligence Manager Simon Mundt Linulf på siml@dkcompany.com.




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more

  • Et fleksibelt og socialt arbejdsmiljø med personalegoder som sundhedsforsikring, pensionsordning og rabat på vores brands.
  • Sociale aktiviteter og teamarrangementer, der styrker fællesskabet.


Praktiske oplysninger

  • Arbejdssted: København.
  • Referencer: Stillingen refererer til Business Intelligence Manager.
  • Ansættelsesvilkår: Løn og vilkår matcher din erfaring og baggrund.


Om ansøgningen

Har du lyst til at blive vores nye kollega, så send din Ansøgning og dit CV til os via linkedIn "Easy Apply". Du har kun mulighed for at vedhæfte 1 fil, hvorfor du bedes samle både ansøgning og CV i samme fil.

Vi afholder løbende samtaler, så vi ser gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt.


For spørgsmål om stillingen, kontakt Business Intelligence Manager Simon Mundt Linulf på siml@dkcompany.com.


Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Title: Data Engineer, der brænder for data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
HOFORs Dataplatform er den centrale hub, hvor HOFOR samler, strukturerer og udstiller data internt og eksternt. Du vil derfor komme til at arbejde med onboarding af datakilder, optimering af data pipelines, samt udvikling og opbygning af de centrale datamodeller, der anvendes til applikations- og analyseformål på tværs af virksomheden. Vi arbejder blandt andet med store mængder tidsseriedata og data med høj kompleksitet.

Velkommen til Digital Udvikling

Vi har en ledig stilling som Data Engineer i Digital Udvikling, nærmere bestemt i Dataplatformsteamet. Vi søger efter dig, der enten har nogle års erfaring som Data Engineer eller anden tilsvarende erfaring inden for dataområdet. Det vigtigste er, at du har interesse i at arbejde struktureret med data og gerne vil være en del af et team, der samarbejder og sparrer om opgaverne. Det er også en klar fordel, hvis du synes, det er spændende at arbejde med forskellige typer af data.

Dine nøgleopgaver bliver at:


Udvikle og vedligeholde dataløsninger i Azure Synapse 
Optimere ETL-processer og sørge for, at data er valide, pålidelige, opdaterede og tilgængelige for analyse og beslutningstagning 
Udvikle datamodeller i henhold til medallion lakehouse arkitektur, samt deltage i udviklingen af den fælles datamodel for HOFOR 
Skrive tests og monitorere data pipelines 
Sikre konsistens af data på tværs af forretningsområder – ofte i samarbejde med forretningen. 



Nogle af de nuværende teknologier vi arbejder med, er Azure Synapse, Azure SQL Server, Apache Spark, Delta Lake, Python mv. Vi er i øjeblikket i gang med et pilotprojekt i Microsoft Fabric, som vi fremover vil arbejde videre med. Det mest centrale for os er dog ikke hvilken teknologi der anvendes, men om løsningerne er robuste, skalérbare og kan driftes. Derudover er omdrejningspunktet for arbejdet med dataløsningerne, at de så vidt muligt bør overholde strukturen i den fælles datamodel for HOFOR. Denne model er udviklet og beskrevet i samarbejde med forretningen, og sikrer at der findes en klar definition af centrale begreber.

Vi arbejder agilt og med mange forskellige teknologier

Vi arbejder agilt i et SCRUM-team, der udvikler og drifter data- og integrationsløsninger som understøtter forretningsbehovene internt i HOFOR og hos vores eksterne samarbejdspartnere. Da vi ikke kun udvikler løsninger, men også står for driften, er DevOps en central del af tankegangen i teamet. Vi udvikler, tester og deployer løsninger vha. Azure Devops og sørger for løbende opdatering, konfiguration og monitorering i Azure. Da vi følger DevOps tankegangen er deployment af løsninger automatiseret via pipelines og IaC. 

Vi forventer derfor, at du har:


Solid erfaring med datatransformation/ETL
Erfaring med Python/Pyspark og SQL 
Erfaring med DevOps, Git og CI/CD 
Kendskab til medallion lakehouse arkitektur 
Erfaring med at tænke drift og videreudvikling ind løsningsdesignet 
Et agilt mindset og evnen til at forstå forretningskrav og omsætte disse til løsninger 



Vi glæder os til at byde dig velkommen

Som vores nye kollega bliver du en del af sektionen Digital Udvikling, der hører til i området Digitalisering & IT, som består af ca. 160 medarbejdere. Sektionen har ansvaret for udvikling, drift og vedligeholdelse af en række løsninger i HOFOR og består pt. af 17 specialister og ledere.

Vi er stolte af at kalde os selv et professionelt team med høj faglighed og et godt sammenhold, og vi sætter pris på sparring og samarbejde. Du kan se frem til at blive en del af en virksomhed, hvor viden og faglighed værdsættes. Du kommer til at indgå i et åbent og uformelt arbejdsmiljø med engagerede og dygtige kolleger.

Du kan læse mere om vores medarbejdergoder her

Bliv en del af HOFOR og vær med til at gøre en forskel

Er du klar til nye muligheder, så ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning og CV senest den 14.02.2025 - men meget gerne før! Vi indkalder til samtaler løbende, og ønsker opstart snarest muligt.

Vi forbeholder os samtidig retten til at fjerne opslaget inden ansøgningsfristen, hvis vi finder den rette kandidat.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Janika Gilbert, Sektionsleder, jangil@hofor.dk .

Send din ansøgning ved at klikke på ”Søg stillingen” i højre side.

Er jobbet ikke det rette match for dig?

Hvis dette job ikke er det rette match for dig, vil vi opfordre dig til at dele jobannoncen med andre i dit netværk, der kunne finde stillingen interessant. Tag også et kig på vores andre ledige stillinger her - måske vi har det rette job til dig.

Hos os får du plads

Vand, varme, hverdag. I HOFOR sikrer vi forsyningen i hovedstadsområdet. Men vores ansvar rækker længere: Vi skaber fremtidens bæredygtige byer. Det kræver overskud, og derfor giver vi dig plads. Plads til at forfølge de store ideer og til at hente de små. Plads til at dyrke de faglige detaljer og til at tegne de store linjer. Plads til at hjælpe hinanden og til at tænke nyt, når der er brug for det. Vi har plads til flere og til, at du kan være med.

HOFOR. Hos os får du plads. Til fællesskab, udvikling og et bæredygtigt arbejdsliv.

Inkluderende kultur og rekruttering

I HOFOR arbejder vi på at skabe en inkluderende kultur, og vi leder efter dygtige kollegaer uanset udseende, køn, kønsidentitet, seksuel orientering, etnicitet, religion, handicap, alder osv. Vi vil gerne skabe lige muligheder for alle samt sikre en retfærdig rekrutteringsproces. Undlad venligst at vedhæfte et billede.

Title: Leder af Data & Analytics hos Velliv
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du være med til at løfte Velliv til næste niveau i vores datadrevne rejse? Som leder af vores afdeling, Data & Analytics (D&A), får du en helt central rolle i at realisere vores visioner om værdiskabende dataanvendelse.

Giv mening: Skab en tydelig vision for data i Velliv

Velliv er 100% kundeejet, og vores strategiske retning fokuserer på at sætte kunderne i centrum gennem datadrevne beslutninger. Din rolle bliver at sikre, at data bruges til at levere præcise og værdifulde løsninger for både interne og eksterne kunder. Vi har allerede sat ambitiøse mål om øget digitalisering, automatisering og effektiv udnyttelse af Cloud-services. Dit arbejde vil derfor have en direkte effekt på Vellivs konkurrencekraft og vores kunders oplevelse gennem brug af AI og mere traditionelle Analytics-værktøjer.

Skab udvikling: Led transformationen

Data & Analytics er en tværorganisatorisk enhed, hvor du leder et team af pt. 9 dygtige medarbejdere. Afdelingen skal organiseres i forretningsnære teams med dedikerede enheder på tværs af værdikæden for Velliv, og en vigtig opgave for dig bliver at sikre, at vi sætter det rigtige hold og skaber en stærk kultur, der kan drive vores dataambitioner fremad.

Du vil være ansvarlig for:


Personaleledelsen for Data & Analytics og at sikre, at teamet har de rette kompetencer til at lykkes i en fremtid præget af øget dataanvendelse og AI
At etablere forretningsnære teams på tværs af Velliv
At genere indsigter og guide forretningsstrategien gennem ’thought leadership’ for udnyttelse af data
Samarbejdet med it- og forretningsinteressenter for at tilpasse udviklingsindsatsen til forretningen, f.eks. onboarding af nye systemer og sikring af robust dataarkitektur og systemtilstand
Input på det overordnede D&A ressourceestimat og budget, koordinering af tværfaglige teams med resten af forretningen og forankring af dataområdet som en strategisk prioritet


Sæt retning: Vær en visionær, stærk faglig og forretningsdrevet leder

Du bliver ansvarlig for at fastlægge og kommunikere en klar retning for, hvor Velliv skal hen med data og analytics. Din naturlige autoritet og evne til at skabe samarbejde på tværs gør dig til en dygtig leder, der sikrer fremdrift og resultater. Du skaber tillid gennem åbenhed og struktur, og du motiverer dine omgivelser ved at sætte ambitiøse, men realistiske mål. Med en jordnær og relations-orienteret tilgang bliver du den, der skaber det fundament, vi skal bruge for at blive endnu mere datadrevne.

Kvalifikationer og personlige egenskaber:


Minimum 5 års erfaring inden for datamanagement, analytics og rapportering.
Erfaring med programledelse, interessenthåndtering og/eller forandringsledelse.
Kendskab til Cloud-baserede platforme, services og værktøjer (Snowflake er vores strategiske platform).
Relevant uddannelse på kandidat-niveau – gerne med en teknisk profil.
Erfaring med data og compliance fra en reguleret industri samt AI er en fordel.


Personligt er du analytisk, struktureret og en dygtig kommunikator – både over for dine medarbejdere og ledelsen. Du forstår at oversætte komplekse problemstillinger til løsninger, som skaber værdi for forretningen. Du holder af at udvikle dine medarbejdere og være i dialog med forretningen.

Plads til at være menneske – plads til at være dig

Velliv er to år i træk blevet kåret til at have branchens bedste medarbejderimage og har gennem flere år vundet prisen som Årets Pensionsselskab. Hos os bliver du mødt med åbne arme, og vi gør os umage for, at du kommer godt fra start og hurtigt falder til.

Du har mulighed for at melde dig ind i ”Klub Velliv” og deltage i aktiviteter inden for sport, mad, hobby og kultur for os medarbejdere og vores børn. I det hele taget kan du forvente en kultur, hvor vi lever vores tre kerneværdier: Optimisme, Ordentlighed og Omsorg.

I Velliv skal der være plads til at være menneske – plads til at være dig.

Interesseret?

Vil du høre mere, kan du kontakte Jacob Vammen på telefon +45 29672736. Ansøgninger behandles løbende.

Vil du lære Velliv bedre at kende? Læs mere her
Show more

Title: Data Engineer with expertise in Databricks and/or Microsoft Fabric, Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a talented Data Engineer with a flair for designing and building robust data systems? Do you feel at home working in Databricks, Azure and Fabric, using technologies such as Python, PySpark, SQL, Purview and Profisee? If so, we are looking for you!

We’re keen to hear from data professionals who are ready to take their skills to the next level while collaborating with some of the best minds in the industry.

About Us

Valcon is a leading European management consulting firm with Scandinavian roots. With offices in the Netherlands, Denmark, the UK, Sweden, Germany, Croatia and Serbia, we strive to connect strategy with operations through innovative technology and data. We are looking for individuals who are driven and possess a “can do” attitude.

Experience


A master’s degree and at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or a similar role
Ideally, hands-on experience with Databricks, Fabric and the wider Azure ecosystem for Data & AI
Drive clarity not only around the “how”, but also the “why” for data engineering solutions


Keywords


Data Engineer
Collaboration
3+ years of work experience


Location: Denmark

What You’ll Do

As a Data Engineer at one of Europe’s fastest-growing consultancies, you will:


Solve complex challenges for Danish and international companies across industries
Work side by side with skilled and experienced colleagues and clients, many of whom have several years of experience and backgrounds in executive positions in other companies
Design and build scalable ETL pipelines to support our clients’ data integration and transformation needs
Use cutting-edge tools and technologies like Databricks and Fabric to create meaningful solutions to our clients
Leverage IaC to provision resources in modern data lakehouses
Develop data models and architectures that enable efficient querying, reporting and analysis for complex organisations
Engage in cross-functional teams to ensure data systems are aligned with business objectives and drive value
Drive clarity not only around the “how”, but also the “why” for data engineering solutions


What We’re Looking For

We want someone who is not only skilled but also committed to personal and professional growth. To thrive in this role, you’ll need:


A master’s degree and at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or a similar role
Ideally, hands-on experience with Databricks, Fabric and the wider Azure ecosystem for Data & AI
A firm theoretical foundation for data modelling and data architecture paired with practical experience
Familiarity with Git version control, DevOps, MLOps pipelines, CI/CD and test automation
Proficiency in Python, SQL and ideally also PySpark
Commitment to continuous professional and personal development, including certifying on key technologies (see below) at a reasonable pace
Willingness to be an active member of professional communities by participating in (and potentially organising) events


Certifications we love

Amongst Others, We Value These Certifications


Databricks Certified Data Engineer Professional (or higher)
DP-100 Azure Data Scientist Associate
DP-203 Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure
DP-600 Fabric Analytics Engineer Associate
DP-700 Fabric Data Engineer Associate
AI-102 Azure AI Engineer Associate
AZ-104 Azure Administrator Associate
AZ-305 Azure Solutions Architect Expert


It is not a problem if you don’t have them yet, but we do expect a commitment to achieve many of them over time. We will discuss your learning plan for the first 12 months during the interview process. This includes getting started on certifying as well as important advisory fundamentals, which we consider important to ensure full impact at our clients in every assignment.

We offer you

The opportunity to work in a diverse and international environment with an informal culture, a flat hierarchy, in which we cooperate across business areas and levels. You will be working with some of the most talented and experienced consultants, and you will become part of a value-driven company, where our values; Integrity, Together, Joy, Curious and Can do are the corner stones in everything we do.

We care about results, not methodologies. But first and foremost, we care about people and how we can constantly challenge each other to become better. To do better. Your background is less important to us than your ability to create results, to create change. We prize excellence and ingenuity but know that both must be grounded in reality. The reality of making our clients ready for the future.

A workplace in the heart of Copenhagen, Meldahlsgade 5, Copenhagen V.

Application

Does this sound like you? If so, please apply below. If you have any questions or need more information, feel free to contact our People & Culture department at [email protected].

We will be reviewing applications and conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send us your application as soon as possible.

HTML:
Are you a talented Data Engineer with a flair for designing and building robust data systems? Do you feel at home working in Databricks, Azure and Fabric, using technologies such as Python, PySpark, SQL, Purview and Profisee? If so, we are looking for you!

We’re keen to hear from data professionals who are ready to take their skills to the next level while collaborating with some of the best minds in the industry.

About Us

Valcon is a leading European management consulting firm with Scandinavian roots. With offices in the Netherlands, Denmark, the UK, Sweden, Germany, Croatia and Serbia, we strive to connect strategy with operations through innovative technology and data. We are looking for individuals who are driven and possess a “can do” attitude.

Experience

  • A master’s degree and at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or a similar role
  • Ideally, hands-on experience with Databricks, Fabric and the wider Azure ecosystem for Data & AI
  • Drive clarity not only around the “how”, but also the “why” for data engineering solutions

Keywords

  • Data Engineer
  • Collaboration
  • 3+ years of work experience

Location: Denmark

What You’ll Do

As a Data Engineer at one of Europe’s fastest-growing consultancies, you will:

  • Solve complex challenges for Danish and international companies across industries
  • Work side by side with skilled and experienced colleagues and clients, many of whom have several years of experience and backgrounds in executive positions in other companies
  • Design and build scalable ETL pipelines to support our clients’ data integration and transformation needs
  • Use cutting-edge tools and technologies like Databricks and Fabric to create meaningful solutions to our clients
  • Leverage IaC to provision resources in modern data lakehouses
  • Develop data models and architectures that enable efficient querying, reporting and analysis for complex organisations
  • Engage in cross-functional teams to ensure data systems are aligned with business objectives and drive value
  • Drive clarity not only around the “how”, but also the “why” for data engineering solutions

What We’re Looking For

We want someone who is not only skilled but also committed to personal and professional growth. To thrive in this role, you’ll need:

  • A master’s degree and at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or a similar role
  • Ideally, hands-on experience with Databricks, Fabric and the wider Azure ecosystem for Data & AI
  • A firm theoretical foundation for data modelling and data architecture paired with practical experience
  • Familiarity with Git version control, DevOps, MLOps pipelines, CI/CD and test automation
  • Proficiency in Python, SQL and ideally also PySpark
  • Commitment to continuous professional and personal development, including certifying on key technologies (see below) at a reasonable pace
  • Willingness to be an active member of professional communities by participating in (and potentially organising) events

Certifications we love

Amongst Others, We Value These Certifications

  • Databricks Certified Data Engineer Professional (or higher)
  • DP-100 Azure Data Scientist Associate
  • DP-203 Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure
  • DP-600 Fabric Analytics Engineer Associate
  • DP-700 Fabric Data Engineer Associate
  • AI-102 Azure AI Engineer Associate
  • AZ-104 Azure Administrator Associate
  • AZ-305 Azure Solutions Architect Expert

It is not a problem if you don’t have them yet, but we do expect a commitment to achieve many of them over time. We will discuss your learning plan for the first 12 months during the interview process. This includes getting started on certifying as well as important advisory fundamentals, which we consider important to ensure full impact at our clients in every assignment.

We offer you

The opportunity to work in a diverse and international environment with an informal culture, a flat hierarchy, in which we cooperate across business areas and levels. You will be working with some of the most talented and experienced consultants, and you will become part of a value-driven company, where our values; Integrity, Together, Joy, Curious and Can do are the corner stones in everything we do.

We care about results, not methodologies. But first and foremost, we care about people and how we can constantly challenge each other to become better. To do better. Your background is less important to us than your ability to create results, to create change. We prize excellence and ingenuity but know that both must be grounded in reality. The reality of making our clients ready for the future.

A workplace in the heart of Copenhagen, Meldahlsgade 5, Copenhagen V.

Application

Does this sound like you? If so, please apply below. If you have any questions or need more information, feel free to contact our People & Culture department at [email protected].

We will be reviewing applications and conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send us your application as soon as possible.

Title: Software Developer - Intraday Quantitative Development
Description:
Are you passionate about crafting exceptional software that drives cutting-edge trading strategies? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment where your contributions shape the future of energy trading? If so, we’ve got the perfect opportunity for you!




Join our growing intraday quantitative trading team, where you'll work with cutting-edge technology and play an integral role in our innovative trading strategies.




NET is a dynamic, fast-paced company that values a low-formality work environment. We embrace modern tools and empower individuals with trust and autonomy. Our focus is on achieving a high level of automation and adopting a systematic approach to decision-making, particularly in the realm of quantitative trading.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain software applications for algorithmic trading, primarily in Python with ample opportunity to branch into C# if desired.
Collaborate with traders and analysts to optimize trading strategies and implement new features.
Design and build robust tools for data exploration and analysis.
Contribute to developing a modern data pipeline for quantitative trading.
Become a leading expert on high quality Python development and pass this knowledge on to your peers.




Job Requirements

A master’s degree in computer science or a related field.
At least 2 years of experience in software development.
Strong expertise in building robust, well-structured Python applications.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to thrive in a team-oriented environment.
A passion for continuous learning and professional growth.




Desirable Qualifications

Experience with model and data pipeline tools (dagster, great expectations, scikit, etc.).
Familiarity with Kubernetes deployment and/or Azure.
Understanding of automated deployment processes.




What We Offer

Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.
Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement.
A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Access to cutting-edge technology and resources.
Full-time employment based in our Aalborg office.
Flexible working hours and work-from-home options.




Ready to Join Us?

If this opportunity excites you, we’d love to hear from you! Click “APPLY HERE” —we’re always eager to welcome talented individuals and help them thrive.

Have questions or need more details? Feel free to reach out to Troels Møller Larsen for more information.

Title: Quantitative Analyst for US Trading Team
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst for US Trading

At MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and drive the green transition.

We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious US Power Trading team. This is your opportunity to play a key role in the dynamic and evolving US power market, working alongside talented traders and analysts who share your drive for excellence and innovation.

Why join us?

At MFT Energy, we combine a startup mindset with the strength of a global organization. We believe in empowering individuals to make data-driven decisions in a fast-paced environment where collaboration, innovation, and entrepreneurial thinking are the cornerstones of our success.

As a quantitative analyst in MFT, you’ll be at the heart of our US power trading team, which specializes in navigating one of the world’s most complex and fast-moving energy markets.

Here’s What You’ll Be Doing


Modelling: Build Mathematical models to support trading strategies
Data infrastructure: Enhance and streamline data pipelines, ensuring robust analytics and efficient operations.
Team collaboration: Work closely with traders and analysts to translate market insights into actionable tools and models.
Innovation: Research and implement new technologies and methodologies to stay ahead in energy market modeling and analytics.


What We’re Looking For


Master’s or PhD in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or another quantitative field.
Proficiency in Python and a statically typed programming language.
Experience designing and maintaining reliable, automated systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills preferable with strong knowledge of Statistics.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


You should expect technical tests as part of the recruitment process.

Our ideal candidate

You thrive in high-pressure environments. You have a desire to solve complex problems optimally from the ground up with next level curiosity. Furthermore, it's an expectation that the candidate is passionate about stock markets, gaming, betting, science fiction, manga or similar (passion being the keyword).

What We Offer


A dynamic, entrepreneurial work environment where the best ideas win.
Talented and ambitious colleagues who challenge and support you.
Competitive benefits and a people-first leadership approach.
Mind boggling daily lunch conversations (e.g. physicists explaining space-time and Schrödinger's cat or lectures on differences between wizards and sorcerers).


Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations - Please send us the following information: your CV, a link to your GitHub or other passion projects examples, your grades, and answers to the four questions in the application form. No cover letter needed.

For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Start date: As soon as possible

We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

We are a global and independent energy trading hub specializing in power and gas, trading 24/7 across 39 countries. With MFT Energy's unique partner model, we empower entrepreneurs to become the best and make the most of their talent. We believe the most successful way to advance our business is to extend a sense of ownership to as many employees as possible.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Do ETL processes, workflow automation, and data transformation excite you? Are you ready to grow your career in Data Engineering and help shape the future of the automotive industry? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Data Engineer.




We are a high-growth SaaS and analytics company that works predominantly in the automotive industry, where we bridge the gap between data and insights, providing our clients with the necessary tools and intelligence to make informed decisions and optimize their operations. We build automations and utilize prediction models for our prestigious clients so they can take action on data. We work with the biggest clients in the industry such as Audi, VW, Porsche, SKODA, Seat, Peugeot, Opel, Suzuki, KIA and Citroën.

We are looking to hire a full-time Data Engineer to join our growth journey and help us to continue to deliver outstanding products and services to our customers.




The Position

As a Data Engineer at ag analytics, you will be able to leverage your analytic skills to gain insights from a diverse range of data sources. You will be working in our Data Science department, where your main tasks will include:

· Building, maintaining, and optimizing ETL workflows using tools such as Apache Airflow.

· Developing R and Python scripts for data processing and analysis.

· Automating data workflows and ensuring efficient execution.

· Integrating APIs to enhance data accessibility.

· Ensuring data quality through robust testing and validation of workflows.

· Collaborating with cross-functional teams to support analytics and reporting needs.




With exposure to a wide range of technologies, you will have the chance to expand your knowledge and develop your career in a dynamic and challenging environment.




About You

You have a background in data science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, or other relevant scientific education. You have practical experience working with R and Python and are curious to know more and develop your skills within both Data Science and Data Engineering.

At ag analytics, we believe that passion is the key to success. We are not just looking for individuals with a specific set of hard skills; rather, we are seeking individuals who are truly passionate about data analytics, technology, and making a difference in the world. We believe that with the right mindset and drive, skills can be developed and honed over time. Our clients expect the best from us, so we expect you to be a self-starter, take responsibility, and keep deadlines. You take ownership of your tasks, you are curious and willing to learn and improve. You work in a structured manner, have an eye for detail and ensure we always deliver the highest quality.




Skills and Qualifications

· Experience in building ETL pipelines and workflow automation.

· Good knowledge of programming languages such as R and Python.

· 2-4 years of practical experience.

· Highly structured and committed to delivering reliable, high-quality solutions.

· Good verbal and written English skills.

· Enjoys working on dynamic and diverse data projects.




Nice-to-Have

· Experience working in a Scrum environment.

· Practical experience with Apache Airflow.




About Us

ag analytics is a highly international scale-up with a team of over 40 who are passionate about predictive data analytics. Our offices are on Højbro Plads in the tech start-up community Matrikel 1. We are highly focused on delivering best-in-class solutions to our customers while learning and developing at the same time. We have an informal and relaxed team atmosphere with team events, breakfasts and Friday bars. You can read more about us here www.aganalytics.dk




Please note: this is not a remote role, you will be working in our Copenhagen office.




How to apply

Please apply using the ‘apply’ button, we do not accept applications via email. We interview on an ongoing basis so please apply as soon as possible. We expect to begin responding to the applications at the beginning of January 2025.




If you have any questions about the role, please contact our Head of Engineering, Jan Vittrup Hansen at jvt@aganalytics.dk




We look forward to hearing from you.

Show more

Title: Student Helper - Business Intelligence
Description:
Student Helper - Business Intelligence at Advansor




Advansor is looking for a Student Helper - Business Intelligence to become part of a successful company driven by climate actions.




The Student Helper should be able to work approximately 2 days per week. The total number of working hours can also be spread over more than 2 days, but the exact working schedule will be planned on an ongoing basis.




Your role

The Controlling department at Advansor acts as support function for management, providing data for decision-making.




You will participate in project work related to data management, governance and implementation of new systems in co-operation with IT and Accounting. This also means that you will cooperate with departments across the entire organisation.




Your main tasks will include:

Play a role in our efforts on data governance
Participate in securing Optimal use of data to support business strategies
Analyses and reports, including creation and updating reports and dashboards in PowerBI
Participate in project work on data governance and business intelligence
Secure that data is structured, accessible and easy to understand for technical and non-technical colleagues
Participate in the development and implementation of new governance structure, securing correct collection, structuring and use of data
Work with different data models and data protection as well as participating in practical data tasks
Securing that all data efforts are connected to the strategic targets of the company




What does the position require from you?

You are probably studying Cand. Merc. BI or Cand. Merc. IT, but it is not a requirement. You are fluent in English as you will be working with colleagues of many different nationalities.




In order to succeed in the position, you must be curious about how things work and have the desire to learn new things. It is only positive if you are critical and open to ask questions – better too many than too few.




The tasks you will handle require some knowledge about PowerBI. You don’t have to be an expert, but you must be willing to learn. In general, you are expected to take responsibility for own learning.




When working in the Controlling department, no two days are the same. Unplanned tasks will always come up, so you should be comfortable with handling sudden changes in priorities.




Knowledge to DAX will be an advantage but is not a requirement.




We offer

As part of Team Advansor, you will get to work with more than 350 competent colleagues of more than 35 different nationalities and join us in our mission: to design and produce the world’s best sustainable climate solutions. You will become part of a highly ambitious company that values a good working environment, diversity, and teamwork.




The company is located in Brabrand close to E45 with good access and within walking distance to the bus stop.




If you are interested in the position, please send your application and CV in English online through our website. We aim for a start date mid-February, but it is not a prerequisite for employment that you will be able to start exactly then.




Please contact Malene Birck Jensen, Operation Controller at mbj@advansor.com if you have any questions about the position or Advansor as a workplace.




We look forward to receiving your application.




Sustainable CO2 climate solutions

As a market-leading manufacturer, we have designed and produced more than 16,000 CO2 systems for sustainable commercial and industrial cooling and heating around the world since 2006.




Many people associate CO2 with global warming. We’re cool with that. Literally. Because CO2 is the most climate-friendly refrigerant: It is non-toxic, non-flammable and does not harm our drinking water. That is why we are ’cool with CO2’.

Title: Quantitative analyst
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bliv en del af vores team i Modellering & Innovation, hvor vi udvikler og driver komplekse modeller til præcise forsikringsberegninger og strategisk styring. Vær med til at forme fremtidens forsikringsløsninger.

Vi har bedt din kommende leder om at sætte ord på jobbet og opgaverneVores "kunder" er Aktuariatet, investerings- og finansafdelingerne samt ledelse og direktion. Modellering & Innovation, som er en del af Aktuar & Analyse i Velliv, har et mål om at blive set som en forretningspartner, der med dataindsigt, analytiske kompetencer og forretningsforståelse, bidrager med finansiel viden og understøtter Vellivs væsentlige beslutningsprocesser med fakta og analyser.

Dine primære opgaver bliver:


Videreudvikle og forfine teknisk fundament for hensættelsesmodeller og solvensmodel
Drift af solvens- og hensættelsesmodellerne
Rapportering på baggrund af ovenstående modeller.


Du har forudsætningerne og modet til mere

Der er styrke i forskellighed. Vi bliver bedre af at bringe forskellige erfaringer, fagligheder og personligheder sammen. Derfor opfordrer vi til, at alle uanset baggrund sender en ansøgning. Vi vurderer dog, at der er nogle grundlæggende forudsætninger, som er vigtige for at lykkes i jobbet:


En kandidatgrad i forsikringsmatematik, matematik-økonomi, statistik eller tilsvarende
Ca. 1-3 års erfaring fra en tilsvarende stilling
Solide analytiske egenskaber
Professionelle mundtlige og skriftlige dansk- og engelskkundskaber
Kendskab til C# eller lignende objektorienteret sprog er ikke et krav, men det er en forudsætning at du har en grundlæggende interesse for objektorienteret programmering.


Sådan oplever en af dine nye kolleger afdelingenDu vil blive en del af et team på 5 fagligt dygtige medarbejdere. Vi er en lille afdeling med fokus på godt arbejdsklima og faglige udfordringer. Vi anvender primært C# som værktøj til vores modeller og analyser. Modellerne er lavet i state-of-the-art C# kode, så her vil du have mulighed for at udvikle et højt fagligt niveau. Vi bruger derudover Git og andre moderne værktøjer til vores arbejde. // Martin Rebild, Quantitative analyst

Plads til at være menneske – plads til at være digVelliv er to år i træk blevet kåret til at have branchens bedste medarbejderimage og har gennem flere år vundet prisen som Årets Pensionsselskab. Hos os bliver du mødt med åbne arme, og vi gør os umage for, at du kommer godt fra start og hurtigt falder til.

Du får en buddy, der hjælper dig i gang, og en leder, der bidrager med mening, udvikling og retning. Du har mulighed for at melde dig ind i ”Klub Velliv” og deltage i aktiviteter inden for sport, mad, hobby og kultur for os medarbejdere og vores børn. I det hele taget kan du forvente en kultur, hvor vi lever vores tre kerneværdier: Optimisme, Ordentlighed og Omsorg. I Velliv skal der være plads til at være menneske – plads til at være dig.

Vi holder samtaler løbende

Send dit CV og et par ord om dig selv og din baggrund i en kort ansøgning. Vi vil gerne høre fra dig senest den 26. januar, men vi holder samtaler løbende, så send gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, kan du kontakte Johannes Müller på telefon +45 25277479 eller johannes.m@velliv.dk.

Vil du lære Velliv bedre at kende? Læs mere her
Show more
HTML:
Bliv en del af vores team i Modellering & Innovation, hvor vi udvikler og driver komplekse modeller til præcise forsikringsberegninger og strategisk styring. Vær med til at forme fremtidens forsikringsløsninger.

Vi har bedt din kommende leder om at sætte ord på jobbet og opgaverneVores "kunder" er Aktuariatet, investerings- og finansafdelingerne samt ledelse og direktion. Modellering & Innovation, som er en del af Aktuar & Analyse i Velliv, har et mål om at blive set som en forretningspartner, der med dataindsigt, analytiske kompetencer og forretningsforståelse, bidrager med finansiel viden og understøtter Vellivs væsentlige beslutningsprocesser med fakta og analyser.

Dine primære opgaver bliver:

  • Videreudvikle og forfine teknisk fundament for hensættelsesmodeller og solvensmodel
  • Drift af solvens- og hensættelsesmodellerne
  • Rapportering på baggrund af ovenstående modeller.

Du har forudsætningerne og modet til mere

Der er styrke i forskellighed. Vi bliver bedre af at bringe forskellige erfaringer, fagligheder og personligheder sammen. Derfor opfordrer vi til, at alle uanset baggrund sender en ansøgning. Vi vurderer dog, at der er nogle grundlæggende forudsætninger, som er vigtige for at lykkes i jobbet:

  • En kandidatgrad i forsikringsmatematik, matematik-økonomi, statistik eller tilsvarende
  • Ca. 1-3 års erfaring fra en tilsvarende stilling
  • Solide analytiske egenskaber
  • Professionelle mundtlige og skriftlige dansk- og engelskkundskaber
  • Kendskab til C# eller lignende objektorienteret sprog er ikke et krav, men det er en forudsætning at du har en grundlæggende interesse for objektorienteret programmering.

Sådan oplever en af dine nye kolleger afdelingenDu vil blive en del af et team på 5 fagligt dygtige medarbejdere. Vi er en lille afdeling med fokus på godt arbejdsklima og faglige udfordringer. Vi anvender primært C# som værktøj til vores modeller og analyser. Modellerne er lavet i state-of-the-art C# kode, så her vil du have mulighed for at udvikle et højt fagligt niveau. Vi bruger derudover Git og andre moderne værktøjer til vores arbejde. // Martin Rebild, Quantitative analyst

Title: Market Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Maersk Offshore Wind is on a growth journey where we are scaling up our business and organization. Therefore, we are looking for a Market Intelligence Analyst analyzing, interpreting, and delivering market data and trends to form the basis for our business decisions.




We Offer




As our new Market Intelligence Analyst, you will be part of the Commercial team in Copenhagen and where you will be working closely with other team members, particularly our Regional Commercial Heads. We work hard and we have fun doing so. As a team, we see our different backgrounds and experiences as a source of strength. Our structure is lean and flat, and you will have significant independence to impact your role, as well as be expected to collaborate across disciplines.




We are owned by A.P. Moller Holding, operating independently with the trust and empowerment to do what is right for us, while proudly bearing the Maersk name and values.




The position will be based in our headquarters in Lyngby until March 2025 where we will move to a new office in Nordhavn. We offer various benefits, including a delicious breakfast and lunch, massage services, comprehensive health insurance, and, of course, a team of fantastic colleagues.




Key Responsibilities




As our Market Intelligence Analyst, you will be working with other members of our Commercial team in our HQ in Copenhagen and reporting to the Chief Commercial Officer. Travelling will to a limited extent be required to support the business. Your key responsibilities will be:




Being key responsible for market intelligence information and our overall market understanding. This involves market size, market shares, competitors and vessels and understanding how and why these shift over time.
Collecting and updating the yearly data gathering and analysis forming the basis for our global sales plan and regional strategies. This is a key deliverable during the first 6 months.
Developing data visualizations, dashboards, and other business intelligence tools, facilitating informed and data-driven decision-making processes.
Assessing quality and relevance of different databases and subscriptions.
Performing deep dive analyses on specific markets or product areas.




Who are we looking for?




You have preferably 2 – 5 years of experience from a similar position within the offshore wind B2B market. This experience has given you a good understanding of the offshore wind market as a whole and its business drivers.
You have excellent data management skills and talent to handle large data sets and integrations across different sources and platforms such as PowerBI, Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint.
You have strong analytical and data management skills and can translate metrics, research, and trends meaningfully into our sales and strategy context.
You have strong communication and writing skills in English that enable you to present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner and with a strong attention to detail.
You thrive in a dynamic work environment and are used to working independently, while at the same time being a team-player.




How to apply




If you can imagine yourself in this role, we look very much forward to hearing from you. Please apply through our website no later than 1st February 2025. We will review and interview on an ongoing basis we encourage you to apply sooner rather than later.




About Maersk Offshore Wind




Drawing on decades of maritime capabilities to operate large assets and execute complex offshore projects, Maersk Offshore Wind is committed to solving the energy challenges of tomorrow by providing innovative offshore wind installation services worldwide, supporting the rapid growth and development of the offshore wind industry. Maersk Offshore Wind is part of the A.P. Moller Group and headquartered in Denmark. Read more on our website: https://maerskoffshorewind.com/

Title: Junior System Engineer
Place: Sønderborg Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are rapidly growing our global business and we are looking for new colleagues.

Do you want to kick-start your career in system engineering in a company that develops systems to help keep people and society safe?

We are looking for Junior System Engineers to join our growing organization. You will become part of a large team of experienced and highly competent System Engineers where you will be able to learn from them and grow into the role as System Engineer.

Your role

As Junior System Engineer, you will interact with the other System Engineers and help with the technical part of projects. Based on customer requirements and internal design processes, you will plan the system design in close cooperation with other System Engineers. You will:


Participate in customer projects as part of the system engineering team
Support the team with requirement breakdown in our system
Participate in internal and external design and document reviews
Support the team with data collection in various parts of the organization
Support the team with collection of equipment data



Your profile

This opportunity requires a person who likes to learn and work with many stakeholders. The candidate we are looking for is a team player with initiative and interpersonal skills. You have a broad technical background and work in a structured way.

We expect you to hold a degree within engineering, computer science or a technical education with equivalent experience. This is a perfect opportunity for a recent graduated candidate.

We are in a global environment and therefore look for candi­dates with various backgrounds and experiences. We interact with each other and therefore need good communicators, who like to interact with stakeholders and who speak/write English.

What can you expect from us?

Saab Danmark is a company that is growing and you will therefore experience a company that is dynamic and able to adapt. In the Saab group we have a saying ”Business is done between people”, and this is also the environment you can expect here. We offer:


Initial learning process with mentorship and support
Good career and development opportunities in a professional company
A vibrant and international atmosphere with colleagues from all over the world
Benefits that support our employees’ wellbeing
A variety of social activities, lunch scheme, pension as well as flexible work conditions
Focus on our teams, good cooperation and giving our employees the ability to take ownership of their tasks.



As a condition of employment, candidates will be required to participate in a background investigation and/or successfully demonstrate eligibility to receive applicable government security clearance(s).

About Saab Danmark A/S

Saab in Denmark is part of the Saab Group with headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. At the same time, Saab Danmark is an independent legal company with a flat organizational structure. Our main area of business is delivering integrated communication solutions to civil and military markets at home and abroad.

You can find further information about our integrated communication solution TactiCall on www.saab.com/naval.

Workplace

Saab Danmark A/S

Porten 6-8

6400 Sønderborg

________________________

Application

As we interview candidates continuously, send in your application now.

________________________

Contact regarding the job content

hr@dk.saabgroup.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
DATA ENGINEER 

Data is an incredibly important asset to our organisation, and now is your chance to join our digital business transformation and contribute to shaping the future of data in Lind Capital. 




Who we are 

At Lind Capital, we take a different approach to trading. We're a team of 20+ market specialists and analytical thinkers who collaborate to combine technical expertise with market understanding. With no external investors, we are free to focus on making the best possible trades using quantitative models. 




Data in Lind Capital 

Data is central to Lind Capital’s success and key to our future growth, and therefore we are looking to expand our resources within the area. You become part of our international technology team which currently consists of 8 software engineers, data engineers and data scientists. On a daily basis, you will be working in one of our cross-functional squads of professionals who enjoy solving complex problems together in our effort to advance on our tech and data journey. 




The job 

The main tasks of your team are to develop and maintain solutions solving complex business problems by utilizing vast amounts of structured and unstructured data. As our new Data Engineer, you will play an important role in preparing and serving data for both trading applications, analytics and our machine learning models. Also, you will play an important role in the development of data solutions and data usage at large.  

If you are skilled and motivated to build solutions to bring raw data into actionable output, you will be able to make a big impact in our organization.  

More specifically, your tasks will include: 

Collaborate closely with data scientists, software and ML engineers in a cross-functional setting identifying and facilitating both analytics and ML requirements for data
Design, develop and maintain batch and streaming data pipelines from end-to-end.  
Enable both batch and live serving of data for applications, analytics and ML models. 
Build data quality monitoring tools and improving pipeline observability. 
Develop our data management framework. 
Build and maintain our infrastructure in AWS using infrastructure-as-code tools.  
Contribute to our data strategy and promote good engineering practices.  




You make the difference 

Technical capabilities are required, but personality makes the difference. We aim for a cooperative work environment with a high level of knowledge sharing. A work environment where everybody assumes personal responsibility, and where teamwork and communication skills are essential. 

The trading strategies we pursue are all based on a complex combination of tech, data, numbers, and market know-how. This means your ability to go beyond your comfort zone and engage with experts in other areas is paramount to our success. 

You are a team player and have an open-minded attitude. You can communicate ideas and technical topics honestly and clearly – also to non-experts – while respecting the views of others on the team. You are eager to understand and find solutions, allowing you to quickly adapt to changing situations and come up with new ideas.  

We're looking for someone who brings: 

Clean and efficient Python code (experience with other programming languages is a plus). 
Practical experience in creating and maintaining data intensive solutions from a similar role. 
Experience with orchestration frameworks like Apache Airflow. 
Experience with containerization frameworks like Docker. 
Experience with SQL and NoSQL DBMS for both transactional and analytical workloads. 
Experience with Big-data solutions for distributed storage and computing like Hadoop or Spark. 
Familiarity with cloud providers (preferably AWS), time series data, CI/CD pipelines, GIT and/or infrastructure as code.  




We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all the listed qualifications. 




Life at the office 

We bring together talented people from diverse backgrounds. You will become part of an informal and diverse work environment where we focus on creating results together, and where you will be empowered to make decisions. We generally dislike meetings, PowerPoints, politics, and committees, but prefer to look at the code or the chart together over the screen for a few minutes and make the decisions there and then. 

We value work-life balance and support our team members' personal and professional commitments. While our dynamic work environment may require additional work hours, we ensure flexibility works both ways - whether you need time for personal appointments, family responsibilities, or other important life events. Our focus is on results and impact rather than rigid schedules. 




The practical stuff 

This position is based in Aarhus, Denmark. We operate in English and welcome international candidates. 

Start date: As soon as possible. 

To apply, please submit your CV and motivation letter. 

Applications will be processed on a rolling basis.

  • Contribute to our data strategy and promote good engineering practices.  


You make the difference 

Technical capabilities are required, but personality makes the difference. We aim for a cooperative work environment with a high level of knowledge sharing. A work environment where everybody assumes personal responsibility, and where teamwork and communication skills are essential. 

The trading strategies we pursue are all based on a complex combination of tech, data, numbers, and market know-how. This means your ability to go beyond your comfort zone and engage with experts in other areas is paramount to our success. 

You are a team player and have an open-minded attitude. You can communicate ideas and technical topics honestly and clearly – also to non-experts – while respecting the views of others on the team. You are eager to understand and find solutions, allowing you to quickly adapt to changing situations and come up with new ideas.  

We're looking for someone who brings: 

  • Clean and efficient Python code (experience with other programming languages is a plus). 
  • Practical experience in creating and maintaining data intensive solutions from a similar role. 
  • Experience with orchestration frameworks like Apache Airflow. 
  • Experience with containerization frameworks like Docker. 
  • Experience with SQL and NoSQL DBMS for both transactional and analytical workloads. 
  • Experience with Big-data solutions for distributed storage and computing like Hadoop or Spark. 
  • Familiarity with cloud providers (preferably AWS), time series data, CI/CD pipelines, GIT and/or infrastructure as code.  


We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all the listed qualifications. 


Life at the office 

We bring together talented people from diverse backgrounds. You will become part of an informal and diverse work environment where we focus on creating results together, and where you will be empowered to make decisions. We generally dislike meetings, PowerPoints, politics, and committees, but prefer to look at the code or the chart together over the screen for a few minutes and make the decisions there and then. 

We value work-life balance and support our team members' personal and professional commitments. While our dynamic work environment may require additional work hours, we ensure flexibility works both ways - whether you need time for personal appointments, family responsibilities, or other important life events. Our focus is on results and impact rather than rigid schedules. 


The practical stuff 

This position is based in Aarhus, Denmark. We operate in English and welcome international candidates. 

Start date: As soon as possible. 

To apply, please submit your CV and motivation letter. 

Applications will be processed on a rolling basis.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented, curious, and data-driven problem solver who wants to build up and maintain a Data Platform for reporting and analytics in a fast-growing FinTech company? Then you might be the one we are looking for.




Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 600 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide, who are all passionate about creating next-generation mission-critical financial services infrastructure and leading the rise of a super-correspondent banking network.




About the role

We are looking to hire a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team in Copenhagen, reporting to the Data Engineering Team Lead.




In this role you will get the chance to work on building and maintaining our next generation Data Platform in Azure. The Data Engineering team owns Banking Circle’s Data Platform, which is closely coupled to our payment processing system. Our tech stack includes Python, Terraform, Microsoft Azure cloud ecosystem, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Power BI. Furthermore, we also use Databricks SQL warehouses and Astronomer/Airflow to orchestrate our processing pipelines.




What you will be doing

Build and maintain our Data Platform in collaboration with peers
Advocate for software architecture patterns, efficient data processing, modern data integration, and solid data modelling
Collaborate in the continual analysis of project requirements in collaboration with teams across the organization
Participate in Agile team rituals (stand-up, planning, and retrospective)
Contribute to continuous improvements of the team’s way of working
Take responsibility for own learning and development




What we are looking for

To be the right candidate for this position, we expect you to have an educational background within computer science, software engineering, or other related fields, with a bachelor's degree as a minimum. We expect you to have 3+ years of relevant work experience within pipelines, infrastructure, or the platform world, including strong Python skills. Furthermore, it is a big advantage if you have experience within Microsoft Azure cloud.




As a person we expect you to be open-minded, and willing to learn and further expand your existing experience in Data Engineering. You are curious, communicative, and able to work well on your own as well in a team.




As Banking Circle is an international company it´s a requirement, that you are fluent in English.




What we offer you

We offer a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity, however we do also expect you to spend time in the office on a regular basis to build community and efficiency in the team. Furthermore, we offer a competitive salary and a generous benefit package, opportunities for continuous learning, development, and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.




Would you like to join us?

We will be conducting interviews continuously; therefore, we urge interested candidates to apply online as soon as possible. Please note that we do not accept applications by email. If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Kheira Nougal, Global Recruitment Partner on khno@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.




Who we are

Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world’s clearing systems – enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.
